user_input: 本文中膝踝外骨骼在哪些日常活动中表现出助力效果？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n16  circuit recommended in the Tekscan data sheet [Tekscan, 2020]. This circuit also has the additional function of linearizing the non-linear resistance-force relationship. Finally, MyRIO software is used to calibrate the sensors before each experiment to achieve a final readout normalized to body weight.  2.2.3 Human Subject Experiment Methodology  The human subject experiment was designed to demonstrate the potential benefit of the knee-ankle exoskeleton during multiple, common ADLs. These tasks were: sit to stand, stand to sit, treadmill walking, and stair climbing. The primary aim of the experiment was to show a reduction in effort of the muscles related to the joints assisted by Comex 1. We assessed activation levels of the following muscles: vastus medialis oblique (VMO), biceps femoris (BF), tibialis anterior (TA), and soleus (SOL), which function as a knee extensor, knee flexor, dorsi-flexor, and plantar-flexor respectively. A single, male human subject (mass: 80 kg, height: 1.78 m) was enrolled for the study, which was approved by the Institutional Review Board at the University of Texas at Dallas and the University of Michigan.\n']
response: 本文中膝踝外骨骼在坐到站、站到坐、跑步机行走和楼梯攀爬这四种日常活动中表现出助力效果。
reference: 本文中膝踝外骨骼在以下日常活动中表现出助力效果：坐到站、站到坐、跑步机行走和爬楼梯。通过评估肌肉激活水平（VMO、BF、TA、SOL）验证其助力作用。

user_input: 自适应阻抗控制如何提升外骨骼系统在非结构化环境中的动态响应性能？
retrieved_contexts: ['\namong the devices. Both MTx and BioStampRC detected significantly distinct gait charac- teristics between PwMS with different disability levels (p<0.01).  Conclusion  BioStampRC sensors accurately and precisely measure gait parameters in PwMS across diverse walking impairment levels and detected differences in gait characteristics by disabil- ity level in PwMS. This technology has the potential to provide granular monitoring of gait both inside and outside the clinic.  1. Introduction  Multiple sclerosis (MS) is an immune-mediated disease that affects an estimated 400,000 peo- ple in the USA, and has a worldwide prevalence of 2.5M [1]. MS is characterized by inflamma- tory demyelination and axonal damage in the central nervous system, which result in conduction delays and blockage of electrical potentials along neuronal pathways [2]. The MS pathology transitions into a neurodegenerative disease process associated with insufficient neurotrophic support resulting in irreversible axonal and neuronal loss [3]. This progressive disease commonly affects mobility (i.e. gait function) [4]. Gait impairment in persons with MS (PwMS) has been identified by altered spatio-temporal gait parameters such as slower gait speed, reduced cadence, shorter step length, prolonged stride time and increased double sup- port period [5, 6]. Therefore, accurate assessment of gait characteristics in PwMS is required to examine the severity and progression of gait impairment.  Gait assessment in PwMS has relied on analysis in gait laboratories, with specialized equip-  ment including expensive motion capture systems, pressure sensitive walkways, and force- plates [7]. Clinicians also utilize objective performance based measures (e.g. timed-25 foot walk (T25W)), 6 minute walk test (6MW) [8], and subjective functional ambulation tests (e.g. Performance-Oriented mobility assessment, Dynamic Gait Index)) [8, 9] to assess gait func- tion. However, all of these clinical assessments only provide a ‘snapshot’ of an individual’s walking ability that may not extrapolate to typical gait performance under normal daily conditions.\n']

user_input: 基于Cleveland Clinic约定的逆动力学计算中，反射标记物的布置部位包括哪些关键下肢解剖位置？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nfirst peak—associated with knee extension—was overridden by the extension signal.  experimental Protocol Ten able-bodied subjects [five males/five females, weight: 67.6 kg (8.8 SD)] gave written informed consent to participate and have their data published for the following experiment that had been approved by the University of Michigan Institutional Review Board. The experimenters located the following nine EMG elec- trode locations on the lower limbs of each subject: (1) right rectus femoris, (2) right gluteus maximus, (3) left rectus femoris, (4) left gluteus maximus, (5) left sartorius, (6) left medial hamstring, (7) left medial gastrocnemius, (8) left soleus, and (9) left tibialis anterior. The rectus femoris and gluteus maximus locations were control sites while the other six EMG locations were solely for the purpose of understanding changes in lower limb muscle activ- ity during the experiment. The experimenters placed reflective markers along the lower limb for inverse dynamics calculations based on the Cleveland Clinic convention [Heisenberg, (date unknown)]. These marker locations included the feet, shank, knee, thigh, hip, and pelvis. We fit subjects to the exoskeleton using adjustable shoulder, waist, and thigh straps. The complete experimental setup with the different measurements that were made is shown in Figure 4.\n']
response: 在基于Cleveland Clinic约定的逆动力学计算中，反射标记物的布置部位包括脚部（feet）、小腿（shank）、膝关节（knee）、大腿（thigh）、髋关节（hip）和骨盆（pelvis）。
reference: 基于Cleveland Clinic约定的逆动力学计算中，反射标记物的布置部位包括以下关键下肢解剖位置：足部（feet）、小腿（shank）、膝部（knee）、大腿（thigh）、髋部（hip）和骨盆（pelvis）。

user_input: 本文为何仅选用一名健康受试者进行实验？其理论依据是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n2.6. Experimental Methods The purpose of experiments in this study was to quantify not the human reaction but the torque tracking performance of various hardware and control conditions, the relative performance of torque tracking under diﬀerent desired and passive stiﬀness conditions for the same subjects. In theoretical analysis, we conjected that the subject does not aﬀect the relative relationship between desired/passive stiﬀness and tracking performance, but only the absolute values of the optimal control gains, and optimal tracking errors with a maximum tolerable exoskeleton control bandwidth (torque tracking rate). If this conjecture, together with the resulting hypotheses, is validated by single-subject experiments, then there is no need to testmultiplesubjectsfortheproofoftherelativeperoformanceof diﬀerent desired and passive stiﬀness values, which is unaﬀected by the subjects. If the conjecture and hypotheses do not even agreewithsingle-sugjectexperiments,thereisnomeaningtesting more subjects. Therefore, only one healthy subject (N = 1, female, 32 years, 1.65 m, 56 kg) was involved. The subject walked on a treadmill with a ﬁxed speed of 1.25 m/s with a self-paced step frequency while wearing the tethered ankle exoskeleton on the right leg in all experiments. All experimental protocols were approved by Carnegie Mellon University IRB.  in detail,  For the ease of readability, this paper uses Newton-meter, degree and meter as the corresponding units for measurements of torque, angle and distance.  December 2017 | Volume 11 | Article 68  Zhang and Collins  2.6.1. Desired Torque-Angle Curves and Evaluation of Their Desired Stiffness Values To test the hypotheses, eight desired quasi-stiﬀnesses, i.e., torque vs. ankle angle relationship, were implemented, including three linearandﬁvepiece-wiselinearcurves.Aunitlinearcurve(S = 1 in Equation 7) was deﬁned by parameter values in Table 1. The three linear curves, L1, L2 and L3, were achieved by scaling the unit curve on the desired torque axis with factors of 0.4, 1, and 1.7 respectively. On the other hand, a unit piece-wise linear curve (S = 1 in Equation 8) was deﬁned by the parameter values listed in Table 2. Five piece-wise linear curves, P1, P2, P3, P4 and P5, were then achieved by scaling the unit curve with factors 0.4, 0.7, 1, 1.3, and 1.7. The resulting desired torque vs. ankle angle curves are shown in Figure 3.\n']
response: 本文仅选用一名健康受试者进行实验，因其理论依据是：受试者不会影响期望刚度与跟踪性能之间的相对关系，仅影响最优控制参数的绝对值；若该关系在单个受试者实验中被验证，则无需进一步测试多个受试者以确认相对性能的普遍性。
reference: 本文选用一名健康受试者进行实验的理论依据是：研究关注的是外骨骼在不同期望与被动刚度条件下的扭矩跟踪性能相对关系，而非个体间差异。作者假设受试者不会影响这种相对关系，仅影响控制参数和误差的绝对值。因此，若单受试者实验能验证理论假设，则无需扩展至更多受试者；若无法验证，则扩大样本无意义。该设计节省了实验资源并聚焦于硬件与控制性能的核心问题。

user_input: 文中提到的肌电信号控制相比生物髋关节扭矩控制在代谢成本和肌肉活动减少方面有何优势？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nCorrespondence: Aaron J. Young aaron.young@me.gatech.edu  Specialty section: This article was submitted to Bionics and Biomimetics, a section of the journal Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology  results: Compared to unassisted walking in the exoskeleton, myoelectric control sig- nificantly reduced metabolic cost by 13% (p = 0.005) and biological hip torque control reduced metabolic cost by 7% (p = 0.261). Subjects reduced muscle activity relative to the unpowered condition for a greater number of lower limb muscles using myoelectric control compared to the biological hip torque control. More subjects subjectively pre- ferred the myoelectric controller to the biological hip torque control.  Received: 08 July 2016 Accepted: 06 June 2017 Published: 30 June 2017  Citation: Young AJ, Gannon H and Ferris DP (2017) A Biomechanical Comparison of Proportional Electromyography Control to Biological Torque Control Using a Powered Hip Exoskeleton. Front. Bioeng. Biotechnol. 5:37. doi: 10.3389/fbioe.2017.00037  conclusion: Myoelectric control had more advantages (metabolic cost and muscle activity reduction) compared to a controller that targeted a biological torque profile for walking with a robotic hip exoskeleton. However, these results were obtained with a single exoskeleton device with specific control configurations while level walking at a single speed. Further testing on different exoskeleton hardware and with more varied experimental protocols, such as testing over multiple types of terrain, is needed to fully elucidate the potential benefits of myoelectric control for exoskeleton technology.  Keywords: robotic exoskeleton, powered orthosis, electromyography control, biomechanics of human walking, metabolic cost, exoskeleton control  Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology | www.frontiersin.org  1  June 2017 | Volume 5 | Article 37  Young et al.  inTrODUcTiOn\n']
response: 肌电信号控制相比生物髋关节扭矩控制在代谢成本和肌肉活动减少方面具有显著优势：代谢成本减少了13%（p = 0.005），肌肉活动减少的肌肉数量更多，且受试者主观偏好更高。这些结果表明肌电信号控制在提升穿戴者效率和舒适性方面更具优势。
reference: 肌电信号控制相比于生物髋关节扭矩控制在代谢成本和肌肉活动减少方面具有以下优势：首先，在代谢成本方面，肌电信号控制可显著降低13%（p = 0.005），而生物髋关节扭矩控制仅降低7%（p = 0.261）；其次，在肌肉活动减少方面，肌电信号控制使更多下肢肌肉的活动降低。这些结果表明，肌电信号控制在提升能量效率和减少肌肉负荷方面更具优势。

Further experiments on electromechanical systems would be necessary to verify these conclusions.  Numerous industry and research groups are designing exo- skeletons that include actuated hip joints (Arazpour et al., 2014; Farris et al., 2014; Giovacchini et al., 2014; Asbeck et al., 2015). The findings of this study are useful to help designers to properly time exoskeleton assistance to reduce the metabolic cost of walk- ing. This includes applications for military use, industrial grade exoskeletons, and medical exoskeletons for disabled or elderly individuals. Studies on the effects on biomechanics and metabolic cost of human subjects wearing exoskeletons are necessary to help progress the field (Ferris, 2009). Numerous market predictions  Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology | www.frontiersin.org  9  March 2017 | Volume 5 | Article 4  Young et al.  are forecasting that the exoskeleton market will grow exponen- tially within the next 5 years from current market of $16.5–$2.1 billion (Austin, 2015). Exoskeleton controllers and hardware will need significant advancement to achieve this ambitious goal, and human subject studies with exoskeletons such as this one will provide a critical and necessary element in validating the utility of exoskeleton technology.  manuscript. response: 本文指出自适应控制策略在减少步行代谢成本、辅助步态以及军事、工业和医疗应用中具有潜在应用价值，尤其适用于气动或液压系统；然而，其在电磁机械系统的适用性尚需进一步实验验证。
reference: 自适应控制策略在以下应用场景中具有潜在应用价值：军事用途、工业级外骨骼以及面向残疾或老年人的医疗外骨骼，尤其在优化外骨骼辅助时机以降低步行代谢成本方面。该策略主要适用于气动或液压系统，也可能适用于机电系统，但需进一步实验验证。此外，人体实验对于验证这些控制策略在实际应用中的有效性至关重要。

Similar results have been reported in conventional treadmill studies with or without the partial weight support (19, 20, 48, 49). In these studies, a physical therapist assisted the child with manual corrections and verbal instructions, which led to improvements in walking (48). Instead of a physical ther- apist assisting in walking straight, TPAD can provide a robotic en- vironment for the children to strengthen extensor muscles compared with ordinary walking. This device can potentially reduce the effort and labor of the physical therapists so that they can focus on higher-level management, dosage, and monitoring of the patients.  Walk test showed improvements. Six Minute Walk test is a self-paced, submaximal test that assesses functional capacity for walking over a prolonged distance (53, 54). It reflects exercise tolerance and endur- ance required for the performance of active daily living (54). Here, we asked children to walk within a submaximal environment, by aug- menting weight, for longer than 6 min. We think that the training effect of the present study is better estimated by the Six Minute Walk test that is more analogous to the task in the TPAD training, rather than BBS or TUG tests.\n']
response: 自适应阻抗控制通过融合运动捕捉、负载力与电缆速度等多源信息，结合前馈补偿与自适应律机制，在线调节外骨骼系统的刚度与阻尼参数，从而实现对人机交互动态力的实时响应与自适应调节。
reference: 自适应阻抗控制通过高阶与低阶控制器协同、前馈补偿、张力规划及反馈机制实现人机协同中的动态力调节。系统根据用户运动状态实时调整缆索张力与电机输出，利用负载单元与弹簧测量交互力，结合期望张力指令实现闭环控制，确保在不同运动模式（如拉/推）下动态响应用户意图。

Then a secondary FSM was used to select between parameter sets based on the estimated incline ˆγ. To prevent rapid switching between parameters at the boundaries, overlap was included in the switching thresholds (Fig. 13b). response: 表IV中不同基线任务下的阻抗参数变化趋势表明，外骨骼系统能够根据任务需求动态调整刚度（K）、阻尼（B）和等效相位角（θeq），实现对平地、上坡和下坡地形的适应性控制。平地任务中系统维持较低能量消耗，上坡任务中降低刚度以减少能耗并增强稳定性，下坡任务中则增加刚度以提升控制能力。
reference: 表IV中的阻抗参数（K、B、θeq）在不同基线任务下呈现显著变化趋势，反映了基于有限状态机的控制策略（FSMC）具备地形适应性和任务特异性调节能力。踝关节和膝关节的刚度（K）和阻尼（B）随行走任务（平地、上坡、下坡）而调整，θeq也相应变化以匹配所需步态模式，从而实现控制系统的动态稳定与能量效率优化。

response: 自适应阻抗控制通过实时感知用户的步态参数（如关节角度、步长-步频变异性等）并结合反馈控制策略调整外骨骼的支撑力与阻抗特性，从而实现动态步态适应。该方法依赖惯性测量单元（IMUs）和微型陀螺仪等传感器获取运动学数据，结合文献中关于MS患者步态时间变异性与空间参数的研究，构建自适应控制模型，以实现人机协同中的自然步态协调与安全性。

user_input: 文中使用代谢分析系统测量了哪些生理参数来评估外骨骼的辅助效果？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nExperimental testing was done on a single day. Subjects stood in the exoskeleton for 3 min while we measured oxygen consump- tion and carbon dioxide production using a metabolic analysis system (Oxycon Mobile, CareFusion). The subjects walked at 1.0 m/s to simulate a medium to low walking speed on a split belt-instrumented treadmill (Bertec) to measure their ground reaction forces. The order of the two powered conditions was randomized such that five subjects performed the state machine controller first and five subjects performed the EMG controller first. During the first 5 min of walking, subjects acclimated to walking with an exoskeleton as the experimenter slowly increased the amount of power supplied to maximum levels. Subject specific tuning parameters were set during this phase. For EMG control, the subject tuning parameters were the gains and thresholds for each of the four control muscles. For state machine controller, only the maximum hip flexion angle, the neutral hip flexion angle (measured during standing), and the peak weight were used as subject specific parameters for the controller. After the initial 5-min adjustment period, subjects walked for 30 min in each of the powered conditions while we measured their metabolic expenditure rate. In between the two powered conditions, sub- jects walked for 10 min with the unpowered exoskeleton while we measured their metabolic expenditure rate to have a baseline for comparison. Movie demonstrations of both controllers are available in Video S1 in Supplementary Material.  At the end of the experiment, subjects were verbally asked the following series of questions, and their responses were recorded. (1) Which controller (the first one or the second one) did you prefer to walk with? (2) Did you find the first controller to be overall helpful or not helpful for aiding your walking move- ments? Use the unpowered condition as reference. (3) Did you find the second controller to be overall helpful or not helpful for aiding your walking movements? (4) What were your general  Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology | www.frontiersin.org  5  June 2017 | Volume 5 | Article 37  Young et al.\n']
response: 文中使用代谢分析系统测量了氧气消耗（oxygen consumption）和二氧化碳产生（carbon dioxide production）作为评估外骨骼辅助效果的生理参数。
reference: 文中使用代谢分析系统测量了氧气消耗（oxygen consumption）、二氧化碳产生（carbon dioxide production）以及代谢消耗率（metabolic expenditure rate）来评估外骨骼在不同控制策略下的辅助效果。

response: 文中假设的最优比例增益与被动刚度值之间存在反比例关系，这种关系对扭矩误差变化率具有依赖性：当扭矩误差变化率被限制在一个固定最大值以内时，比例增益与被动刚度才表现出这一反比例关系。
reference: 文中假设最优比例增益与被动刚度值之间存在反比关系，该关系依赖于一个固定的可接受最大扭矩误差变化率。在期望曲线固定的前提下，该误差变化率约束导致比例增益随被动刚度增加而减小，以维持最佳扭矩跟踪性能。

user_input: 与传统刚性外骨骼相比，文中所述的生物启发式软体外骨骼在行走辅助中体现出哪些设计优势？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n.IEEE,2013.[21]T.Kawamura,K.Takanaka,T.Nakamura,andH.Osumi,“Develop-mentofanorthosisforwalkingassistanceusingpneumaticartiﬁcialmuscle:Aquantitativeassessmentoftheeffectofassistance,”inRe-habilitationRobotics(ICORR),2013IEEEInternationalConferenceon.IEEE,2013,pp.1–6.[22]Y.Ding,I.Galiana,A.Asbeck,B.Quinlivan,S.M.M.DeRossi,andC.Walsh,“Multi-jointactuationplatformforlowerextremitysoftexosuits,”inRoboticsandAutomation,2014.Proceedings.ICRA’14.IEEEInternationalConferenceon.IEEE,2014,pp.1327–1334.[23]A.T.Asbeck,S.M.M.DeRossi,I.Galiana,Y.Ding,andC.J.Walsh,“Anatomyofasoftexosuittoassistlocomotion,”ToappearinRoboticsandAutomationMagazine,IEEE,2014.[24]A.T.Asbeck,S.M.M.DeRossi,K.G.Holt,andC.J.Walsh,“Abiologically-inspiredsoftexosuitforwalkingassistance,”InternationalJournalofRoboticsResearch,2015.[Online].Available:http://dx.doi.org/10.1177/0278364914562476[25]J.PerryandJ.Burnﬁeld,Gaitanalysis:normalandpathologicalfunction,2nded.SLACKIncorporated,2010.[26]C.L.LewisandD.P.Ferris,“Invarianthipmomentpatternwhilewalkingwitharobotichipexoskeleton,”Journalofbiomechanics,vol.44,no.5,pp.789–793,2011.[27]P.-C.Kao,C.L.Lewis,andD.P.Ferris,“Invariantanklemomentpatternswhenwalkingwithandwithoutaroboticankleexoskeleton,”Journalofbiomechanics,vol.43,no.2,pp.203–209,2010.\n']
response: 与传统刚性外骨骼相比，文中所述的生物启发式软体外骨骼在行走辅助中展现出的显著设计优势包括：仿生结构提升自然运动适应性、柔性材料增强穿戴舒适性、维持人体生物力学对称性与髋关节力矩不变、提升人机交互适应性与能量利用效率。
reference: 与传统刚性外骨骼相比，文中所述的生物启发式软体外骨骼在行走辅助中体现出以下设计优势：采用柔性材料和气动人工肌肉等驱动方式，更贴合人体自然运动特性；通过多关节协同驱动平台实现对下肢多自由度的支持，同时保持自然步态；其柔顺特性有助于维持髋关节和踝关节的自然力矩模式，提升穿戴舒适性与运动协调性。

user_input: 髋部肌群力量减弱与膝关节和髋关节OA进展之间存在怎样的关联？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nWeak lower-limb musculature is a significant contributor to the risk of OA, especially at the knee, which represents over 80% of the total burden of the disease [Vos et al., 2012]. The medial and lateral tibiofemoral joint (TFJ) and patella-femoral joint (PFJ) form the three compartments of the knee (and three potential regions for OA). Several studies support the theory of quadriceps weakness being a significant contributing risk factor towards knee OA progression in all three compartments. In [Amin et al., 2009] , it was found that greater quadriceps muscle strength pre- vented cartilage loss at the PFJ. Additionally these patients presented with less knee pain compared to controls. A proposed theory is that the medial and lateral quadriceps are uneven in strength and cause misalignment of the PFJ [Amin et al., 2009], which can increase pain during loading. This correlation between quadriceps weakness and knee pain was also found for TFJ OA [O’Reilly et al., 1998]. It is known that the quadriceps act as a shock absorbing mechanism during the gait cycle [de Oliveira Silva et al., 2015]. Weak quadriceps can therefore lead to knee instability and greater loading at the articular surfaces, increasing the risk for TFJ OA progression. There is also growing evidence that hip musculature has influence on the progression of both knee and hip OA. Preliminary findings show decreased hip extension, external rotation and abduction weakness in patients with knee OA compared to healthy adults [Deasy et al., 2016]. A similar correlation between weakened hip muscles and hip OA progression has been found [Amaro et al., 2007]. Im- portantly, the compensatory mechanisms of unilateral hip OA can lead to contralateral hip OA [Amaro et al., 2007] as well as contralateral knee OA [Shakoor et al., 2003]. Therefore, modular orthoses that can provide assistive torques at the knee and hip joints during daily tasks can com- pensate for weakness in quadriceps and hip musculature and mitigate the symptoms of knee and possibly hip OA. Instead of assisting musculature, current knee OA orthoses unload the medial or lateral knee joint space through the mechanical structure of the brace. These knee orthoses have shown pain reduction and functional improvement [Pollo et al., 2002] but they do not address pain associated with the patellofemoral joint (PFJ) compartment–most likely because they do not re- duce patellofemoral loads caused by the action of the quadriceps\n']
response: 髋部肌群力量减弱与膝关节和髋关节OA进展之间存在相互关联，主要通过步态代偿、关节不对称负荷和代偿性关节损伤机制实现。髋部肌群无力可导致髋关节和膝关节负荷失衡，进而促进OA进展，尤其在膝关节的PFJ和TFJ区域。髋部与膝部在OA发病机制中存在协同作用，髋部肌群减弱可能引发对侧髋或膝关节OA，但其在膝关节OA中的独立作用尚需进一步研究。
reference: 髋部肌群力量减弱与膝关节和髋关节OA进展之间存在双向关联：一方面，髋部肌群无力可能通过导致步态不稳定、关节对齐异常和负荷分布失衡，间接促进膝关节OA在胫股关节（TFJ）和髌股关节（PFJ）的进展；另一方面，髋部肌群力量减弱本身也是髋关节OA进展的潜在风险因素，且可能通过代偿机制引发对侧膝关节OA。这些机制表明，髋部肌群在下肢OA的病理过程中具有重要影响。

user_input: 在模拟典型时间试验中，外骨骼是否有助于参与者保持更好的深蹲姿势，其评估指标是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe study comprised two sessions: fatiguing and non-fatiguing. Fatigue is inevitable and causes deleterious symptoms of reduced performance and increased risk of injury [National Safety Council, 2018; Zhang et al., 2015; CCOHS, 2019]. Accordingly, performance on a time trial is one of the classical measures of fatigue [Enoka and Duchateau, 2016]. Session 1 tested the hy- pothesis that the exoskeleton improves fatigued LL performance (time trial of 10 fatigued LL reps) compared to no exoskeleton (bare), when squatting posture is enforced. Participants performed repeated squat LL until fatigue-induced failure (without power in the exoskeleton condition), im- mediately followed by 10 timed squat LL cycles (with power in the exoskeleton condition). Partici- pants were instructed to take the minimum required pause between repetitions in order to complete the next repetition with good squat posture, emulating a typical time trial while ensuring safe pos- ture. Although squatting posture was an experimental control, we performed an exploratory anal- ysis of peak thorax lean to see if the exoskeleton helped participants maintain a better squat form. Session 1 also gathered qualitative subjective feedback of exoskeleton effectiveness in post-fatigue multi-terrain LLC. At least one week later, session 2 tested the hypothesis that the exoskeleton reduces quadriceps effort during multi-terrain LLC in a non-fatigued state. A recent study simi- larly investigated back exoskeleton-induced improvements in worker performance with time trials of various activities [Luger et al., 2023], along with assessing muscular, postural, and perceptual benefits.  61\n']
response: 在模拟典型时间试验中，外骨骼可能有助于参与者维持更优的深蹲姿势，其评估指标包括峰值胸段前倾角度以及通过主观反馈评估的姿势控制质量。
reference: 在模拟典型时间试验中，外骨骼有助于参与者保持更好的深蹲姿势，评估指标为峰值胸段前倾角（peak thorax lean），该指标用于量化姿势控制的稳定性。

reference: 自适应助力控制算法通过提供有效的膝关节辅助降低了使用者在蹲下运动中的代谢能量消耗，其效果与现有的重力补偿、振荡器和位置控制方法相当，但文献中未提供该算法具体如何优化能量消耗的详细机制。

response: 在贝叶斯近似推断框架下，后验概率分布 $ P(f|D) $ 被近似为高斯分布的方式是通过构造一个以最大后验估计（MAP） $ f_{MAP} $ 为中心，协方差矩阵为 $ H^{-1} $ 的高斯分布。具体而言，该近似基于 MAP 的梯度 $ g = \nabla f \ln P(f|D) $ 为零的条件，使得 $ P(f|D) \approx N(f_{MAP}, H^{-1}) $。该方法依赖于计算 MAP、梯度 $ g $ 和 Hessian 矩阵 $ H = K^{-1} + C $，从而实现对复杂后验分布的高效近似。
reference: 在贝叶斯近似推断框架下，后验概率分布 $ P(f|D) $ 被近似为高斯分布的过程如下：首先利用最大后验估计 $ f_{MAP} $ 作为展开点，在该点处对数后验的梯度消失；接着在 $ f_{MAP} $ 处对 $ \ln P(f|D) $ 进行二阶泰勒展开，忽略高阶项；由此得到指数形式的近似后验表达式，最终等价于一个以 $ f_{MAP} $ 为均值、$ H^{-1} $ 为协方差矩阵的高斯分布，即 $ P(f|D) \approx \mathcal{N}(f_{MAP}, H^{-1}) $，其中 $ H $ 为负的对数后验海森矩阵。

Similar to zero-order hold, a parallel thread was created to read vGRF continuously at ∼ 55 Hz, which gave the latest vGRF every 0.02 s and avoided slowing down the main control loop at 200 Hz. The sensor was calibrated using a predefined calibration procedure before each use to achieve a final readout normalized to body weight in the same manner as the vGRFs from the normative dataset used for the controller simulation. An infinite impulse response (IIR) second-order low-pass filter (50 Hz cutoff frequency) was applied to the vGRF for noise reduction purposes.  Safety features such as mechanical hard stops, thermal protectors, software program interven- tions, and current limiters were present at all joints. We also implemented a motor current limiting policy to prevent overheating the motor windings.  3.6.2 Experimental Protocol: Study 2  The study was approved by the Institutional Review Board at the University of Michigan (HUM00164931). We enrolled eight able-bodied (AB) human subjects (see Table 3.1) to demonstrate the ability of M-BLUE with M-TOES to assist multiple tasks. We assessed muscle activation via wireless EMG (Delsys Inc.) of vastus medialis oblique (VMO), rectus femoris (RF), biceps femoris (BF), and glu- teus maximus (GLUT), which function as a knee extensor, knee extensor/hip flexor, knee flexor, hip extensor, respectively. We used low-profile neonatal sensors for VMO, RF, and BF. One trial consists of Part 1 (P1) and Part 2 (P2).  34  F 58\n']
response: 通过自适应阻抗控制实现人机协同步态调节，需基于实时感知的垂直地面反作用力（vGRF）和肌电信号（EMG）等人体反馈信息，构建闭环控制回路，动态调整外骨骼的阻抗参数（如刚度与阻尼），从而实现与人体运动意图的同步与协调。尽管参考文本未直接描述具体控制算法，但其涉及的vGRF测量与EMG信号分析为该方法的可行性提供了基础。

response: 低占空比在外骨骼电机中允许扩展暂态操作空间，从而在短时高扭矩需求场景中提升性能；但同时也可能限制整体系统效率，需在电机设计中权衡暂态响应与机械阻抗优化。
reference: 在考虑电机瞬态操作空间时，低占空比允许外骨骼电机在短时间内运行于高于连续转矩的瞬态区域，从而提高输出功率。由于焦耳热与电流平方成正比且电流与转矩相关，低占空比可避免热积累，使电机在可控热负荷下实现高瞬时功率输出。然而，需权衡高电压带来的高传动比、高阻抗及效率下降问题。因此，低占空比有助于提升外骨骼电机的瞬态性能，但需结合系统设计优化其应用。

user_input: BiLSTM网络在处理IMU长期时间序列运动数据时存在哪些局限性，注意力机制如何弥补这些局限性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nInputLayer Conv1D Dropout BiLSTM Dropout Permute Dense Permute Multiply Flatten Dense  Size: N * 5 * 10 Num filter = 128; Kernel size = 1; Padding = 0; Activation = ReLU Dropout = 0.5 Num filter = 64 Dropout = 0.5 Permute Num filter = 5; Activation = Softmax Permute Multiply Flatten Num filter = 1  gyroscope signals.  3.3. Proposed subject-independent attention-based CNN-BiLSTM model  Conv1D and BiLSTM were used in the present model for data extraction due to their excellent performance in capturing time-series data features [25]. A recent study has developed a CNN-BiLSTM model that utilize the advantages of both CNN and BiLSTM to process surface EMG and IMU data [26]. As the BiLSTM lacks the ability of global information extraction [27], the attention mechanism was used in the proposed model to provide an ability to capture essential informa- tion [28]. In the present study, the long-term time-series kinematic data was collected by IMUs. Therefore, an attention-based CNN-BiLSTM hybrid model was proposed for the estimation of the lower-limb joint moments. The framework of the proposed model is illustrated in Fig. 2. The present model consisted of three blocks, namely the CNN network, BiLSTM network and attention mechanism.  Fig. 3. Profile of hip/knee/ankle joint moment during single gait cycle of (A) level-ground, (B) ramp, (C) stair, and (D) treadmill for subject AB19. Results were derived using attention-based CNN-BiLSTM model with a single shank-attached IMU.  BiomedicalSignalProcessingandControl86(2023)1053725  W. Liang et al.\n']
response: BiLSTM网络在处理IMU长期时间序列运动数据时存在全局信息提取能力不足的局限性，难以整合跨时间步或跨空间维度的信息。注意力机制通过动态分配不同时间点或特征的权重，增强对关键运动模式的捕捉能力，从而弥补BiLSTM的不足，提升模型对关节力矩估计的准确性。
reference: BiLSTM在处理IMU长期时间序列运动数据时的主要局限性是缺乏全局信息提取能力。注意力机制通过为BiLSTM输出的不同时间步分配可学习权重，实现对关键时间信息的聚焦，从而弥补其在全局依赖建模上的不足，提升模型对长期时间序列的表达能力。

user_input: 被动辅助模式与无辅助模式在胫骨前肌（TA）用力程度上的差异说明了什么控制优势？
response: 被动辅助模式与无辅助模式在胫骨前肌（TA）用力程度上的显著差异表明，TA在被动辅助中需求较低，说明该模式可能通过减少TA的主动参与来优化能量利用与运动协调性，从而实现更高效的外骨骼控制策略。
reference: 被动辅助模式与无辅助模式在胫骨前肌（TA）用力程度上的差异说明了被动辅助模式在外骨骼控制中能够优化肌肉用力分布，减少肌肉自主负荷，从而提升运动效率和稳定性，体现了其在降低肌肉疲劳与维持功能性运动方面的控制优势。

user_input: 自适应前馈模型如何提升执行系统的力跟踪性能？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n. CAN Communication was selected to satisfy the 1 kHz control loop rate requirement for a simpler implementation compared to Ethercat. In the top layer, a dell precision T3500 computer is configured as the real time target machine that runs Matlab Simulink for the control implementation. A PCI interface card for CAN (CAN-AC PCI, Softing AG, Haar, Germany) is installed on this computer to acquire sensor signals and send desired current to servomotor driver through the microprocessor. All sensors and actuator signals including load cell, IMU, actuator encoders command motor current and measured motor current are all logged on the real time target machine at the control loop frequency. An Arduino Due is selected as the microprocessor in the middle layer. It acts as a signal hub between real time target machine and servomotor driver while protecting the system from undesired behavior of the actuator due to anomalous errors of signals from real time target machine. In the bottom layer, Gold Twitter (Elmo Motion Control Ltd, Israel) with 55V maximum supply voltage and 60 A peak current is selected as the current servomotor driver. It tracks the checked current command from the microprocessor to drive the actuator at the desired speed and stiffness. With this control system structure, it keeps the possibility to make this actuation modular to be a self-contained actuation system without an external real time target machine similar to the off-board system in [22]. IV. SYSTEM MODELING To achieve accurate force tracking on a moving object through a soft interface, we need a high bandwidth control system. Feedforward ideas are shown to lead an increase in the effective bandwidth of a close-loop control and an improvement on tracking performance in previous studies [35], [36]. In this section, we present accurate models of suit stiffness, thigh motion, and actuator transmission. These models are integrated into our control architecture as feed forward models that significantly improved the force tracking performance of our actuation system. The detailed implementation of each FFM is described in Section V. A. Suit stiffness model The suit stiffness model is intended to enable the controller to compensate for the nonlinear deformation in the hip exosuit when assistance force is generated. Using desired reference force as the input to calculate the required cable position is the purpose of the suit stiffness model\n']
response: 自适应前馈模型通过提升系统带宽、补偿非线性特性以及增强动态响应能力，显著提升了执行系统的力跟踪性能。具体而言，前馈模型被集成到控制架构中，用于估计和补偿外骨骼刚度、大腿运动和执行器传动等非线性参数，从而实现高精度、高响应的力跟踪控制。
reference: 自适应前馈模型通过建立执行系统的精确模型（包括外骨骼服刚度、大腿运动学及执行器传动特性），在闭环控制中引入预测机制，提前补偿非线性变形和动态响应误差，从而显著提升力跟踪性能与系统带宽。

Features from the last fully connected layer were flat- tened and connected to the prediction layer.\n']
response: BiLSTM相较于标准LSTM在外骨骼控制中的优势体现在：1）通过双向结构同时利用时间序列的前后信息，增强对中长期依赖的建模能力；2）提升IMU数据驱动的关节力矩预测准确性，尤其在处理复杂运动模式（如斜坡行走）时表现更优；3）文献实验证明其在膝关节和踝关节预测任务中具有更高的预测一致性与鲁棒性。
reference: BiLSTM相较于标准LSTM在外骨骼控制中的优势主要体现在其双向建模能力上，BiLSTM通过结合前向和反向LSTM，能够同时利用过去和未来时刻的信息，从而更全面地捕捉时间序列数据中的上下文依赖关系，提升对复杂运动模式的建模与预测能力。

Human Subject Experiments  The objectives of the human experiments are the following: 1) to evaluate the movement synergy of our continuous torquecontrollerwithhumansatdifferentwalkingspeeds; 2) to evaluate the capability of the system to track the desired torque and show that our exoskeleton with the proposed controller does not cause a signiﬁcant change in knee kinematics;  3) to understand the effect on lower-limb muscle activities. 1) Accurate Biological Torque Estimation With Our Stiffness Model: To illustrate the beneﬁt of our proposed controller, the knee moment estimation from the continuous torque controller is shown in Fig. 14(a). response: 自适应连续扭矩控制器通过仅依赖当前膝关节角度估计力矩，结合闭环控制策略实现对不同行走速度的自适应调节，从而在不依赖步态相位信息的前提下，生成连续且准确的膝关节力矩估计，确保在 0.8–1.5 m/s 的行走速度范围内保持高精度与稳定性。
reference: 自适应连续扭矩控制器通过仅依赖当前膝关节角度而非步态相位估计，实现了在0.8至1.5 m/s不同行走速度下的膝关节力矩连续输出；实验结果表明其估计力矩与实际生物力矩之间具有较低RMSE和高相关性，从而确保了不同速度下的准确估计。

user_input: 基于IMU传感器的数据驱动方法在外骨骼控制中如何实现髋、膝、踝关节力矩的估计？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nAuthorized licensed use limited to: BEIJING UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY. Downloaded on January 15,2024 at 07:32:40 UTC from IEEE Xplore. Restrictions apply.  HOSSAIN et al.: ESTIMATION OF LOWER EXTREMITY JOINT MOMENTS AND 3D GRFS  [35], [35], [37] using data-driven methods with IMU sensors. Dorschky et al. [37] used 4 IMU sensors to estimate hip, knee, and ankle joint moments, anterior-posterior GRF, and vertical GRF in the level-ground and treadmill walking and running utilizing a 2D Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) based deeplearningmodelwiththedataaugmentationtechniqueswith musculoskeletal model simulation. Their approach is limited to the highly repeated level-ground or treadmill walking condition only. Leporace et al. [38] used a single accelerometer on the shank to predict the 3D GRFs during walking using a Multilayer Perceptron (MLP). However, the model was trained on limited samples (only 4 gait cycles per participant), and data was col- lected in level-ground walking condition only. Guo et al. [39] used only acceleration data from a single waist-mounted IMU sensortopredicttheverticalGRFinself-selectedwalkingspeeds in outdoor level-ground settings using Orthogonal Forward Re- gression (OFR) algorithm. All these studies are implemented in simple repetitive motion such as level-ground or treadmill walking and the use of conventional machine learning models. Toutilizeadatasetwithoutthepresenceofexperimentallycol- lected IMU sensors with motion capture and GRF data, Mundt et al. [31] placed virtual IMU sensors on the retrospectively collected walking model to predict hip, knee, and ankle joint momentsusingfeedforwardandLSTMbasedmodels.Molinaro etal.[28]alsousedamusculoskeleletalmodeltogeneratevirtual IMU sensor signals on the trunk and thigh to estimate hip joint momentusingTCN[40].Asthesestudiesareimplementedusing virtual IMU data, it is unclear how reliable the outcome of their methods is on real IMU applications with noise introduced from skin surface movements.\n']
response: 基于IMU传感器的数据驱动方法在外骨骼控制中通过采集关节运动学数据，并结合深度学习模型（如CNN、MLP、OFR、TCN、LSTM）进行非线性建模与预测，以估计髋、膝、踝关节力矩及地面反作用力（GRF）。典型方法包括：Dorschky等人使用4IMU+CNN模型；Leporace使用MLP预测GRF；Mundt和Molinaro等人使用虚拟IMU数据训练模型以估计关节力矩。然而，这些方法多依赖有限样本或虚拟数据，且在真实IMU应用中（如皮层运动或非重复步态）的可靠性尚未充分验证。
reference: 基于IMU传感器的数据驱动方法中，Dorschky等人[37]通过部署4个IMU传感器采集运动数据，结合二维卷积神经网络（CNN）模型、数据增强技术及肌肉骨骼模型仿真，实现了对髋、膝、踝关节力矩的估计。该方法适用于平地和跑步机行走与跑步场景，但受限于高度重复的运动模式。Mundt等人[31]使用虚拟IMU数据结合前馈和LSTM模型预测三关节力矩，而Molinaro等人[28]基于虚拟IMU信号和TCN估计髋关节力矩，但均未使用真实IMU传感器。目前文献中尚无基于真实IMU、适用于复杂步态模式的完整数据驱动三关节力矩估计方案。

user_input: 软性可穿戴外骨骼系统（exosuit）如何通过辅助关节扭矩实现对人体肌肉工作的增强？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n. Also, static misalignment of the biological and exoskeleton joints can result in dynamic misalignments of up to 10 cm during normal movement, causing pain and even injury to users [15]. One solution has been to include redundant, passive degrees of freedom to accommodate these misalignments [16]; however, this adds further weight to the system. It is partly for these reasons that these systems do not typically reduce the metabolic power required for locomotion. In order to address these issues there has recently been work on developing active soft orthotics [17, 18] that show great promise in reducing the impedance experienced by the wearer and allowing more natural movement. As an alternative to rigid exoskeletons, we present the design and evaluation of a soft wearable device, we call an “exosuit” (Fig. 1). This device was designed to augment the normal muscle work of healthy individuals by applying assistive torques at the wearer’s joints with the goal of reducing the metabolic cost of transport of the wearer. Figure 1. A lightweight, non-restrictive soft lower extremity exosuit that can provide gait assistance through pneumatic actuators (orange) that span the hip, knee and ankle joints.\n']
response: 软性可穿戴外骨骼系统通过在穿戴者关节处施加辅助扭矩（如气动执行器驱动的髋、膝、踝关节助力）增强肌肉工作，利用柔性结构减少干扰并提升自然运动能力，从而降低穿戴者的代谢成本。
reference: 软性可穿戴外骨骼系统（exosuit）通过在人体髋、膝、踝关节处施加外部辅助扭矩，减少肌肉自身所需产生的力量，从而增强肌肉工作的效率。该系统采用轻质柔性材料和气动执行器，提供非限制性辅助，降低穿戴者运动时的阻抗和代谢能量消耗，实现对人体肌肉功能的支持。

user_input: 自适应频率振荡器（AdOs）在外骨骼控制器中用于估计步态周期的哪些关键参数？
retrieved_contexts: ["\nThe first stage of the assistive controller addresses the estimation of the current phase of the gait cycle. The gait cycle, i.e., stride period, is defined in the controller as the time between two consecutive left heel strike events, while the current phase inside each gait cycle (expressed as a percent of stride period) is obtained as the ratio between the time elapsed from the start of the current cycle, and the expected duration of the cycle. The expected duration of the gait cycle is estimated through an Adaptive Frequency  In this study we propose an alternative solution based on nominal torque profiles that approximate on-line the user's joint torque during walking. While walking at a constant  1 Note that given the substantial equivalence between over-ground and treadmill walking [46], the Winter’s torque profile can be used for experiment performed on treadmill.  Copyright (c) 2013 IEEE. Personal use is permitted. For any other purposes, permission must be obtained from the IEEE by emailing pubs-permissions@ieee.org.  This article has been accepted for publication in a future issue of this journal, but has not been fully edited. Content may change prior to final publication.  Oscillator (AdOs), a mathematical tool that was originally developed for other applications [45] and more recently used for estimating the high-level features of periodic human movements [42],[49]. Resistive foot-pressure sensors are embedded insoles (see [47] for implementation) and act as switches to detect the heel-strike and toe-off events. By combining the left foot heel strike detection with the estimated cycle-duration, the assistive controller can compute the current stride percent (Stride % in Fig. 2(a)).  in  the user’s shoe\n"]
response: 自适应频率振荡器（AdOs）在外骨骼控制器中用于估计步态周期的持续时间和当前相位，其中步态周期持续时间通过AdOs估计，当前相位则由该估计值与预期周期长度的比值计算得出。
reference: 自适应频率振荡器（AdOs）在外骨骼控制器中用于估计步态周期的关键参数包括：1）步态周期的预期时长（expected duration of the gait cycle）；2）当前步态周期中的相位百分比（current phase expressed as a percent of stride period）；3）结合左脚跟触地事件检测与周期估计，生成步态百分比（Stride %），用于控制辅助时机。

Instead, we examined propulsive and braking AP impulses of both the prosthetic limb and the intact limb because AP impulses in walking are the results of interactions between both lower limbs and the environment. Furthermore, these impulses have previously explained gait characteristics, such as temporal- spatial symmetry [27], [32] and walking speed [48]. response: 推进和制动冲量在解释步态特征（如时空对称性和行走速度）中起到了补充作用，能够更全面地反映下肢与环境交互的结果，尤其在解释个体间差异较大的完整肢体运动行为时，优于仅依赖假肢控制参数的方法。
reference: 推进和制动冲量在解释步态特征中起到了关键作用：它们作为双下肢与环境相互作用的综合指标，能够有效解释步态的时空对称性和行走速度。相比直接使用控制参数，这些冲量更全面地反映双侧肢体的协调性，尤其适用于评估健全肢体与假肢之间的动态平衡。

user_input: 文中提到的脊髓反射控制模型如何通过本体感觉反射调控下肢九大肌群的激活状态？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n2. METHODS  We select a range of unexpected disturbances used in human gait studies from the literature, replicate them in simulation with the neuromechanical model, and compare the models reactions to the reported human experimental data.  FIGURE 1 | Spinal reﬂex-control model of human locomotion. The sagittal plane components of a 3-D model (Song and Geyer, 2015a) are adopted for the current study. The model mainly uses proprioceptive reﬂexes to control nine major muscle groups per leg, including hamstrings (HAM), rectus femoris (RF), vasti (VAS), gastrocnemius (GAS), soleus (SOL), and tibialis anterior (TA). The activations of these muscles during normal walking of the model (black lines) and of humans (gray lines) are shown in the right panel. MN, motor neuron; IN, interneuron.  Frontiers in Computational Neuroscience | www.frontiersin.org  2  March 2017 | Volume 11 | Article 15  Song and Geyer  2.1. Experiment Selection Five disturbance experiments are selected from the literature: electrical stimulation of the lumbar spinal cord to evoke multisegmental monosynaptic responses (MMR; Courtine et al., 2007), mechanical tap of tendons to induce tendon tap reﬂexes (TR; Dietz et al., 1990; Faist et al., 1999), actuation of the ankle joint to induce stretch reﬂexes (SR; Sinkjaer et al., 1996), and tripping (TRIP) of the swing leg (Schillings et al., 1999), and slipping (SLIP) of the stance leg (Sloot et al., 2015; refer Video S2 for visual guidance). In these experiments, the reactions of the spinal control are assessed through the changes that occur in the leg muscle activations within a short time after the disturbances. Speciﬁcally, the activation changes are measured by surface electromyograms (EMGs) and their trend with respect to gait phase or disturbance magnitude is used to estimate the activity of spinal reﬂexes.\n']
response: 脊髓反射控制模型通过整合本体感觉信息（如肌肉长度、张力、关节角度等）生成适当的肌肉激活指令，从而实现对外骨骼或仿生系统中下肢肌群的精确调控。该模型采用三维人体运动模型评估不同扰动（如电刺激、腱反射、关节伸展反射、摆动腿滑步等）下肌肉激活的瞬态变化，并通过表面肌电图（EMG）测量其趋势，用于估计脊髓反射活动。文中提到的九大肌群（如股直肌、股四头肌、腓肠肌、比目鱼肌、胫骨前肌等）在正常行走与扰动响应中表现出相似的激活模式，表明本体感觉反射在调控这些肌群激活状态中起关键作用。
reference: 脊髓反射控制模型通过本体感觉反射调控下肢九大肌群（HAM、RF、VAS、GAS、SOL、TA等）的激活状态。模型在受到电刺激、肌腱敲击、踝关节拉伸及步态扰动（如绊倒和滑倒）等外部干扰后，快速产生肌肉激活变化，这些变化通过表面肌电图（EMG）测量并用于评估脊髓反射活动的趋势。本体感觉反射机制根据扰动强度和步态相位动态调节肌肉激活，实现对下肢运动状态的快速适应性控制。

user_input: 柔性滑动大腿支架设计如何兼顾外骨骼优势与可穿戴安全性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n. If such a rigid shape is fitted to the human body, there is high probability that it may injure the joints and contact locations. Consequently, much research is being conducted on methods of improving the wearability, such as recent work on developing active soft orthotic systems that can be tightly fitted. However, these devices are designed to augment muscle function by applying tension at the wearer’s joints similar to the direction of muscles. Therefore, they cannot support any device weight. Furthermore, with these devices, wearers would have to endure bone-on-bone forces amounting to more than several tens of kilograms. In this study, we propose the flexible sliding thigh frame, which has taken all the good points of exoskeletons and soft\n']
response: 柔性滑动大腿支架通过采用软性结构设计，减少了关节与接触部位的直接压力，避免了传统刚性支架可能引起的损伤；同时结合外骨骼的支撑能力，确保设备重量能够被有效承载，从而兼顾了穿戴安全性与外骨骼功能。
reference: 柔性滑动大腿支架通过结合刚性外骨骼的结构承载能力和柔性系统的贴合性，实现外骨骼功能与穿戴安全性的平衡。其设计可适应人体运动形态变化，减少对关节和软组织的压迫，同时有效分散设备重量，提升穿戴舒适度与支撑性能。

user_input: 功能性电刺激（FES）在外骨骼系统中如何实现对腿部肌肉收缩的控制，并面临哪些主要挑战？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nmotion in individuals with paraplegia, a number of researchers have investigated the use of functional electrical stimulation (FES) to artiﬁcially elicit and control leg muscle contraction, thereby utilizing the musculature and metabolic power supply of the paraplegic subject to generate legged locomotion. Some of the research efforts in this regard include [3]–[13]. In ad- dition to providing power for locomotion, FES-aided gait has also been shown to provide a number of associated physiolog- ical beneﬁts, some of which include increased muscle strength, increased bone density, decreased spasticity, and improved car- diovascular health [14]–[20]. Despite this, FES-based systems entail a number of challenges; most notably, muscles are difﬁ- cult to control, particularly in the absence of adequate sensory information, and muscle torque output tends to fatigue rapidly, as a byproduct of the synchronous activation and preferential recruitment of fast-twitch muscle ﬁbers associated with FES.  Index Terms—Cooperative controller, functional electrical stim- ulation (FES), hybrid FES, powered lower limb exoskeleton, spinal cord injury (SCI).  I. INTRODUCTION  O NE of the most signiﬁcant impairments resulting from  paraplegia is the inability to stand and walk [1]. In ad- dition to diminished mobility, spinal cord injury (SCI) and the inability to stand and walk can entail signiﬁcant health implica- tions, including loss of bone mineral content, pressure-induced skin problems, increased incidence of urinary tract infection, muscle spasticity, impaired lymphatic and vascular circulation, impaired digestive operation, and reduced respiratory and car- diovascular capacities [2]. In an effort to restore legged loco-\n']
response: 功能性电刺激（FES）通过外部电刺激激活瘫痪个体的腿部肌肉，实现对肌肉收缩的控制，但其在实现过程中面临的主要挑战包括：肌肉控制难度大，尤其在缺乏有效感官反馈的情况下；肌肉扭矩输出易因快肌纤维的同步激活而快速疲劳；此外，不同个体间的神经-肌肉耦合差异进一步增加了控制的复杂性和不确定性。
reference: FES通过电刺激引发腿部肌肉收缩，利用瘫痪者的肌肉和代谢能量实现外骨骼系统中的步行控制，并具有增强肌肉力量、增加骨密度、减少痉挛和改善心血管健康的生理益处。其主要挑战包括肌肉控制困难（尤其在缺乏足够感觉反馈的情况下）以及因快肌纤维的同步激活与优先募集导致的快速疲劳。

user_input: 文中采用的自定义McKibben执行器如何通过调整输入气压实现力输出控制？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nAnkle Plantarflexion 25 100 0.06 1867  Ankle Dorsiflexion 10 5 0.06 67  Knee Flexion 60 25 0.07 457  Knee Extension -5* 25 0.07 457  Hip Flexion 35 80 0.12 750  Hip Extension 10 50 0.12 367  Maximum knee extension is less than zero (straight leg) during normal walking. B. Actuator Design and Characterization Actuators used for this study were constructed from latex tubing, expandable mesh, pinch clamps, and barbed fittings; all available commercially as previously described in [17]. While, commercial McKibbon actuators are available for purchase, custom actuators were made to minimize weight for the size and force requirements based on the biological specifications shown in Table I. As compressed air is supplied to the actuators, they expand radially, shortening in length and thereby providing actuation. Force can thus be modified by changing input pressure and the stroke length is determined based on the actuator length and properties. An actuator with an active length (excluding end hardware such as fittings and steel loops) of 200 mm was prototyped and force versus displacement data were recorded on an Instron 5544 load frame system for 1 to 5 bar (14.7 to 73.5 psi) input pressures (Fig. 2). Figure 2. Force versus displacement curves for a 200 mm long custom made McKibben actuator. Negative displacement indicates shortening. As shown, an actuator will generate a peak force when engaged at its rest length, from there, its force producing capabilities decrease with contraction. Increasing supply pressure increases the actuators force output and its amount of maximum contraction. For this prototype, 4 bar (58.8 psi) was chosen as an operating pressure to provide substantial actuating force, yet provide an additional safety measure, providing forces 38% lower than those at the maximum pressure of 5 bar (230 N vs 370 N). Air flow to the actuators was controlled by inline solenoid valves (Norgren, 2 position, 5/2 valve model E12), and air was supplied from the compressor to the system with 3/8 inch OD (1/4 ID) tubing, and distributed from the valves to the individual actuators with individual 1/4 inch OD (1/8 ID) tubes. When using these actuators for a dynamic application such as assisting with gait, inflation and deflation times must be considered as the actuators do not actuate instantaneously,  3363\n']
response: 文中采用的自定义McKibben执行器通过调节输入气压来控制力输出，气压越高，执行器内部弹性材料的压缩程度越大，从而输出更大的力。执行器的力输出与输入气压成正比，并受执行器主动长度和压缩能力的限制。在4 bar（58.8 psi）下输出230 N，5 bar（73.5 psi）下输出370 N，说明气压是实现力控制的核心参数。
reference: 文中采用的自定义McKibben执行器通过调节输入气压来控制力输出，气压越高，执行器产生的最大力和收缩量越大。实验表明在1至5 bar范围内，力输出随气压上升而增加，最终选择4 bar作为操作压力以在力输出与安全性之间取得平衡。

response: 不同深度学习模型在水平地面行走预测中的表现存在显著差异，主要体现在预测误差（RMSE）和相关性（PCC）指标上。例如，Conv1D模型在水平地面行走任务中的表现优于部分传统方法，但仍有提升空间；而某些模型（如Bi-LSTM）在趋势匹配和误差控制方面表现更优。模型结构（如CNN vs. Conv1D）对预测性能也有显著影响。
reference: 根据参考文献中的实验结果，不同深度学习模型在水平地面行走预测中表现存在差异。所提出的模型在PCC（0.79 ± 0.15）和RMSE（0.24 ± 0.07）指标上优于Conv2D、TCN、ANN、LSTM-ANN、Bi-LSTM和Conv1D等模型，表明其具有更优的预测性能。尽管文献未提供统计显著性检验结果，但数值差异表明模型间存在性能差异。

response: 文中训练模型时采用的学习率衰减策略（每5个epoch将学习率减少20%）有助于防止模型在训练后期陷入局部最优，从而提升模型泛化能力。该策略通过动态调整优化速度，使模型在训练过程中更精细地调整参数，降低过拟合风险。然而，文献未提供其他直接防止过拟合的机制。
reference: 文中采用的学习率调整策略为：当验证集RMSE在5个epoch内未下降时，学习率减少20%；当验证集RMSE连续20个epoch未下降则终止训练。该策略通过动态调整学习步长并结合早停机制，有效防止模型在训练数据上过拟合，从而提升泛化能力。

user_input: 文中提到的“patient-cooperative control”在步态康复外骨骼中是如何实现个性化辅助的？
retrieved_contexts: ['\ncompared with walking without the exoskeletons14–16. Therefore, lighter-weight hardware and autonomous systems were developed and tested in goal-driven experiments, with single-joint systems tested to explore underlying biological mechanisms. These technological advances ultimately enabled exoskeletons to meet the envisioned objectives of reducing the metabolic cost during loaded or unloaded locomotion for military, industrial and recreational applications.  Alongside the development of exoskeletons to enhance the performance of load carriage, devices (in particular, the Lokomat17, Gait Trainer18, lower extremity powered exoskeleton (LOPES)19, active leg exoskeleton (ALEX)20,21 and Rutgers Ankle22) were designed to mechanize physical therapy for individuals re-learning to walk fol- lowing spinal-cord injury (SCI) or stroke. Common clinical practice calls for physical therapists to manually move the feet and legs of non-ambulatory patients through the motions of walking to facili- tate re-learning of movement patterns for functional improvement23. Robotic devices were developed to offload this burden from physical therapists and to improve patient outcomes by delivering precise interventions and training at optimal intensities, unconstrained by the limits of manual assistance. Exoskeletons initially failed to show clinical improvements that would justify their cost compared to traditional  1John A Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences, Harvard University, Cambridge, MA, USA. 2Department of Physical Therapy, College of Health and Rehabilitation Sciences: Sargent, Boston University, Boston, MA, USA. 3These authors contributed equally: Christopher Siviy, Lauren M. Baker.  e-mail: walsh@seas.harvard.edu  Nature Biomedical Engineering  non-robotic gait-training methods24–30. However, a better understand- ing of the underlying biomechanics and physiology led to an improve- ment in exoskeleton design, including biologically inspired strategies for actuation and control31–36. For example, ‘patient-cooperative control’ has been implemented in devices for gait rehabilitation to allow for more individualized assistance37–43. Such ‘assist as needed’ approaches are particularly important for augmenting the gait of individuals with some residual walking function while encouraging their own contributions.  a  Unimpaired weight-bearing  b  Unimpaired joint-targeting\n']
response: “patient-cooperative control” 是一种基于生物力学与个体运动特征的自适应控制策略，通过仿生驱动与“按需辅助”机制，实现对步态康复外骨骼的个性化辅助。该策略鼓励患者主动参与康复过程，在必要时提供助力，从而提升训练效果与功能性恢复潜力。
reference: “Patient-cooperative control”在步态康复外骨骼中通过“assist as needed”策略实现个性化辅助，依据患者的残余运动能力动态调整助力水平，鼓励其主动参与步态过程。该方法基于对生物力学和生理机制的理解，属于仿生启发式控制设计，旨在提升个体化康复训练效果。文献未详述其具体技术实现机制。

user_input: 文中提到的膝关节生物力学模型存在哪些局限性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nMedicine & Science in Sports & ExerciseT  131  force was 11–17 times BW, whereas estimated posterior shear force was 2–3 times BW. Although these knee forces appear inordinate, very few individuals other than compet- itive powerlifters are capable or willing to squat with a 382.5-kg external load.  Knee joint biomechanical models and anthropometric data used to estimate knee forces in Nisell and Ekholm (43) were based on 10 subjects from their previous studies (41,44), with a mean height of 180 cm and a mean body mass of 75 kg. This is one limitation in the study by Nisell and Ekholm (43), because their three subjects had a mean body mass 20 kg more than and a mean height 7 cm less (Table 1) than the 10 subjects used in their biomechanical models. Another limitation in their study was that the effect of co-contraction of the hamstring musculature was not considered. Because the calculated knee torque was the resultant torque (i.e., sum of all flexor and extensor torques), hamstring force, which generates a knee flexor torque, would cause greater quadriceps force and extensor torque. Consequently, all calculated knee forces in this study would be underestimated, because these forces are functions of quadriceps tendon and patellar tendon forces. Because the quadriceps tendon thickness is significantly greater than the patellar tendon thickness, it should be able to withstand a higher load before rupture. However, high magnitudes of compressive force and stress (force/area) between the fem- oral intercondylar notch and the quadriceps tendon may increase the injury potential of the quadriceps tendon. Tendofemoral compressive force between the quadriceps tendon and the femoral intercondylar notch began high at 6000 N at approximately 130° knee flexion, quickly de- creased to approximately 1750 N at 90° knee flexion and decreased to approximately 0 N at 60° knee flexion. As- suming a 3.4-cm2 tendofemoral contact area when the knee is flexed approximately 130° (24), tendofemoral compres- sive stress would be 17.6 MPa (6000 Nz0.00034 m-2). This large stress applied repetitively over time may cause degen- erative changes in the tendofemoral complex. Hence, per- forming the squat at knee flexion angles less than 90° will minimize tendofemoral stress and minimize injury potential to the tendofemoral complex.\n']
response: 文中提到的膝关节生物力学模型存在以下局限性：1）基于的受试者群体与研究人群（10名受试者）存在显著差异（体重和身高偏差），影响模型的泛化能力；2）未考虑腘绳肌的共激活效应，导致计算的膝关节力被低估；3）未涵盖动态运动任务中的生物力学特征，限制其在实际应用中的适用性；4）未提及是否基于个体化数据或考虑肌肉解剖变异，影响其临床与运动科学中的通用性。
reference: 文中提到的膝关节生物力学模型存在以下局限性：一是模型基于的受试者群体与实际研究对象在身高和体重参数上存在差异，影响力估计的准确性；二是未考虑腘绳肌共激活效应，导致股四头肌力及膝关节力的计算结果被低估；三是模型未充分反映不同膝关节屈曲角度下肌腱-股骨接触面积变化对压应力的影响，可能低估了损伤风险。

user_input: 文中设计的Android应用程序如何实现对不同类型任务的辅助水平个性化调节？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n6.2 Methodology  6.2.1 Clinician-friendly android app (GUI) interface development  I designed an android app, or graphical user interface (GUI) in Android Studio using the Java language. This work involved two main aspects: 1) designing the front panel (or what the user sees and how they interact), and the background interface which provides the functionality of the GUI. We wished the front panel to be user friendly to the clinician who will ideally leverage the intuitive customizability of the controller to provide the appropriate assistance levels for each category of task or task phase to the patient based on their unique deficits. Four customization options were provided: as can be seen in Fig. 6.2, i.e., the ability to modulate the assistance for - 1) aiding in upward propulsion in ascent tasks, aiding bracing (energy absorption) in descent tasks, 3) aiding the strength of upward propulsion for sit-stand (or more generally closed chain squatting) tasks, and 4) leg clearance in general swing. With intuitive graphics, the on-site clinician was easily able to control the behavior of the controller. The GUI also provides a secondary feedback panel which receives data from the bilateral exoskeleton modules and displays them as live bar graphs. In this  76  case we displayed live commanded torques (normalized to the saturation torque of 25 Nm). This feature allows the clinician to monitor the behavior of the controller and can determine if more assistance may be needed in certain difficult tasks or task phases. Buttons on the bottom right of the screen are provided to easily switch back and forth between the two front panels.\n']
response: 文中通过设计直观的临床友好型Android应用程序界面，提供四种任务相关的辅助调节选项（向上推进、制动、坐站辅助、摆动腿部抬升），并实时反馈控制器行为，结合图形化操作与多任务切换功能，实现对不同类型任务的个性化辅助水平调节。
reference: 文中设计的Android应用程序通过提供四个可调节的辅助模式（上坡推进、下坡支撑、坐站推进力量、摆动腿抬离）和直观图形界面，使临床医生可根据患者个体缺陷和任务类型实时调节外骨骼的辅助水平。结合实时扭矩反馈与界面切换功能，实现了对不同类型任务或任务阶段的个性化辅助控制。

user_input: 自适应阻抗控制如何实现人机协同中的代谢能量减少？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThorough clinical investigations are still ongoing to prove the usability of these assistive robots; besides technical problems, mainly related to autonomy and portability of assistive exoskeletons, a scientific challenge still remains open i.e., how to control the robot in order to promote the human motor-adaptation and provide an effective assistance to the user.  In this paper, we study the human locomotor adaptation to the action of assistive exoskeletons that provide additional torque at the user’s hip, with the goal of reducing the muscle activity during gait while still allowing users to control their joint kinematics.  A muscle effort reduction during walking may be desirable for many persons. Several pathologies can decrease the walking ability of affected persons by reducing their  Manuscript received July 20, 2012, This work was supported in part by  the CYBERLEGs project (FP7-ICT-2011-2.1 #287894)  T. Lenzi was with with The BioRobotics Institute, Scuola Superiore Sant’Anna, Pisa, Italy; now is with the Center For Bionic Medicine, Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago and the Feinberg School of Medicine, Northwestern University, Chicago IL 60611 USA (e-mail: lenzi@ieee.org). M.C. Carrozza is with The BioRobotics Institute, Scuola Superiore  Sant’Anna, 56025 Pisa, Italy (email: carrozza@sssup.it)  S. K. Agrawal is with the Department. of Mechanical Engineering, (e-mail:  Columbia sunil.agrawal@columbia.edu).  University,  NY  10027,  USA  Walking assistance requires a strong synergy between the user and the robot. While walking, the assistive exoskeleton provides the user’s joints with supplemental torques. At the same time, the user adapts his muscle activation patterns to exploit the available torques in a convenient way. If the assistance is effective, the motor adaptation process will result in lower muscle forces and thereby a less fatiguing walk for the user. A thorough understanding of the human adaptation process is therefore fundamental for designing an effective assistive device for walking [20].  Recent studies exploiting proportional EMG control and gait event detection have showed that when an assistive torque is provided, humans modulate their muscle activation in order to maintain the total torque profile, i.e., the sum of human muscular torque and assistive torque, unaltered along the gait cycle [21],[22]. As a consequence, the muscle torque decreases and the metabolic effort is reduced [23]\n']
response: 自适应阻抗控制通过动态调节外骨骼提供的髋关节辅助扭矩，使人体在行走过程中适应并优化肌肉激活模式，从而降低肌肉总扭矩输出。这种调节机制确保用户肌肉与外骨骼扭矩的总和保持不变，促使人体通过减少肌肉激活来维持运动，最终实现代谢能量的降低。
reference: 自适应阻抗控制通过调节外骨骼提供的辅助扭矩，使用户能够根据外力进行肌肉激活模式的适应性调整，从而维持总扭矩不变并降低肌肉负荷，最终实现代谢能量的减少。

retrieved_contexts: ['\n. An RCT must be suf- ficiently powered and contain a formal control group representative of usual care, to allow for comparisons of rehabilitation effects. If an RCT shows positive changes in some metrics but remains overall inconclu- sive, then progression to a multicentre RCT in phase 4 should be halted. Once clinically meaningful average improvements are obtained with the device (compared with the control group), a multicentre RCT can be conducted. Clinical effectiveness from such a study would motivate device implementation in clinical settings.\n']

Results All 50 participants completed gait training and assessment (Pre/Mid/Post: n = 25 for FTST and SMA; Fol: n = 19 for FTST, n = 17 for SMA), with no adverse events in either intervention group. Stepping activity data were available for 24participantsineachgroup,andTMSdatawereavailablefor 15 participants in each group (ﬁgure 1). retrieved_contexts: ['\nD. Conclusion and Future Work  In this work, a continuous-phase stiffness model and the corresponding stiffness-based continuous torque controller are proposed and evaluated on a portable knee exoskeleton with eight able-bodied subjects during treadmill walking. This stiff- nessmodelcanachievealargeandsufﬁcientstiffnessbandwidth (16 Hz) to cover the normal human walking frequency range, and the controller achieves a small torque tracking error (0.23 N·m) under different stiffness. Our continuous torque controller requires no gait phase estimation and can adapt to varying speeds and generate a continuous torque proﬁle. Reducing the muscle activity of able-bodied subjects for level-ground walk- ing using a portable knee exoskeleton has traditionally been considered a difﬁcult task [65]. However, by leveraging our lightweight portable knee exoskeleton and our proposed contin- uous stiffness-based torque controller, our neuromuscular walk- ing experiments demonstrate that both the rms and maximum EMGofalleightmusclesdecreased(remarkableforthreeexten- sors and two ﬂexors) in the powered condition relative to the un- powered condition and two out of eight lower extremity muscles have a signiﬁcant reduction in muscle activation in the powered condition relative to the baseline (no-exoskeleton) condition. ComparedwiththeresultofthebaselineconditioninTableVIII,  the results showed that the powered exoskeleton could reduce the maximum EMG of knee extensors (VM, VL, and RF), knee ﬂexors(BFandSEM),andanklemuscle(TA)andreducetherms of knee extensor (RF), knee ﬂexors (BF and SEM), and ankle muscle (TA). But the rms and maximum EMG of the ankle plan- tarﬂexors(MGandLG)wereincreasedby3.55%and2.18%,re- spectively.Therefore,itcanbeconcludedthatthekneeexoskele- ton can reduce the EMG signal of the knee ﬂexor and extensor muscles. In contrast, the weight of the exoskeleton might cause a slight increase in the EMG signal of the ankle plantar ﬂexors, and it cannot be mitigated by knee joint torque assistance.\n']
response: 本文提出的基于连续刚度模型的扭矩控制器通过其自身的刚度调节机制，在不依赖步态相位估计的前提下实现了连续扭矩控制。该模型具有足够宽广的刚度带（16 Hz），能够覆盖正常人体步行频率范围，并在不同步态速度条件下保持良好的控制性能。控制器通过肌肉与关节之间动态交互关系构建的连续刚度特性，实现对膝关节肌肉负荷的连续调节，从而显著降低肌电信号，验证了其无需步态相位估计即可实现稳定、连续控制的优势。
reference: 本文提出的基于连续刚度模型的扭矩控制器通过构建一个连续变化的刚度函数，替代传统控制中所需的步态相位估计，从而实现不依赖步态相位划分的连续扭矩控制。该模型具备16 Hz的刚度带宽，能够适应不同步行速度，并在实验中表现出0.23 N·m的低扭矩跟踪误差，验证了其连续控制的稳定性与适应性。

user_input: 文中提出的混合FES系统如何实现代谢动力与机器人动力的有效协同控制？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nDigital Object Identiﬁer 10.1109/TNSRE.2015.2421052  1534-4320 © 2015 IEEE. Personal use is permitted, but republication/redistribution requires IEEE permission. See http://www.ieee.org/publications_standards/publications/rights/index.html for more information.  455  456  IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON NEURAL SYSTEMS AND REHABILITATION ENGINEERING, VOL. 24, NO. 4, APRIL 2016  similarly do not leverage the presence of the metabolic power supply.  In this paper, the authors combine the use of an externally powered lower limb exoskeleton with FES, in order to form a powered hybrid FES system. The intent of the system is to combine the power and movement control advantages of the powered lower limb exoskeleton with the physiological bene- ﬁts provided by FES. The proposed system is of the same gen- eral class of systems as the hybrid FES systems previously cited (i.e., [21]–[28]), but incorporates two sources of motive power (metabolic and robotic), and therefore offers additional control authority with which to supplement the FES. Such an approach requires a control methodology that can effectively combine these dissimilar sources of motive power, which is the topic of this paper.  Some researchers have recently explored the notion of com- bining FES with powered exoskeleton systems for individuals with paraplegia, as described in [41] and [42]. In [41], the au- thors describe a feasibility study combining quadriceps stimu- lation with a lower limb exoskeleton that includes hip and knee joint actuation. In that work, the authors manually tune a quadri- ceps stimulation pulse on a single healthy subject, and show that once appropriately tuned, the quadriceps stimulation decreased the torque required from the knee actuator to achieve similar joint angle tracking. In [42], the authors also describe a control method for combining FES with a powered knee joint, and im- plemented this method on ﬁve healthy subjects. In that work, the knee joint motor is controlled by a variable-stiffness con- troller, with the stiffness controlled as a function of the interac- tion torque between the user and the exoskeleton. Concurrently, the knee extensor muscle stimulation is controlledby a PID con- troller, and knee ﬂexor muscle stimulation is controlled by an iterative learning controller.\n']
response: 文中提出的混合FES系统通过引入代谢动力与机器人动力的双源控制机制，实现代谢动力与机器人动力的有效协同控制。系统采用外骨骼膝关节的变刚度控制与FES的PID控制器及迭代学习控制器相结合的方式，动态调节两种动力源的输出，实现对下肢关节的精确辅助与运动协调，从而提升整体控制性能与用户适应性。
reference: 文中提出的混合FES系统通过将外骨骼系统与功能性电刺激（FES）结合，整合代谢动力（人体肌肉）与机器人动力（外源驱动），从而实现协同控制。系统采用多种控制策略，如PID控制器调节膝关节伸肌刺激，迭代学习控制器用于屈肌刺激，以及可变刚度控制器调节电机行为，以有效融合两种动力源。实验验证表明，适当调制FES可降低外骨骼执行器所需扭矩，从而实现代谢动力与机器人动力的协同优化。

user_input: 本文通过运动学步态分析揭示了多发性硬化患者的哪些主要步态特征？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nTo conclude, gait disturbances in a cohort of mildly- to moderately-affected patients with MS are typified by decreased knee and ankle flexion, reduced dynamic stability and increased variability of movements. Subgroup analysis highlighted three dominant walking patterns in these patients: spastic-paretic gait, ataxia-like gait and unstable gait. While sensitive kinematic gait analysis and clinical walking tests detected deterioration of walking function over 1 year, EDSS scores did not reveal any change in our cohort. These insights may help to inform rehabilitative gait training in patients and to develop deficit-specific and patient-tailored exercise programs.  Materials Participants. Thirty-seven patients diagnosed with relapsing-remitting, primary- or secondary-progres- sive MS and clinical walking impairment were assessed at University Hospital Zurich between 2012 and 2013 (FAMPKIN study; clinicaltrials.gov, NCT01576354). For inclusion, patients had to be able to cover a distance of at least 50 meters within 6 minutes and to walk independently on an instrumented treadmill. Healthy control par- ticipants were measured within the framework of a two-centre study (University Hospital Zurich and University Hospital Balgrist). Both studies were approved by the Zurich cantonal ethics committee (KEK-2011-0445, KEK- 2014-0004) and were conducted in accordance with the Declaration of Helsinki and Good Clinical Practice. All subjects gave written, informed consent.\n']
response: 本文通过运动学步态分析揭示了多发性硬化患者的三个主要步态特征：1）步态不稳定性和运动变异性增加；2）痉挛-肌张力减退步态；3）类似小脑共济失调的步态；4）不稳定的步态模式。这些特征提示MS患者存在多种核心步态缺陷，可用于指导康复训练和制定个性化康复策略。
reference: 本文通过运动学步态分析揭示了多发性硬化患者的以下主要步态特征：膝关节和踝关节屈曲减少、动态稳定性降低、运动变异性增加。亚组分析进一步识别出三种主要步态模式：痉挛性轻瘫步态、类共济失调步态和不稳定步态。尽管EDSS评分未显示变化，但运动学分析可检测出一年内行走功能的退化，提示其在评估步态障碍方面具有更高的敏感性，有助于制定个性化的康复训练方案。

user_input: 柔性框架在辅助位置设计上采用了哪些策略以提升穿戴安全性与舒适性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nFigure 4. Free body diagram of 2D flexible sliding frame  Figure 3. The concept of flexible sliding frame  600  of the thigh frame. Thus, the concept of flexible frame is verified for the 1D and 2D frames. To connect the front side of the thigh fastener and the output of the actuator located next to the hip joint, as shown in Fig. 1, the shape of the flexible frame follows slightly reverse conic. The detailed 3D shape of flexible frames referred to those of the average old from KATS (Korean Agency for Technology and Standard) and they were made in three length. The loads transmitted from the device to the human interface produce contact pressures that can compromise safety and comfort. Hence, for assisting to reduce the force, the assisting position on the thigh is designed to be close to the knee, avoiding areas such as knee movement area, quadriceps tendon, etc. Figure 6 shows the detailed design of the flexible frame, which has an upper plate and a lower plate. These plates are bonded to each other at both ends, and can be moved in the middle portion to slide relative to each other with guidance from dovetail sliders. This structure of the dovetail sliders can increase the tensile/compressive stiffness and bending compliance at the same time. However, it has a limitation that the end rigidity may be insufficient for transmitting the force, because it is made of engineering plastics such as\n']
response: 柔性框架在辅助位置设计上采用了以下策略以提升穿戴安全性与舒适性：1）采用略呈反锥形的1D和2D结构以适应人体运动范围并减少局部压力；2）通过滑块引导的V型结构增强轴向刚度与弯曲顺应性；3）采用上板与下板相对滑动设计，提升力传递效率与穿戴灵活性。文献未提及具体关于皮肤接触面积或温度分布的优化策略。
reference: 柔性框架在辅助位置设计上采用了以下策略以提升穿戴安全性与舒适性：（1）将辅助位置设计在靠近膝盖处，避开膝关节活动区域和股四头肌腱等敏感部位；（2）采用略呈反圆锥形状的结构以优化与大腿的贴合性；（3）采用由上板与下板组成的滑动结构，并通过燕尾槽导轨实现相对滑动，从而兼顾拉压刚度与弯曲顺应性；（4）基于KATS平均老年人人体数据进行3D建模，并提供三种长度规格以适配不同用户。

The friendly rehabilitation assistance and avoidance of secondary injuries can be achieved through the application of the optimal torque. Currently, the primary methods for measuring human joint torque are to directly measure the torque or use reverse dynamics [5]. However, these meth- ods are not optimal for the real-time measurement of joint torque. The main techniques employed to estimate joint torque include biological models [6], various regression models, artiﬁcial neural networks [7]. Liu et al. [8] collected sEMG signals and used Hill’s musculoskeletal model to estimate joint torque esti- mation strategy that collected sEMG signals and obtained the envelope information through pre-processing. Machine learning is capable of extracting valuable key information from multimodal data, while also demonstrating good generalisation capabilities [10]. Truong et al. [11] adopted long and short memory network (LSTM), which extracted three groups of sEMG features as input and estimated joint torque of lower limbs. Gui et al. [12] adopted radial basis function neural networks combined with sEMG signals to estimate active joint torque for the custom lower limb exoskeleton. TCN employs dilated and causal convolution to encode temporal information and automatically extracts features. Molinaro et al. [13], [14] adopted TCN and achieved the average error of 0.131Nm/kg the sonomyography of for hip exoskeletons. Furthermore,  torque. Wu et al. response: 文中提到用于估计关节力矩的关键技术包括：生物模型（如Hill模型）、回归模型（如SVM）、人工神经网络（ANN）、长短期记忆网络（LSTM）、径向基函数神经网络（RBF）、时间卷积网络（TCN）等。这些技术各自存在以下局限性：生物模型依赖生物参数拟合精度，难以适应个体差异；回归模型对训练数据依赖强，泛化能力有限；ANN易过拟合，训练耗时；LSTM需大量计算资源，部署受限；RBF对初始参数敏感，非线性建模能力有限；TCN模型复杂度高，部署难度大。目前，这些技术尚未实现全面融合，尤其在实时性和个体适应性方面仍需优化。
reference: 文中提到的关键关节力矩估计技术包括：生物模型、回归模型、人工神经网络（如LSTM、RBFNN和TCN）。其局限性分别为：生物模型（如Hill模型）受限于复杂性和个体差异；LSTM依赖大量数据且可解释性差；RBFNN对输入信号质量敏感；TCN虽精度较高（平均误差0.131 Nm/kg），但模型复杂度高，可能影响实时性；直接测量与逆动力学方法不适合实时应用。

response: 本文通过仿真分析得出了 HLi（踝距）、TLi（脚距）和 CLi（接触长度）这三个关键指标的变化趋势。在步长 SL（28 cm、30 cm、32 cm、34 cm）下进行十次连续行走仿真，优化模糊调制器参数以最小化 HLi 并满足 CLi 的约束条件。结果显示，HLi 均为正值，表明无踝部与楼梯碰撞；CLi 均约为 25 cm，说明脚部接触面积良好，验证了所提方法的可行性。
reference: 本文通过仿真分析得出了 HLi（脚跟离地高度）、TLi（脚尖着地位置）和 CLi（接触长度）的变化趋势。仿真结果显示，HLi 始终为正值，表明无脚跟与楼梯碰撞；CLi 约为 25 cm，表明脚部与楼梯有良好的接触面积。这些趋势验证了所提方法在保证行走安全与稳定性方面的可行性。

user_input: 如何利用股直肌（RF）和腘绳肌（HM）的MMG信号进行膝关节屈伸扭矩预测，文中采用了何种目标变量进行回归分析？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nPradhan et al. proposed a linear regression technique that divides the EMG signal into frequencies to control a pros- thetic hand and stated that control by linear regression pre- diction provides accurate and robust control [15]. Similar to Pradhan et al., Smith et al. reported that linear regression control can be an alternative to conventional methods [16]. Chen et al. used polynomial regression to analyze joint torque and muscle activity using EMG, MMG, and sonography, respectively, and found that EMG and MMG had no effect on convergence speed [17]. Anders et al. used polynomial regres- sion analysis to identify patterns in EMG and MMG of the vastus lateralis muscle signals during leg extension and found that there were few intra-individual effects such as fatigue but observed that differences between individuals should be noted [18]. The best performance of MMG-based regression analysis is given in [19]. Estimating muscle torque with support vector regression (SVR) from MMG signals evoked by electrical stimulation showed a coefﬁcient of determination (R2) of 94% for training and 89% for testing. However, this study was conducted under limited conditions in which vibrations were induced by electrical stimulation.  Fig. 1. Overview of the signal processing.  rectus femoris (RF) muscle of the thigh, which is the main ﬂexion-extension muscle of the knee joint, and the hamstring (HM), which is the antagonist muscle group, from four direc- tions, and analyzed the feature values during the ﬂexion- extension movement. A regression analysis was performed using the number of ﬂexion and extension movements as objective variables. From the results of the regression analysis, the knee joint ﬂexion/extension joint torques was predicted from the MMG of the thigh, and the accuracy was veriﬁed.\n']
response: 文中采用线性回归方法，以“关节屈曲与伸展次数”作为目标变量进行回归分析，用于预测膝关节的屈伸扭矩。
reference: 该研究通过分析股直肌（RF）和腘绳肌（HM）的MMG信号特征，采用“屈伸动作次数”作为目标变量进行回归分析，从而预测膝关节屈伸扭矩，并验证了其预测精度。

user_input: 文中提出的软体外骨骼设备如何结合刚性与柔性设计的优势以提升穿戴舒适性与关节对齐特性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nTo address the above issues, there has recently been work on developing active soft orthotics. A team at Harvard University has developed a soft exosuit to assist the wearer’s natural gait performance in the military and medical ﬁelds [11]–[13]. Unlike traditional rigid exoskeletons with rigid support frames, this exosuit uses soft materials, such as textiles and elastomers, so that it can be worn like clothing. However, until now this soft wearable device has presented its own inherent limitations, such as the absence of weight-support functionality. As shown in Fig.1(b), the device pulls the extremity of a human body by the wire directly without load-support frames to assist the joint torque. Considering the importance of the weight- support function for the elderly who have arthritis pain, the effectiveness of the device in assisting the elderly’s gait has not yet been proved.  To solve these limitations of conventional rigid and soft wearable devices, we proposed a novel wearable walking assis- tance device named Samsung walking-assist device for lower extremities (abbreviated as “S-Assist L-type”) for personal use. Its biomechanical design takes the best of the above two approaches, conjugating a ﬂexible load-support structure for increased wearability and comfort, with a multi-joint kinematics for compliance and self-alignment with anatomical joints.  We developed in this work the ﬁrst prototype of a novel, tightly ﬁtting, more comfortable walking assist device for per- sonal use. It was designed to support the geriatric population with moderate impairment to walk or stand. Our aim is to promote active daily living for the elderly and the inﬁrm, who require lower-body physical support without adverse social consequences. The S-Assist can transmit a maximum of 20Nm of torque to the hip and knee joints independently. As shown in Table II, considering the added mass of the device, it is approx- imately 11.4%–26% of the torque required for the wearer’s hip and knee joints during walking or single-leg standing based on a 70-kg bodyweight. Although these maximum assist torques  (a)  (b)  Fig. 2. System overview of the “S-Assist L-type”: (a) the front view of the S-Assist in the standing mode and (b) the side view of the S-Assist in the standing mode.\n']
response: 文中提出的 S-Assist L-type 软体外骨骼设备通过融合柔性负载支撑结构与多关节运动学控制，提升了穿戴舒适性与关节对齐特性。其柔性结构增强了贴合度与穿戴舒适性，同时多关节运动设计确保了与人体自然关节的顺应性与自对准能力，从而克服了传统刚性与软体设备的局限性。
reference: 文中提出的软体外骨骼设备（S-Assist L-type）通过引入柔性负载支撑结构提升穿戴舒适性，并结合多关节运动学设计实现与人体解剖关节的自对齐，从而融合了刚性设计的关节对齐优势与柔性设计的舒适性与贴合性。

user_input: 自适应助力控制算法中，如何通过权重矩阵Wj(U,Yj)调节外骨骼控制输入与人体关节力矩的协同关系？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nj · [vGRF ·U(qj, pj,α) −Yj]  + [UB(qj, pj,α) −Y B  j ]TWk[UB(qj, pj,α) −Y B  j ]}  +U(q0, p0,α)TWrU(q0, p0,α) + Wsα  1  ,  (11)  where the subscript j represents the number of different walk- ing tasks, including level-ground walking, ramp walking, stair climbing, and stand-to-sit. The state vectors qj, pj ∈ Rm×1 comprise samples over time for the given task j with the number of time samples m.  The objective function comprises four parts, where the ﬁrst part corresponds to the least squares error of the exoskeleton control inputsU ∈ R2m×1 and the normalized able-bodied hu- man torquesYj ∈ R2m×1 for the ankle and knee joints with the weighting matrix Wj(U,Yj). The weighting matrix Wj(U,Yj) depends on the exoskeleton and human inputs (U,Yj) and adjusts the weights according to sign(U(i) ·Yj(i)), where i ∈ {1,...,2m} represents the sample index. We enlarge the weights when U(i) and Yj(i) have opposite signs to empha- size the importance of assisting rather than resisting human torques.  The second part of the objective function with UB and Y B aims to minimize the difference between the control inputs and normalized able-bodied torques during the initial 15%  20  VOLUME 1, 2022  and late 15% of stance phase boundaries with weighting ma- trix Wk, i.e., the early and late stance phases during the gait cycle, without the effect of GRFs. This helps regulate the exoskeleton torques u at endpoints of the stance phase. This also minimizes the dependence on vGRF for real-time imple- mentation to avoid aggressive torques when the custom force sensor in [24] returns inconsistent measurements of vGRF compared to the force plates in the dataset [33].\n']
response: 自适应助力控制算法中，权重矩阵 Wj(U, Yj) 根据外骨骼控制输入 U 与人体关节力矩 Yj 的符号乘积 sign(U(i)·Yj(i)) 进行动态调整。当两者符号相反时，权重被放大，以强调助力的重要性；当符号相同时，权重被减小，以减少对外骨骼与人体协同的干扰，从而实现更合理的自适应控制。
reference: 在自适应助力控制算法中，权重矩阵 Wj(U,Yj) 通过分析外骨骼控制输入 U 和人体关节力矩 Yj 的符号乘积 sign(U(i)·Yj(i)) 动态调整权重，当二者符号相反时增大权重，以强调辅助作用并避免产生阻碍人体运动的力矩。该矩阵用于目标函数的第一部分，即最小化外骨骼控制输入与归一化人体关节力矩之间的误差，从而调节外骨骼与人体关节力矩的协同关系。此外，在步态周期的初始和末段支撑阶段，权重矩阵 Wk 进一步调节控制输入与人体力矩的匹配程度，确保外骨骼在关键时间点提供适当的助力。

retrieved_contexts: ['\n. Here we presented a simple timing based control scheme; however, with the addition of sensors to the virtual anchor matrix, additional human-machine interaction control modalities can be examined. Specifically, we can examine those relevant and have been shown to be very important from a physiological perspective [31]. An extensive study of the full range of parameters of this device was beyond the scope of this paper, but we feel that this work opens the door to a broad range of biomechanics studies, not previously possible with other exoskeletons that have a significant effect on natural dynamics and kinematics. Further, we note that while no statistical analyses were performed here, the trends presented for this first case study are promising. Future work will also focus on statistically evaluating the efficacy of the exosuit with an increased number of human subjects. This new paradigm provides, for the first time, design rules, fabrication methodologies, and control strategies for\n']
