The plantar-ﬂexors pro- vide the pushoff power during late stance to drive the COM  VOLUME 1, 2022  25  LIN ET AL.: OPTIMALLY BIOMIMETIC PASSIVITY-BASED CONTROL OF A LOWER-LIMB EXOSKELETON  FIGURE 7. Individual subject comparisons of mean effort across repetitions. Effort is compared between bare, active with PHI method, and active with WOP method for each muscle pair (VMO, RF, BF, TA, GM and SOL) and task {Stairs Ascent/Descent (7 in step height), Decline (−5.2◦,−12.4◦) at 0.6 m/s, level ground (1 m/s for s1 and s2, 0.8 m/s for s3), Incline (5.2◦,12.4◦) at 0.6 m/s, and Sit-Stand cycle (45 BPM)}. * represents statistical difference (p < 0.05). ** represents p <= 0.01. *** represents p <= 0.001.  forwards. Both our controllers provided appropriate knee ex- tension and plantar-ﬂexion assistance torques that resulted in noticeable reductions in VMO (s1) and SOL (s2) activity in the stance phase. Since the knee goes through a minimal range of motion during stance in level walking, our prior controller that utilized only potential energy shaping [24] was not ade- quate to provide assistance during this phase. With the PHI and WOP controllers developed in the present study, adequate knee extension assistance torques are provided to assist with impact absorption in early stance.  The TA activations for both PHI and WOP were higher than bare for all walking tasks. This is similar to the results in [41], where the TA during the swing phase had increased activity with decreasing gravity. One explanation is that we are not providing adequate torques to support the weight of the sensorized exoskeleton foot plate. It is also possible that the provided plantar-ﬂexion torques are excessive, necessitating the TA activation to compensate. Future work will model the passive dynamics of the muscle-tendon unit for all joints. This is especially important for the ankle, i.e., the Achilles tendon is known to provide signiﬁcant storage and release of energy, much like a spring.  The purpose of BF during swing is to lift the foot by ﬂexing the knee, aiding in leg clearance. Although we pro- vided marginal knee ﬂexion torques, we observed high ac- tivations for BF with the active modes compared to bare,\n']
response: 在摆动相中股二头肌（BF）激活度增加可能反映了控制器未能在该阶段提供足够的膝关节伸展辅助力矩，导致肌肉代偿性激活增加，说明控制器设计在摆动相中存在对膝关节动力学支持不足的问题。
reference: 在摆动相中股二头肌（BF）激活度增加，是因为控制器未能提供足够的膝关节屈曲辅助力矩以完成足部抬高任务，反映了当前控制器在摆动相膝关节动力学建模和力矩分配上的不足，尤其是缺乏对肌肉-肌腱单元被动动力学的有效整合。

user_input: 膝关节外骨骼在疲劳后举升任务中表现出哪些显著的性能优势？研究中如何验证这些优势不受预疲劳工作量的影响？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n61  For all metrics, we used linear mixed models (LMMs) with condition (bare, exo) and gender (male, female) being fixed effects and participant being treated as a random effect. For post- fatigue performance and posture metrics, we included additional effects of order (for the bare vs. exo condition) and pre-fatigue workload (number of pre-fatigue LL repetitions required to reach fatigue). Although our power analysis originally called for ten participants, we concluded our study early after completing eight participants due to 1) the unavoidable risk and discomfort of the fatiguing protocol, and 2) the strong trends observed in our primary metric. The p-values of all metrics tested were therefore corrected as per the early stoppage criteria (Pocock boundary) by scaling by a factor of 1.7. We also corrected for multiple testing (six tasks) for the quadriceps effort metric using the Holm Bonferroni method. Gender, order, and workload were found to be non-significant factors in all statistical tests reported below.  5.3.1 Performance and postural benefits in post-fatigue lifting-lowering  The results confirmed our hypothesis that the knee exoskeleton improves post-fatigue LL com- pletion time. Compared to bare, the bilateral knee exoskeleton induced a significant (p<0.001) 33% reduction, 95% CI [21%, 43%], in the time to complete 10 LL repetitions post-fatigue, corre- sponding to raw un-adjusted averages of 50 seconds (bare) and 35 seconds (exo). Fig. 5.2 shows the completion time distributions, and Fig. 5.3 shows the ensemble averaged durations for 10 LL repe- titions before and after fatigue was declared. We also found that the pre-fatigue workload (number of pre-fatigue LL repetitions performed in exo condition as a percentage of bare condition) was uncorrelated (r = −0.11) with the post-fatigue completion time (exo condition as a percentage of bare condition, Fig. 5.4). Hence, although the exo condition required fewer repetitions to reach fatigue than bare, this did not bias the post-fatigue results.\n']
response: 膝关节外骨骼在疲劳后举升任务中表现出显著的性能优势，具体表现为完成10次举升-下降（LL）任务所需时间平均减少33%（p < 0.001）。研究通过引入预疲劳工作量作为额外变量，发现其与疲劳后完成时间无显著相关性（r = −0.11），从而验证了外骨骼性能优势不受预疲劳工作量增加的影响。研究采用线性混合模型并进行多重检验校正，确保结果的可靠性。
reference: 膝关节外骨骼在疲劳后举升任务中显著提升了任务完成效率，表现为完成10次举升-下降任务的时间减少了33%（p<0.001，95% CI [21%, 43%]）。研究通过将预疲劳工作量作为协变量纳入统计模型，并发现其与疲劳后完成时间无显著相关性（r = −0.11），从而验证了这些性能优势不受预疲劳工作量的影响。

retrieved_contexts: ['\n𝑥(𝑡) = 𝜃𝑇 𝑦(𝑡) = ∫ [𝜃𝑇 − 𝑚𝑒𝑎𝑛(𝜃⃗𝑇)]𝑑𝑡  𝑡  0  where 𝜃𝑇 is the thigh angle input. The vector notation indicates a vector containing the time-history of a particular signal over the course of a stride (i.e., the mean subtraction of the integral occurs once per stride to allow for stride-to-stride consistency in the phase space). Note that this method of using a subtracted mean that originally proposed and is integral implemented by [20]. Figure 1 shows the averaged thigh angle for seven healthy subjects for walking, stair ascent, and stair descent, plotted in the angle versus mean-subtracted integral phase space, as measured by a motion capture system. Note that, as required by the method, the locus of points for each activity forms a simple closed curve in this space for each limb segment input.  the same as  (LDA) pattern  II. ALGORITHM DESCRIPTION  A. Phase space  As previously mentioned, the method presented here is based on a phase variable (PV) representation, which requires that the variable input of interest be represented in a phase space (i.e., a signal as a function of its derivative). The methodology presented here further requires that the input variable form a simple closed curve in the phase space. Representation of a signal in a phase space (signal as a function of its derivative) as a simple closed curve requires that the signal be periodic and that each period be characterized by a single global maximum, a single global minimum, and no local extrema as a function of time.  Figure 1: Phase space for the thigh. The phase space consists of the integral of the mean-subtracted thigh angle plotted against the thigh angle. Thigh angle is calculated relative to the gravity vector in the sagittal plane. Walking (blue), stair descent (red), and stair ascent (green) stride data for healthy subjects form simple closed curves in this space.  B. Coordinate Frame Construction  The authors consider here the thigh angle with respect to the inertial reference frame (i.e., with respect to the vertical) in the sagittal plane as the input signal for activity classification. The thigh angle generally the corresponding phase in order to form a simple closed curve  requires an  integration of\n']
response: 基于积分均值减去的大腿角度相位空间用于将大腿角度信号转化为具有周期性和闭合曲线特性的相位图，从而在活动分类中提供一个具有区分性的相位空间表示。该方法通过积分均值减法消除个体差异和步态波动的影响，使不同活动在相位空间中形成可识别的几何轨迹，便于使用模式识别方法（如LDA）进行分类。
reference: 基于积分均值减去的大腿角度相位空间在活动分类中的作用是将周期性下肢运动（如步行、上下楼梯）表示为相位空间中的简单闭合曲线，从而实现不同活动模式的区分。该方法通过积分并减去大腿角度信号的均值，确保每个步态周期内信号的一致性，并形成可由LDA等分类器识别的特征轨迹。

response: 文中通过动力学模型推导出扭矩误差 eτ = KtRθp + (Kdes − Kt)θe − Kdesθ0，其中 Kt 是被动刚度，Kdes 是期望扭矩增益。当 Kdes − Kt = 0 时，扭矩跟踪误差最小，表明被动刚度 Kt 在适当匹配 Kdes 的条件下对提升扭矩跟踪性能具有关键作用。文中进一步提出，在下肢外骨骼中，最优的被动刚度应等于期望扭矩增益 Kt,opt = Kdes，从而实现最佳的扭矩跟踪性能。
reference: 扭矩误差公式通过包含 (Kdes − Kt) 项体现了被动刚度 Kt 对扭矩跟踪性能的影响，表明当被动刚度等于期望刚度（Kt = Kdes）时，扭矩误差最小，从而最优被动刚度为 Kt,opt = Kdes。

user_input: 相较于Lokomat系统，TPAD在自由度控制方面具备哪些技术优势以避免干预后出现侧向平衡问题？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nmotion during gait such as reduced anterior-posterior acceleration of the center of mass (31). (ii) TPAD does not add rigid links on the hu- man body. This feature allows free movement of the limbs with no re- strictions on any degree of freedom (DOF) and reduces the therapist’s effort to align the joint axes of the device with the human limbs or to adjust the size of the rigid links to the child’s body. Because gait is a se- quential coordination of limbs in three dimensions, restriction of spe- cific DOFs can alter the entire gait pattern. For instance, the restriction of the leg in the sagittal plane, such as what Lokomat provides, can cause issues of lateral balance after the intervention, because the gait pattern is practiced within an artificial environment where the hip abduction/adduction muscles are not actively involved in the motor con- trol (32). (iii) TPAD imposes an overall external force during movement and allows the users to coordinate and control the limb DOF. Because CP is caused by impaired central nervous system (4), the type and level of lesion are quite different among individual children (33). Instead of providing assistance to each joint with a predefined phase-dependent torque or displacement, TPAD promotes variability among joints and provides flexibility to the users in learning, as suggested by theories of human motor learning (34).  Six children diagnosed with CP and exhibiting crouch gait under- went 15 training sessions of 16 min each, over a duration of 6 weeks. We hypothesized that, as the study participants raise their center of mass against the applied downward force from TPAD during walk- ing, they will improve control of their ankle plantar flexor muscles, especially the soleus, and improve their crouched posture. The mus- cle strength and coordination were investigated using electromyog- raphy (EMG) data from the first and after last sessions of training. Kinematics and GRF were monitored continuously throughout the training.  RESULTS In each TPAD training session, participants performed 4 min of free walking before training, 16 min of TPAD walking with continuous\n']
response: TPAD在自由度控制方面相较于Lokomat系统具备以下技术优势：（1）不使用刚性链接限制肢体运动，避免了对特定自由度的干预；（2）通过整体外力影响运动轨迹，使用户能够自主协调肢体重构的自由度，从而减少因特定关节受限导致的侧向平衡问题；（3）不依赖预设阶段依赖的扭矩或位移辅助，而是通过促进运动变异性和用户自主学习能力，增强步态稳定性。
reference: TPAD在自由度控制方面的技术优势包括：不引入刚性约束以保持所有自由度的自然运动、通过外部力引导而非固定轨迹控制以促进关节变异性、以及避免矢状面限制对髋关节肌群激活的影响，从而有效降低干预后侧向平衡问题的发生风险。

user_input: 文中提到的髋关节外骨骼在踩踏周期中的扭矩变化趋势是怎样的？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nPeak flexion  Pedal stroke  Cycling directionAB  206080  0  Figure 3. (A) Definition of the pedal stroke timing based on ϕ from 0% to 100% and (B)hip exoskeleton p torque τ during the sweep session. Within the pedal stroke, peak extension (ϕ ext) and peak flexion (ϕ  p fle) torque timing change over the course of 15min from early (blue) to late (red).  2.3. Experimental Protocol  After fitting the spiroergometry system, the hip exoskeleton, and the seat position of the bicycle ergometer to the participants preference, participants began cycling at the nearest possible resistance to 1W/kg based on body mass (adjustable by 5W intervals) to become familiar with cycling with the hip exoskeleton without assistance (Figure 4). Participants were instructed to monitor their cadence on the screen and adjust it to maintain a cadence between 65 and 70rpm. This is below the preferred 80 to 90rpm found for young adults with no to moderate cycling experience [28]. However, increasing factors such as age, cycling duration, power output or gradient will decrease preferred frequencies [29]. About 55 to 60rpm were used for cycling training in patients with chronic stroke [30]. The resistance and the pedaling frequency were maintained throughout the entire experiment. To become acquainted with exoskeleton assistance, the exoskeleton was then activated, applying torque profiles that included peaks of 10Nm for both hip extension and flex- ion. Participants continued cycling for approximately five to ten minutes until they felt comfortable with the setup.\n']
response: 文中指出髋关节外骨骼在踩踏周期中根据踩踏角度（ϕ ext 和 ϕ fle）动态调整扭矩输出，表现为峰值扭矩在15分钟实验过程中从早期（蓝色）到晚期（红色）随时间变化，呈现动态适应趋势。
reference: 髋关节外骨骼在踩踏周期中的扭矩变化趋势表现为周期性波动，具有髋关节伸展和屈曲方向的峰值扭矩（约10Nm）。在15分钟的踩踏过程中，峰值扭矩的时间点从早期到晚期发生偏移，即髋关节最大伸展和屈曲扭矩的出现时间有所改变。

user_input: 本文提出的优化能量成形控制框架相较于现有研究在关节力矩估计方面有哪些技术突破？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe contributions of this paper are summarized as fol- lows. First, we generalize our optimization-based energy- shaping control framework based on the port-controlled Hamiltonian equations by incorporating global planar ori- entation and GRFs in the basis functions, while preserving  16  VOLUME 1, 2022  input-output passivity and stability for safe human-robot interaction. Second, this framework enables a single feedback controller to closely ﬁt normalized able-bodied human joint torques for all primary ADLs: level-ground walking, walking at variable inclines/declines, stair ascent/descent with vari- able step heights, and stand-to-sit. While recent work in [30] proposed a deep learning approach to estimating subject- independent hip joint torques for walking on level ground, ramps, and stairs, no prior work has estimated more compli- cated knee and ankle torque proﬁles for all primary ADLs (without switching or adaptation between tasks). Third, we assess the muscular effort of multiple able-bodied human subjects with an experimental implementation of this task- invariant control method on a (knee-ankle) exoskeleton to assist the primary ADLs.  The rest of this paper is organized as follows. Section II re- views the concepts of the port-controlled Hamiltonian systems and the corresponding matching conditions for the human- exoskeleton dynamics with contact constraints. In Section III, we design the desired closed-loop Hamiltonian system and the corresponding control law by incorporating the global orientation variable and GRF. We highlight passivity and sta- bility properties based on common human control policies. Section IV presents training and validation results for the optimized controller over a dataset of the primary ADLs. Section V then presents the hardware implementation and able-bodied human subject experiments. Finally, we summa- rize the limitation of the proposed study and provide possible future research directions.  II. REVIEW OF ENERGY SHAPING CONTROL FOR EXOSKELETONS This section brieﬂy reviews interconnection and damp- ing assignment passivity-based control (IDA-PBC) for the the solu- human-exoskeleton system in [29]. We present tion to the matching conditions with contact constraints, deﬁne the corresponding control law, and deﬁne input-output passivity.\n']
response: 本文提出的优化能量成形控制框架在关节力矩估计方面实现了以下技术突破：首先，通过引入全局平面上的旋转和平面力偶（GRFs）作为基函数，提升了控制方法对复杂地形和运动模式的适应能力；其次，保留了输入输出被动性和稳定性特性，确保了人机交互的安全性；再次，首次实现了对膝关节和踝关节在所有基本活动（ADLs）中复杂扭矩时序的估计，而此前研究仅能处理特定任务；最后，通过全局方向变量与GRF建模，增强了对坡道、楼梯等复杂地形的建模精度，从而提升了控制策略的泛化能力和任务不变性。
reference: 本文提出的优化能量成形控制框架在关节力矩估计方面的技术突破包括：1）首次将全局平面方向和地面反作用力引入端口控制哈密顿系统的能量成形控制框架中，提升了模型的物理一致性；2）实现了单一反馈控制器对所有主要日常活动（ADLs）中膝踝关节力矩的高精度拟合，无需任务切换或适应机制；3）保持了输入输出无源性和稳定性，确保人机交互安全性；4）通过膝踝外骨骼实验验证了控制方法在实际系统中的有效性，突破了现有方法（如文献[30]）在任务范围和控制稳定性方面的限制。

response: 低占空比对外骨骼电机性能的影响主要体现在其在连续电流限制下可提升输出扭矩，从而增强其在动态负载下的运行能力。然而，在瞬态操作中，低占空比可能限制电机的高响应能力，导致动态响应降低。因此，低占空比有助于提升连续运行的扭矩输出，但在瞬态条件下可能影响整体性能表现。
reference: 在考虑电机瞬态操作空间时，低占空比使外骨骼电机能够在高于连续运行极限的转矩下短暂运行（即瞬态操作空间），从而满足短时高功率需求。这种操作模式通过利用已知的低占空比特性，在不持续超过热限制的前提下提升电机性能。文献未提及潜在的热累积或效率下降问题，但强调了该策略在提升瞬时功率输出方面的有效性。

user_input: 自适应振荡器序列如何实现下肢外骨骼的基本步态学习与重建？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nother control techniques, such as PID and impedance control, as discussed earlier [20], [21].  However, neural systems are complex and challenging to ac- curately simulate, which poses practical challenges. Commonly used models for CPGs can be categorized into bio-inspired half- center oscillator (HCO) models and abstract oscillator-based CPGs [22], [23]. HCO models consist of interconnected neural networks inspired by biology. Achieving optimal rhythmic pat- terns necessitates simulation, testing, and empirical parameter adjustments [24], [25], [26]. Consequently, exoskeletons may not be well equipped to handle unforeseen circumstances and unexpectedalterations.Moreover,HCOnetworksareinherently reactive and rely on continuous feedback to maintain stabil- ity [27]. On the other hand, CPGs of the abstract oscillator type have the capability to adjust parameters online [28], [29]. Their combination with dynamic movement primitives [30] appears to be a suitable strategy for lower limb exoskeletons. However, this approach requires a lengthy adaptation process and can only learn the gait patterns of pilots [31], [32], lacking true adaptability for the broader exoskeleton population. Hence, there is a clear need for targeted enhancements in existing CPG technology to better control exoskeletons.  The study concerns a bench-style lower limb exoskeleton as theapplicationplatform,whichiscomprisedofanexoskeleton,a treadmill,andaweightreductionbench.Thegaitgenerationsys- tem is utilized to synchronize the exoskeleton’s speed with that of the treadmill. Furthermore, preference learning algorithms are integrated for personalized gait customization.  The main contributions of this article are as follows. 1) A gait-generation strategy for lower limb exoskeleton  based on CPG is proposed.  2) An oscillator sequence with the ability to learn basic gait is proposed, and targeted modiﬁcations for gait recon- struction are made.  3) Variational controller coupling with oscillator sequences is proposed, achieving speed synchronization between exoskeletons and treadmills, as well as personalized gait customization.\n']
response: 自适应振荡器序列通过结合抽象振荡器模型与偏好学习算法，实现下肢外骨骼的基本步态学习与重建。该方法包括：1）基于CPG的步态生成策略，采用变分控制器实现与跑步机的速度同步；2）设计具备在线参数调整能力的振荡器序列，支持个性化步态定制；3）通过振荡器参数的动态更新与偏好学习机制，使外骨骼能够适应不同使用者的步态模式，从而实现真正的自适应控制与步态重建。
reference: 自适应振荡器序列通过在线参数调整与结构设计实现基本步态学习，并结合变分控制器实现速度同步与个性化步态定制，从而实现下肢外骨骼的步态重建与适应性控制。

response: 背驱式执行器在下肢外骨骼中的应用优势主要体现在其良好的可逆驱动特性，有助于提升系统的柔顺性与人机交互安全性，同时支持更高效的能量传递与控制策略。这些特性通过降低人体行走过程中的代谢负担，从而有效降低代谢成本。文献[7]、[9]、[11]和[12]均支持这一机制。
reference: 背驱式执行器在下肢外骨骼中的应用优势包括高顺应性、低摩擦损耗、良好的力控性能及被动运动能力，使其在辅助步态时更自然且安全。其通过减少非助力阶段的运动阻力和提升人机协同性，优化了外骨骼对人体运动的顺应性，从而降低代谢成本。相关机制主要体现在减少肌肉主动发力和提升能量利用效率。

reference: 背驱式执行器在部分助力膝关节矫形器中的设计优势包括：提高系统的紧凑性和轻量化水平，增强穿戴舒适性；实现模块化设计，便于集成与扩展；支持自然的人机交互，提升用户的自愿运动控制能力；并具备较低的机械阻抗，有利于运动顺应性和安全性。

reference: 文中研究（Schiffman et al., 2008）表明，下肢外骨骼辅助装置在静态站立条件下对姿势摇摆无显著影响，同时在一定程度上限制了人体的稳定性极限，可能由于装置的结构限制了动态平衡能力。

user_input: 相较于被动式假肢，主动假肢在舒适性和能量效率方面具有哪些优势？文中提供了哪些研究支持这一结论？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nadjusts the impedance or position of the prosthetic joints based on gait phase and the users locomotor task (e.g. level walking, stair ascent and descent). The autonomous control cannot predict the user’s intent in terms of locomotor tasks and therefore cannot adapt to walking terrains. One solution is to build a neural-machine interface that predict the users intended locomotor task for prosthesis operation. Several groups have developed neural-machine interfaces (NMIs) for artiﬁcial legs to decipher neuromuscular signals (i.e. electromyographic (EMG) signals) and identify the user’s intended locomotor tasks and transitions [6], [7], [8], [9], [10], [11]. These approaches have been demonstrated to enable lower limb amputees to drive their prosthesis intuitively and switch locomotor tasks seamlessly. It has to been shown that active prostheses have the potential offer more comfort and less energy waste to the amputee compared to passive ones, [12], [13], [14]. The development of intelligent prosthetic devices has been done for a while as reported by [15]. Early investigations such as [12], [16], [17], implemented control and signal processing techniques to electromechanical systems in order to provide reliable systems that bring more comfort to the amputee. This type of research is still ongoing. Contemporary approaches make use of learning algorithms applied on exoskeletons and robotic limbs [18] with neural interfaces to the user for enhanced control, [19], [20], [21], [22], [23], [24] and response to human stimuli and intent, the so-called volitional control. For example, in order to give context awareness to the volitional control system for a prosthetic leg, [25] combined an inertial measurement unit (IMU) and a laser distance the terrain type and slope in front meter to reconstruct of the user [25]. Lately, context awareness strategies have gained an extra resource, the use of computer vision (CV). For example, deep learning techniques have been applied to prosthetic arms in order to enhance the grasp perception, independently of object forms or size [26]. However, the requirements and constraints to upper limbs prosthetics are very different than the ones to lower limbs, speciﬁcally in terms of response time and robustness.  This work is supported by the National Science Foundation (NSF) under  award CNS-1552828 and IIS-1361549.\n']
response: 文献中指出主动假肢相较于被动式假肢具有潜在的优势，包括提供更舒适的使用体验和减少能量浪费。然而，文中并未提供具体的研究数据或实验结果来支持这一结论，仅通过神经接口和自适应控制策略的描述暗示其潜在优势。
reference: 主动假肢相较于被动假肢在舒适性和能量效率方面具有优势，主要体现在提供更高的佩戴舒适性（supported by [12], [16], [17]）和减少能量浪费（supported by [12], [13], [14]）。这些结论得到了多项研究的支持，表明主动假肢能够通过控制和信号处理技术优化人机交互，从而提升性能。

user_input: 实验中如何评估GEMS对代谢能量消耗的影响？所采用的实验流程和测量设备分别是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nTABLE I. DESIGN SPECIFICATIONS OF THE ACTUATORS IN GEMS Specification Value  Gear Reduction 50  Max. Angular Velocity (rad/s) 6.5  Max. Assist Torque (Nm) 12  Continuous Torque (Nm) 8  Voltage (V) 24  Max. Ampere (A) 5  Max. Noise level (dB) 55  Figure 7. Angle/width adjustable hip brace  Figure 9. Configuration of the proposed actuator in the exploded view.  1061  estimate walking speed and to determine whether the user has started or stopped walking. The target output torque is determined as a function of the gait cycle, user weight, and walking speed. The gait cycle is estimated using our new algorithm called the particularly shaped adaptive oscillator [17], which is a modification of previous adaptive frequency oscillators in [14–16]. A reference torque pattern for assistance is predefined as a function of the gait cycle, speed, and slope. We identified a specific torque pattern for effective assistance after intensive trials. This pattern is illustrated in Fig. 10. IV. RESULTS As shown in Fig. 11, the maximum thickness is selected among values from the surfaces of the user to the maximum height of the device with a motion analysis system. The results are listed in Table II. The maximum thickness is less than 29 mm at the joint and 22 mm at the frame. To measure the performance of GEMS, 6 male participants with no known medical issues were recruited and 5 of them completed the assessment protocol. One person held the handrail due to apprehension and thus removed from the data. Therefore, we present results from only 5 subjects. All subjects were familiarized with the exoskeleton approximately 20 minutes a day before the experiment [18]. We used K4b2 (COSMED, Italy) to measure the volume of O2 and CO2 at the inlet and outlet to calculate the metabolic energy consumption, as shown in Fig. 12. During the experiment, the subjects performed the following activities [18]. \uf09f Stand for 5 min. \uf09f Free1: Walk on a treadmill for 10 min. \uf09f Rest sitting down for 5 min. \uf09f Wear the gait assistance device \uf09f Exo: walk on the treadmill for 10 min. \uf09f Take off the assistance device \uf09f Rest sitting down for 5 min. \uf09f Free2: Walk on the treadmill for 10 min. \uf09f Stand for 5 min. TABLE II. MAXIMUM HEIGHTS OF GEMS Measurement points Maximum height (mm)  Hip joint 28.9  Thigh frame @ thigh 22.0  Thigh fastener @ thigh 13.5\n']
response: 实验中通过测量用户吸入和呼出的氧气和二氧化碳体积，使用COSMED K4b2呼吸测量仪计算代谢能量消耗。实验流程包括站立、自由行走（Free1和Free2）、休息等任务，并在跑步机上进行行走任务以评估GEMS的影响。实验对象为5名熟悉设备的健康男性参与者，所有数据基于其在不同任务中的代谢参数进行统计分析。
reference: 实验中采用K4b2（COSMED, Italy）设备测量O2和CO2体积，从而计算代谢能量消耗。实验流程包括以下阶段：站立5分钟、自由行走10分钟（Free1）、休息5分钟、穿戴GEMS后行走10分钟（Exo）、取下设备后休息5分钟、再次自由行走10分钟（Free2）以及最后站立5分钟。实验前对受试者进行了约20分钟的熟悉训练，共5名男性参与者完成评估协议。

response: 自适应增益比例肌电信号控制通过动态调整助力输出以匹配用户的步态模式，从而显著提升行走时的助力效果。该控制策略基于肌电信号的实时识别，能够根据运动状态优化助力时机和强度，增强与人体运动的同步性，提高行走效率和舒适性。
reference: 自适应增益比例肌电信号控制通过实时监测肌肉激活水平动态调整踝关节外骨骼的助力输出，使助力与用户步态同步性增强，提升了行走时的平滑性与个性化控制效果。Koller等人（2015）研究表明该方法可改善关节力矩匹配和能量利用效率，从而提升行走助力性能。

user_input: 本文中所采用的背驱式扭矩控制执行器在设计上如何兼顾低反向驱动扭矩与高输出扭矩能力？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n11  To address these gaps, our prior work [Lv and Gregg, 2018; Lv et al., 2018] developed a task-invariant exoskeleton control strategy that assists the user’s voluntary movements with ener- getic control objectives rather than kinematic objectives. This work implemented a control tech- nique called potential energy shaping in a unilateral knee-ankle exoskeleton (Comex 1) to reduce the perceived gravity of the user. The control strategy leverages the exoskeleton’s backdrivable, torque-controlled actuators, which comprise a high-torque motor with a low-ratio transmission (24:1). This design minimizes the backdrive torques (around 3 Nm) while being capable of out- put torques up to 60 Nm [Zhu et al., 2017], which is sufficient for rehabilitation of the primary ADLs post-stroke [Hidler et al., 2007; Ng and Hui-Chan, 2012]. However, the potential energy shaping approach in [Lv and Gregg, 2018; Lv et al., 2018] relies on a model that assumes the stance leg is fully loaded with the weight of the user, resulting in excessive plantar-flexor torques as weight transfers from the assisted leg to the contralateral leg during double support. This exces- sive plantar-flexion can aggravate the foot-drop problem later in swing, during both walking and stair climbing. For sit to stand, the controller provides double the required torque, as body weight should be equally shared between the two legs. During sitting, excessive ankle and knee torques are applied as most of the weight is supported by the seat. These limitations must be overcome before this control approach can serve patient populations.\n']
response: 本文中采用的背驱式扭矩控制执行器通过高扭矩电机与低速比传动（24:1）的组合设计，在反向驱动扭矩控制在约3 Nm以内的同时，具备高达60 Nm的输出扭矩能力，从而兼顾了低反向驱动扭矩与高输出扭矩需求。
reference: 本文中所采用的背驱式扭矩控制执行器通过采用高扭矩电机与低传动比（24:1）相结合的设计，在结构上实现了低反向驱动扭矩（约3 Nm）与高输出扭矩能力（最高达60 Nm）的兼顾，从而满足康复应用中对柔顺控制与动力支持的双重需求。

response: 反馈补偿器通过动态方程 τm − τa = I¨θ 实现踝关节力矩误差的补偿控制，其中 τm 由驱动力测量得出，I 为踝关节转动惯量（包括电机惯性与传动增益修正），¨θ 为角加速度。该方程用于估计实际踝关节力矩 τa，并将其与 τm 相减后作为控制误差输入 PID 控制器，与控制信号 τc 相加实现反馈补偿。
reference: 反馈补偿器通过动态方程 τm − τa = Iθ̈ 估计踝关节实际力矩 τa，其中 I 由传动增益 G 和电机惯量 Im 计算得到。将 τa 与期望力矩 τm,des 对比得到误差，输入 PID 控制器生成补偿信号 τc，与前馈信号结合实现踝关节力矩误差的闭环补偿控制。

response: 实验中通过运动分析系统获取地面反作用力和压力中心位置数据的方式是：在楼梯的每个步骤及上层平台分别安装力板以测量地面反作用力，同时利用运动分析系统记录人体接触地面时的压力中心位置。文献未提供关于数据处理或整合的具体方法。
reference: 在实验中，通过在楼梯的每个台阶及上层平台分别安装力板，并连接运动分析系统（Motion Analysis system），可同步采集地面反作用力（GRF）与压力中心（COP）的位置数据。运动分析系统根据力板提供的力学信号进行处理，输出相应的力学参数。

user_input: 本文为何选择采集健全人群的双侧下肢运动学和肌电信号用于外骨骼控制策略研究？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n. Because exoskeletons serve as a supplement to the existing limb rather than a replacement, users have a “parallel” role in controlling LL movements. Exoskeleton users typically have biomechanically functional muscles (although neuropathologies may complicate the control of movement); exoskeletons are also often bilateral. Therefore, the objectives of this work were to (1) collect bilateral lower limb kinematic and myoelectric signals hypothetically accessible for exoskeleton control from an able-bodied population freely performing various locomotor activities, and (2) apply intent recognition for offline prediction to demonstrate the baseline viability of translating this type of control strategy from active LL prostheses to exoskeletons. Using bilateral lower limb kinematic and myoelectric signals to predict locomotor activities: A pilot study Blair H. Hu, IEEE Student Member, Elliott J. Rouse, IEEE Member, and Levi J. Hargrove, IEEE Member\n']
response: 本文选择采集健全人群的双侧下肢运动学和肌电信号，是因为外骨骼作为现有肢体的补充而非替代，要求用户在控制外骨骼运动时保持与自身肢体的“并行”作用；健全人群具备生物力学功能的肌肉，能够提供可靠的肌电信号；外骨骼通常为双侧结构，因此需要基于双侧下肢信号实现运动意图识别与控制；通过该研究可构建基线模型，验证外骨骼控制策略在真实场景中的可行性。
reference: 本文选择采集健全人群的双侧下肢运动学和肌电信号，是因为外骨骼作为辅助装置依赖用户残存的肌肉功能，且通常为双侧系统；通过采集此类信号，可模拟外骨骼控制中可能获得的输入，并用于运动意图识别，从而验证将主动假肢控制策略迁移至外骨骼的可行性。

user_input: 基于机器人辅助训练的方法在中风患者肩肘运动康复中的作用机制是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nthis practice is also becoming more widespread in Japan(2). Extensive research has been done on compensating for this lack of muscular strength using robotic technology, and on power assist technologies that would further boost muscular strength. Devices have also been developed that measure the amount of force the individual wishes to generate using electromyographs and force sensors, and boost their strength with power assist(3).  Meanwhile, some reports have indicated that the level of stress associated with a particular amount of exercise can be reduced simply by altering the way in which the individual moves(4)-(7). Rather than exerting force constantly from the beginning to the end of a movement, concentrating force at the appropriate time and then relying on inertia reduces heart rate, blood pressure, energy consumption(4)-(7).  In the case of walking also, research has commenced on a two-axis walk, which effectively uses changes in the center of gravity(7). In this mode of walking, virtual axes passing through the foot making contact with the ground, the knee, the hip joint, and the shoulder blade, move forward alternately on the left and right like a pair of stilts. The center of gravity moves forward without the upper and lower bodies twisting. This two-axis walk has  Fundamental Technology Research Center  ** Automobile R&D Center  – 57 –  Honda R&D Technical Review  October 2009  recently been used by Japanese athletes who have been said to be at a disadvantage in terms of physique and muscular strength. This technique has enabled them to supplement their muscular strength with gravity and inertia, and to achieve good results in world championships(8).  Robots are also being used while patients who have been paralyzed by strokes are being retrained in how to move their shoulders and elbows, in this case not to increase muscular strength but to teach patients the correct movements(9). The robot assists patients in moving their shoulders and elbows in the correct trajectory to enable them to grasp objects, generating a load if they move outside the appropriate trajectory. In this type of training process, results achieved using a robot are indicated as being superior to those achieved by normal training(9).\n']
response: 基于机器人辅助训练的方法在中风患者肩肘运动康复中的作用机制是：通过引导患者进行精确的运动轨迹训练，增强其对动作的控制能力；在偏离正确轨迹时施加负载，促使患者主动修正动作，强化运动学习过程；相较于传统训练，该方法在训练效果上更具优势，尤其在促进神经可塑性与功能恢复方面具有积极作用。
reference: 基于机器人辅助训练在中风患者肩肘运动康复中的作用机制主要涉及运动控制再学习，通过机器人引导患者在正确轨迹上完成肩肘动作，纠正错误运动模式并抑制代偿行为；同时优化运动时序以减少生理负荷，从而提高康复效率和运动控制精度，其优势在于优于传统训练方式的运动学习促进效果。

user_input: 自适应优化算法如何提升基于IMU的关节角度估计精度？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nComponent technology Control Accurate joint-angle estimation has proven invaluable in planning assistance. Most rigid systems use encoders on actuated joints to deter- mine joint angles; however, devices without rigid joints cannot rely  Nature Biomedical Engineering  Ref.  179  177  175  178  172  171  173  174  163  158  159  160  162  165  161  191  112  113  176  122  168  109  110  164  on encoders and thus must use other sensors (for example, inertial measurement units; IMUs192,193) to determine joint angles. IMUs are lightweight, inexpensive and easy to integrate into robotic systems, but also particularly sensitive to their physical alignment with biological joints (a challenge that rigid devices do not face). Furthermore, ori- entation measurements from IMUs suffer from inherent inaccuracies owing to bias (a constant offset compared to the true IMU orientation) and drift (a history-dependent change in orientation), which render measurements unusable within minutes if left uncorrected. Therefore, ensuring consistent alignment without first making precise measure- ments is difficult, hence IMU-based joint angles can be highly variable depending on placement. Importantly, asking wearers to take precise measurements each time they put on an exoskeleton hinders com- mercial applications, for which usability is crucial. Misalignments can be corrected by optimization algorithms that automatically estimate the location of the IMU relative to a biological joint, greatly improving joint-angle estimation accuracy194–197. Integrating these algorithms with wearable devices may enable the development of controllers that leverage joint-angle estimates for targeted assistance without requiring rigid joints. Such motion sensing could also be a valuable tool in the evaluation of a wearer’s kinematic performance outside of laboratory settings and could allow for the assessment of interventions at home or in the community. Furthermore, small IMUs worn during walking could inform an algorithm that determines the primary joint (or joints) at which a person experiences a gait deficit, along with the severity of that deficit. A clinician could then recommend a device appropriate for this specific deficit.\n']
response: 自适应优化算法通过自动估计IMU相对于生物关节的位置，克服了其物理对准敏感性和测量漂移问题，从而显著提升了基于IMU的关节角度估计精度。该方法减少了对穿戴者进行额外测量的依赖，增强了外骨骼系统在实际应用中的可靠性和实用性。
reference: 自适应优化算法通过自动估计IMU相对于生物关节的位置，校正IMU的物理对准偏差，从而减少偏置和漂移引起的误差，显著提升基于IMU的关节角度估计精度。该方法无需用户每次穿戴时手动进行精确校准，增强了系统的实用性，适用于无刚性关节的可穿戴外骨骼控制。

response: 基于工作空间加速度的多自由度运动控制方法通过实时反馈工作空间加速度信息，动态调整冗余机械臂各自由度的关节角速度与加速度，从而实现高精度、高响应的实时运动生成与控制。该方法结合了运动学与动力学补偿机制，并通过扭矩无源感控制提升系统稳定性，适用于复杂动态任务。
reference: 基于工作空间加速度的多自由度运动控制方法通过在加速度层面设计控制律，实现冗余机械臂的实时运动生成。该方法利用工作空间中的加速度信息进行运动规划与控制，能够快速响应轨迹变化，并通过优化策略处理冗余自由度，从而在动态环境中生成稳定且自然的运动轨迹。尽管具体实现细节未在参考文本中披露，但其在IEEE工业电子会议上的发表表明该方法具备实时性和工程应用潜力。

user_input: 文中提出的三层助力控制器分别解决了哪些关键问题？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nFor the purpose of the experiment, the controller has been implemented on a modified version of the ALEX II gait trainer (Fig. 1) [47] and experimentally tested on ten healthy subjects. Muscle activation and joint kinematics were recorded while subjects walked on a treadmill at a constant speed in three different conditions: free walking (i.e., no exoskeleton worn by the user), zero torque (i.e., exoskeleton working in transparent mode) and assisted (i.e., exoskeleton providing additional torque). Experimental results show that the controller successfully assisted the user as evidenced by a marked decrease of muscle activations, measured through electromyography, compared to free walking. Despite providing assistance only to the hip joint, both hip and ankle muscles significantly reduced their activation, demonstrating a clear tradeoff between these two joints in propelling gait.  Preliminary results have been reported in a conference [48].  II. METHODS  This section provides details of the assistive controller and its implementation on ALEX II gait trainer. Then, this section describes the experiment protocol and data analysis.  A. The Assistive Controller  In this paper, we explore this hypothesis by designing and testing a novel assistive controller that provides additional torque at the hip joint only, while allowing users to control their own kinematics.  The proposed assistive controller (Fig. 2(a)) is composed of three stages that address the following issues: (1) on-line estimate of the current phase of the gait cycle, (2) planning of the assistive torque, and (3) effective transfer of the desired assistive torque to the user’s leg.  Assistive controllers usually define the additional torque provided by the exoskeleton based on an estimate of the user’s joint torque [34],[35]. This approach allows having assistive torques that are coherent in direction and amplitude with the mechanical action of muscles. Following this approach, assistive torque profiles have been estimated through electromyography [36]-[38], solving the inverse- dynamic problem [39], or by applying algorithms based on inertia reduction [40], gait segmentation [41] and position- based force fields [42].\n']
response: 文中提出的三层助力控制器分别解决了以下关键问题：第一层实现了对步态周期当前相位的在线估计，以确保助力时机的精准；第二层规划了与肌肉作用方向一致的助力扭矩，以实现协调助力；第三层确保了所期望的助力能够有效传递至用户腿部，提升控制的实用性与肌肉激活的改善效果。
reference: 文中提出的三层助力控制器分别解决了以下三个关键问题：(1) 在线估计步态周期相位，以实现对运动状态的实时感知；(2) 规划与用户肌肉作用协调一致的助力扭矩；(3) 将规划的助力扭矩有效传递至用户的腿部，以实现实际助力效果。

user_input: 参与者在实验中进行的地面行走与跑步机行走训练有何不同作用？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nMethods Study and Participant Information. Approval for this study was granted by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) Institutional Review Board under protocol #13-CC-0210. All research was carried out in accord- ance with the guidelines and regulations of the NIH. We recruited children and adolescents with a diagnosis of crouch gait from spastic diplegic CP. Seven participants met our inclusion criteria and completed our exploratory clinical study, which included the Gross Motor Function Classification System (GMFCS) level of I or II and the absence of any health condition, besides CP, that could impact safety. We obtained informed assent from each participant and consent from their parents. Participant information is listed in Table 1.  Participants completed six visits at the NIH Clinical Center over the course of 8–12 weeks (Fig. 1a). The first visit included a clinical evaluation and lower-extremity casting for fabrication of custom thermoplastic braces. For subsequent training visits, each lasting 2–3 hours, the participants practiced walking with the exoskeleton over-ground and on a treadmill (Fig. 1b) with and without assistance as tolerated. Seated breaks, lasting approx- imately 5–15 minutes, were provided as frequently as needed to minimize fatigue. Actual walking duration for each participant is presented in Fig. 1c. The experimental biomechanics data presented in this study were col- lected on the sixth visit during treadmill walking. Treadmill speed and level of exoskeleton extension torque were established based on participant preference over the course of the training visits.\n']
response: 参与者在实验中进行的地面行走与跑步机行走训练分别用于评估外骨骼在真实环境和可控环境中的人机交互性能。地面行走训练侧重于运动表现评估，而跑步机行走则用于采集生物力学数据并进行个性化设置，两者共同用于研究外骨骼在不同行走条件下的功能适应性。
reference: 在实验中，地面行走训练主要用于实际功能适应与训练，帮助参与者在真实环境中使用外骨骼；而跑步机行走则用于标准化数据采集，便于生物力学分析。文献未明确描述两者在运动控制或康复机制上的具体差异。

response: 软体外骨骼系统在改善中风患者步态对称性方面采用的关键控制方法包括：基于split-belt treadmill训练的步态适应策略、任务导向的生物反馈、推进力变异性调节以及定向言语引导。这些方法通过动态调整步态参数和提供结构化反馈，促进患者的步态对称性改善。
reference: 软体外骨骼系统在改善中风患者步态对称性方面采用的关键控制方法包括：任务导向的生物反馈（task-oriented biofeedback）、分裂带（split-belt）跑步机训练、推进力增强（augmenting propulsion）策略以及目标导向的言语提示（targeted verbal cues）。这些方法通过促进步态适应、增强患侧推进力和实时调整步态参数，共同提升步态对称性。

user_input: 动态深蹲作为闭链运动被广泛应用于膝关节康复，文中提到哪些具体的康复应用场景？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe dynamic squat exercise is an integral part of  strength and conditioning programs for many sports that require high levels of strength and power, such as football, track and field, powerlifting, and Olympic weightlifting. The squat primarily strengthens hip, thigh, and back musculature, which are very important muscles in running, is commonly believed among athletes and coaches that the squat enhances athletic performance and minimizes injury potential. Because the dynamic squat has been classified as a closed kinetic chain exercise (17,58,65,71), it is also appropriate and commonly used in knee rehabilitation settings. Several studies have demonstrated the favorable use of the squat exercise during knee rehabilitation (21,32,39,47,52,58,71), such as after cruciate ligament reconstructive surgery. Consequently, an understanding of knee biomechanics during the squat is helpful to therapists, trainers, sports medicine physicians,  jumping, and lifting. It  0195-9131/01/3301-0127/$3.00/0 MEDICINE & SCIENCE IN SPORTS & EXERCISE® Copyright © 2001 by the American College of Sports Medicine  researchers, coaches, and athletes who are interested in closed kinetic chain exercises, knee rehabilitation, and train- ing for sport.  The bodyweight (BW) squat, barbell squat, and machine squat are the most common methods employed while per- forming the dynamic squat in training and rehabilitation. The squat begins with the individual in the upright position with the knees and hips fully extended. The individual then squats down in a continuous motion until a desired squat depth is obtained and then in a continuous motion ascends back to the upright position. The barbell squat is performed with the barbell across the back (back squat) slightly above (high bar squat) or below (low bar squat) the level of the acromion, or with the barbell held in front of the chest approximately at the level of the clavicles (front squat). The back squat is usually preferred and performed by most athletes in sport, although the front squat is commonly performed by bodybuilders and Olympic weightlifters. The front squat is simulated during the clean and jerk exercise by Olympic weightlifters. The machine squat is also performed in training and rehabilitation. The machine squat is typically performed using a special barbell that moves within a fixed groove (e.g., the Smith Machine squat) or by using padded  Received for publication February 2000. Accepted for publication March 2000.  127\n']
response: 文中明确指出动态深蹲被用于膝关节康复的具体应用场景是“after cruciate ligament reconstructive surgery”（重建前交叉韧带手术后）。其他康复场景未在参考文本中提及。
reference: 文中提到动态深蹲作为闭链运动被广泛应用于膝关节康复，具体应用场景包括前十字韧带重建术后康复，并通过徒手深蹲、杠铃深蹲和器械深蹲等形式进行康复训练。

At present, we can only hypothesize how these diﬀerential CME responses between interventions translate into functional movement. Perhaps improved excitability at the RF means that the SMA increases hip ﬂexion or knee extension, supported by our previousﬁndingthattheSMAgroupshowedgreaterincreases in step length on the impaired limb.4 Conversely, without hip assist, the FTST group may have become more practiced at dorsiﬂexion to ensure ground clearance of the foot during walking, thereby strengthening connectionsof the paretic TA. Kinematic data would be beneﬁcial to further quantify these gait-related changes.  guided setting. Future work will examine community mobility and clinical outcomes in a long-term study of individuals wearing the device in the real world, as a potential tool to improve mobility and facilitate at-home and community rehabilitation.\n']
response: SMA组在股直肌（RF）兴奋性上表现出更显著的增强，可能反映髋关节屈曲能力的提升，从而改善步长；而FTST组在胫骨前肌（TA）兴奋性上变化更显著但不显著，可能反映踝背屈动作增强以改善足部离地控制。这些CME差异可能与步态功能改善相关，但文献未提供直接证据支持，推测SMA通过增强髋部驱动改善步态，FTST通过增强踝部控制促进稳定行走。
reference: SMA组在股直肌（RF）表现出更显著的皮质运动兴奋性（CME）变化，可能增强髋关节屈曲或膝关节伸展，从而改善患肢步长；FTST组在胫前肌（TA）的兴奋性变化趋势更大，可能通过增强踝关节背屈提高步行时足部离地能力。这些差异可能反映了两种干预方式对步态功能改善的不同神经调控机制。

user_input: 研究中采用了哪些定量和定性评估方法来全面分析外骨骼辅助对不同病理特征患者的运动功能改善效果？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nWe investigated two highly impaired cases of MS and PPS. The manual muscle test (MMT) and clinician assessment of the PPS patient revealed that he had a highly impaired (atrophied) right  75  leg from the hip down, and quadriceps weakness in his left side. Accordingly, discussion with the patient and on-site clinician highlighted the need to assist knee extension especially during sit- stand-sit and stairs ascent which the patient found the most challenging. Performance assessments during sit-stand and stair ascent were therefore our primary metrics. We hypothesized that after appropriate controller customization for the PPS patient, our novel bilateral exoskeleton would improve the results of the five times sit to stand (5xSTS) test, and time to ascend a 5-step staircase. The MMT and clinician assessment of the MS patient revealed he had reduced knee flexion strength (greatly exacerbated by quadriceps spasticity) and severely hampered hip flexion capa- bility. Functionally, his prominent deficit was leg clearance (worse on the left side) leading to compensatory circumduction. Accordingly, our primary metrics were sagittal knee and frontal shank kinematics. We hypothesized that after appropriate controller customization, exoskeleton assistance would increase the MS patient’s peak knee flexion angle (assessing leg clearance), and reduce peak shank abduction angle (assessing circumduction).  For both patients, we performed a battery of assessments to explore the effects of exoskeleton assistance for a wide array of tasks (including exploratory assessments beyond the primary out- comes described above). We performed two common gait tests: the timed up and go (TUG) test and six meter walk test (6MWT). We also assessed the times to ascend and descend a staircase and ramp. Finally we acquired subjective feedback on exoskeleton effectiveness for the various tasks completed using a modified QUEST questionnaire.  6.2 Methodology  6.2.1 Clinician-friendly android app (GUI) interface development\n']
response: 研究中采用定量评估方法包括：五次坐站测试（5xSTS）、五步楼梯时间、TUG测试、6MWT以及膝关节和胫骨的矢状面与额状面运动学参数；定性评估方法包括手动肌肉测试（MMT）、临床医生评估、改良 QUEST 问卷以及个性化控制器设置的主观反馈收集。
reference: 研究中采用的定量评估方法包括：五次坐立试验（5xSTS）、上下楼梯时间测试、计时起立行走测试（TUG）、六米步行测试（6MWT）以及运动学分析（如膝关节屈曲峰值角度和小腿外展峰值角度）。定性评估方法为改良版QUEST问卷，用于收集患者对外骨骼辅助效果的主观反馈。这些方法共同构成了一个涵盖功能表现、运动控制和患者体验的全面评估体系。

user_input: TPAD外骨骼系统相较于其他步态训练设备在惯性负载方面具有哪些优势？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nRecently, robotic training paradigms for CP children have been proposed. The most widely used device is Lokomat, which is a rigid robot that moves the lower limbs in the sagittal plane using position control (25). Studies with this device have shown mixed outcomes in gait improvements, and this was attributed to lack of the child’s active participation in the study (25–27). An overground gait train- er, “CPWalker,” was used to apply partial body weight support with control of hip flexion-extension and knees in position mode (28). Training with CPWalker was performed for 5 weeks with three CP children, but the outcomes for the posture were inconsistent (29). Another study conducted by Lerner et al. (30) used a robotic exo- skeleton that provides torque assistance to change the posture during walking and enhance the muscle’s ability to extend the limbs. Wearing the exoskeleton changed the muscle patterns and joint angles positive- ly, but the training effects without the exoskeleton were not presented. Compared with other robotic devices that could be potentially used for gait training of children with CP, TPAD offers some unique advan- tages: (i) TPAD does not add inertia to the human body. TPAD only adds 320 g on the child, which is 10 to 20 times smaller compared with other devices (24). This is important for children with small body size and weight. Added inertia on the child’s body can result in undesirable\n']
response: TPAD外骨骼系统相较于其他步态训练设备在惯性负载方面具有显著优势，其仅在儿童身上增加了320克的惯性负载，是其他设备的10至20倍。这种低惯性设计有助于改善肌肉激活模式和关节角度，提升训练效果，同时不会干扰儿童的自然运动控制与参与，从而在CP儿童的步态训练中展现出更优的适应性与安全性。
reference: TPAD外骨骼系统相较于其他步态训练设备在惯性负载方面的主要优势在于其轻量化设计，仅增加320克负载，比其他设备减少10至20倍的惯性负载，从而更适应儿童较小的身体尺寸和较低的体重承受能力。

user_input: 本文如何通过训练提升穿戴者对外骨骼膝关节支撑期屈曲的适应性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nignored stance ﬂexion [50], [51] due to the wearer’s pref- erence. This was because the wearers might have already adapted to their previous daily passive devices, which usually locked the knee joint to a full extension for weight support during stance. In addition, some wearers reported a sense of instability when the prosthesis knee ﬂexed during stance [52]. In our study, training of the subjects helped them to become conﬁdent and comfortable with the prosthesis knee stance ﬂexion in walking. More importantly, we noted knee stance ﬂexion during early stance across all subjects from those tests that rendered the best stance time symmetry (Fig. 6). Since shock absorption after foot contact is pertinent to breaking impulse, the observation further conﬁrmed the importance of prosthesis knee control in early stance. Generating knee stance ﬂexion with eccentric torque in early stance might be necessary for prosthesis control to improve gait symmetry. However, there is no clear relationship between the prosthesis features and the gait symmetry index, and the target knee kinematics in this study cannot guarantee the best stance time symmetry for each participant. Hence, personalizing the target knee features may be necessary in order to minimize gait asymmetry.\n']
response: 本文通过训练穿戴者使其适应假体膝关节在步行支撑期的屈曲状态，增强了其信心与舒适度，并观察到早期站立初期生成膝关节屈曲有助于提升步态对称性。虽然文中未明确说明训练方法，但指出个性化目标膝关节特征可能是减少步态不对称的关键，表明适应性训练需根据个体差异进行优化。
reference: 本文通过训练提升穿戴者对外骨骼膝关节支撑期屈曲的适应性，具体方法是让受试者在行走过程中逐渐适应假肢膝关节在支撑期的屈曲行为，从而增强其信心与舒适感。研究发现，训练后受试者在支撑期早期表现出膝关节屈曲，并在获得最佳支撑时间对称性的测试中实现该行为，这表明训练有效促进了适应性。尽管未发现假肢特征与步态对称性之间的明确关系，但结果提示个性化调整目标膝关节运动参数可能是提升适应性、减少步态不对称性的关键。

user_input: RMS转矩跟踪误差在确定最优控制增益过程中起到了怎样的作用？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nFor each combination of desired and passive stiﬀnesses, the initial session had fairly low proportional and damping gains. The gains were gradually increased across trials until perceptible oscillations were detected with maximum damping gain. Depending on the initial gains and step sizes of gain tuning, number of trials varies for each stiﬀness combination. Sometimes, the gains are lowered in the ﬁnal sessions to achieve better gain tuning resolution. On average, around ten trials were conducted for each stiﬀness combination.  Identiﬁcation of the best torque tracking performance for a speciﬁc desired and passive stiﬀness combination is crucial. The step-wise root-mean-squared (RMS) torque tracking errors averagedovertheonehundredsteadystepsforeachexperimental trial was calculated as its performance indicator. For each combination of desired and passive stiﬀnesses, the RMS error values of all trials with diﬀerent gains were compared. The lowest of them was recorded as the estimate of optimal torque error for the corresponding stiﬀness combination. The control gains of the corresponding data set were recorded as the estimates of optimal control gains. response: RMS转矩跟踪误差在确定最优控制增益过程中起到了关键作用，通过计算不同增益设置下的平均误差，并选择最小误差值作为该组合的最优控制增益估计，从而实现对控制参数的系统优化。
reference: RMS转矩跟踪误差在确定最优控制增益过程中起到了性能评估与优化指导的关键作用。它是通过计算100个稳定步态周期内的均方根误差来评估每次试验的跟踪性能，并用于比较不同增益组合下的控制效果，最终选取使RMS误差最小的控制增益作为最优增益。

user_input: 背驱式执行器与传统执行器相比，在动力学响应方面有哪些优势？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nIn treating individuals with disorders like crouch gait from CP, which has multiple potential contributing factors, it is realistic that not all individuals would respond in the same way to robotic assistance. Not surprisingly, there was a clear variation in walking ability, both with and without exoskeleton assistance, across our cohort. Qualitatively, some individuals were able to walk more naturally in the exoskeleton assist-on condition than others. The additional challenge posed by walking on the treadmill may have also contributed to this spectrum of comfort. While P5 and P6 demonstrated clinically significant improvements in knee extension for at least one parameter (e.g. peak knee extension or knee extension at initial contact) for at least one of their limbs during the exoskeleton assisted treadmill walking trials, they exhibited greater improvement during over-ground walking32. One participant (P7) visibly struggled with walking on the treadmill at baseline with only 4 strides available for analysis (Table 1). P7 also struggled to acclimate to the exoskeleton during treadmill and over-ground walking as she exhibited increased knee flexion in both the assist-on and assist-off conditions, a posture that she likely adopted to increase stability and comfort level. As a result, she also showed an increased biological knee exten- sor moment across the stance phase with the exoskeleton (Supplemental Fig. 1). It should be noted that even in this more crouched posture, the biological knee moment was reduced with the exoskeleton assist-on compared  8  to assist-off. This participant had greatly increased dorsiflexion during walking in the exoskeleton compared to baseline, suggesting that combining motorized knee assistance with an ankle condition that more closely resem- bled her prescribed AFO during typical walking would have improved outcomes. In this study, we chose to use a free ankle for all participants to isolate the effects of robotic assistance at the knee. In the future, combining the exoskeleton with an AFO at the ankle may give improved results for individuals in whom ankle dorsiflexion also contributes to crouch. Furthermore, additional walking practice with the exoskeleton would likely also improve outcomes.\n']

C(θ, ˙θ) is the Coriolis and centrifugal matrix. G(θ) is the gravity matrix. θ is the joint angle, and T = [T1 ,T2]T represents the torque.  Eq.(1) is used to calculate the joint torque based on the Lagrange dynamic model, and the calculated joint torque is employed in the TCN-LSTM model based on joint attention mechanism, which adopts multi-sensor data to estimate the joint torque. In order to calculate the joint torque, the joint velocity and acceleration are typically obtained through Qual- isys motion capture system. The length of the thigh and calf can be measured directly. The mass of the thigh and calf can be estimated in accordance with the national standard about inertial parameters of Chinese adults [21].  m = B0 + B1 × X1 + B2 × X2  where X1 represents individual weight (kg), X2 represents height (mm), and B0, B1 and B2 are the corresponding regression coefficients.  III. TCN-LSTM MODEL BASED ON JOINT ATTENTION MECHANISM  The bottleneck attention module (BAM) was proposed by Park et al. [22]. BAM integrates the dual advantages of spatial attention mechanism and channel attention mechanism, which can focus not only on the importance of spatial features but also significantly enhance the representation ability of features. The image has three dimensions. C, H, and W represent the number of channels, the height of features, and the width of features for image processing, respectively. The time series is one-dimensional, and C represents the step size of the time series. Therefore, the width of features is 1, and H represents the number of features in the time series. The input feature F ∈ RC×H is transformed through one 1×1 convolution, two 3 × 3 dilation convolutions, and one 1 × 1 convolution. The dimension of output feature is C × 1, as shown in Fig. 4.\n']
response: 在TCN-LSTM模型中，关节注意力机制通过引入瓶颈注意力模块（BAM）结合时序卷积网络（TCN）实现对关节力矩的高效估计。BAM融合了空间与通道注意力机制，增强关键特征的表示能力；TCN则通过卷积操作处理时序数据，提升对动态变化的建模能力。两者协同作用，使模型能够自适应关注关节状态变化，从而提升关节力矩估计精度。
reference: 在TCN-LSTM模型中，关节注意力机制通过瓶颈注意力模块（BAM）结合空间与通道注意力机制，对时间序列中的关节特征进行加权，突出对关节力矩估计贡献较大的特征，从而提升关节力矩估计精度。具体而言，模型利用1×1卷积与膨胀卷积提取特征，并通过注意力权重增强关键时间步与关键关节的输入表示，实现更精确的力矩预测。

response: 外骨骼通过将髋关节扭矩 τ 参数化为归一化踏板行程 ϕ 的函数，采用对称区间设计实现伸展与屈曲扭矩的同步控制。其中，伸展扭矩与屈曲扭矩在 ϕ = 0.5 ± ϕ_0 处对称达到峰值，并通过 cos(π(ϕ - 0.5)) 函数确保对称性。该控制策略使外骨骼能够根据踏板运动周期自动调节髋关节扭矩输出，实现骑行过程中的对称伸展与屈曲辅助。

user_input: 研究中使用KT-1000关节测量仪评估膝关节稳定性的测试方法有哪些？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nPanariello et al. (49) examined the effect of the squat exercise on anteroposterior knee translation in professional football players. Thirty-two subjects with normal knees participated in a 21-wk off-season conditioning program involving the parallel squat. Two periodization training cy- cles were utilized during the 21 wk. The first cycle was 12 wk in duration, immediately followed by a 9-wk cycle. The squat was performed twice a week, with subjects performing an average of 32 repetitions per session and lifting an average of 130–200% BW. A knee ligament arthrometer KT-1000 (Medmetric Corp., San Diego, CA) was used to measure anteroposterior knee stability. Both knees of each subject were tested passively and actively at 30° and 90° knee flexion before the start of the training program, at the end of the 12-wk cycle, and at the end of the 9-wk cycle. Passive anterior drawer tests were conducted with 67 N (15 lbs), 89 N (20 lbs), and 133 N (30 lbs) of force, whereas passive posterior drawer tests were conducted with 67 N and 89 N of force. Active tests were conducted with maximum voluntary isometric contractions of the quadriceps and ham- strings. Mean anterior and posterior drawer measurements were compared between the start of the training program and the end of the 12-wk cycle, between the end of the 12-wk cycle and the end of the 9-wk cycle, and between the start of the training program and the end of the 9-wk cycle. There were no significant differences between any pair of pre- and post-exercise measurements, and no significant differences in anteroposterior knee translations in athletes using the squat as part of their training regimen. Hence, it was deduced that the squat is a safe exercise to include in an athlete’s training program.  CONCLUSIONS  This review examined knee biomechanics during the dy- namic squat exercise. Low to moderate posterior shear forces were generated throughout the squat, restrained primarily by  http://www.acsm-msse.org\n']
response: 研究中使用KT-1000关节测量仪评估膝关节稳定性的测试方法包括：被动与主动两种方式；被动测试分别在30°和90°膝关节屈曲下进行，包括前抽屉（67 N、89 N、133 N）和后抽屉（67 N、89 N）测试；主动测试通过股四头肌和腘绳肌的最大自主等长收缩来评估主动稳定性。所有测试均在训练前后进行比较。
reference: 使用KT-1000关节测量仪评估膝关节稳定性的测试方法包括被动和主动测试。被动测试分别在膝关节屈曲30°和90°下进行，前抽屉试验使用67 N、89 N和133 N的载荷，后抽屉试验使用67 N和89 N的载荷。主动测试通过股四头肌和腘绳肌最大自主等长收缩进行。测试在训练开始前、12周周期结束和9周周期结束时进行，用于评估动态负荷对膝关节前后稳定性的影响。

Experimental Methods  A participant with an above-knee amputation (sex: male, age: 26 years, mass: 116 kg, height: 1.9 m, K-level: 4, cause of amputation: congenital, time since amputation: 26 years) was recruited to participate in the experiment. The protocol was approved by the Institutional Review Board of the University of Michigan (HUM00166976) and the participant wore a ceiling-mounted safety harness while walking on the treadmill. The proposed HKIC and the comparison FSMC were im- plemented on a backdrivable, powered knee-ankle prosthesis, shown in Fig. 4 and described in depth in [39]. A licensed prosthetist ﬁt the prosthesis to the participant and ensured proper alignment. The participant was instructed on the ex- pected high-level behavior of each controller and given time to acclimate to each while walking overground within parallel bars. Following this overground acclimation, 5 trials with each controller were conducted on an in-ground split-belt treadmill (Bertec, Columbus, Ohio, USA). The treadmill had instru- mented handrails on either side for safety, and the participant was instructed to limit handrail body weight support when possible to maximize the realism of the experiment. The instrumented handrail data showed that the subject did not heavily rely on the handrails with either controller.\n']
response: 在连续变化任务试验中，参与者对不同控制器（HKIC与FSMC）的依赖手扶栏杆情况均未出现显著差异，表明两种控制器均具备良好的地形适应性和稳定性控制能力，能够在任务空间中实现稳定步态，减少对环境辅助设备（如手扶栏杆）的依赖，说明其控制性能优异。

user_input: 实验如何验证髋关节助力时机与步行代谢成本之间的关系？主要实验结果指标是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nRecent work with hip and ankle exoskeletons has focused on the goal of reducing the metabolic cost of walking, and research- ers have succeeded in a number of experiments (Ronsse et al., 2011; Mooney et al., 2014; Ding et al., 2016a,b; Ruiz Garate et al., 2016; Seo et al., 2016). Research groups have used both rigid exoskeletons (Ruiz Garate et al., 2016), as we use in our experiment, and soft exoskeletons to test the effect of different hip assistance strategies on metabolic output (Ding et al., 2016a; Panizzolo et al., 2016). A wide variety of control systems have been proposed (Aguirre-Ollinger, 2013; Jang et al., 2015; Koller et al., 2015; Oh et al., 2015; Takahashi et al., 2015; Wu et al., 2015; Yan et al., 2015; Ao et al., 2016; Chen et al., 2016; Ding et al., 2016b; Zhang et al., 2016), but typically tests are done on a unique device with only one controller. Oscillator-based controllers tend to be popular for hip exoskeletons due to the reliance on only hip joint angle sensing for control (Ronsse et al., 2011; Giovacchini et al., 2014; Seo et al., 2016; Yan et al., 2016; Sugar et al., 2017). More recent exoskeletons are becoming completely autonomous, using oscillation-based approaches to provide walking assistance that reduces the metabolic cost of walking (Seo et al., 2016).  The overall aim of this work was to determine the optimal tim- ing for supplying hip power using an exoskeleton to assist human walking. This is a useful goal to aid the field in understanding the relationship between hip assistance timing and metabolic cost of walking. The experiment aimed to identify separately the value of hip flexion and hip extension assistance and determine the best timing interval during the gait cycle for supplying powered assistance for both movement types. The primary outcome meas- ure was the metabolic cost of walking. We hypothesized that the controller timings that generated a pattern of exoskeleton torque most similar to the biological torque pattern would produce  the largest reduction in metabolic cost (Malcolm et al., 2013). A secondary outcome measure was user preference. We tested the hypothesis that users would prefer conditions with powered assistive timing that incurred a lower metabolic cost on the user. The primary aim achieved was assessing the effects of hip timing on human performance using an exoskeleton.  MaTerials anD MeThODs\n']
response: 实验通过测量不同助力时机下步行代谢成本的变化，并结合用户偏好评估其对髋关节助力时机与代谢成本之间关系的验证。主要实验结果指标为步行代谢成本，次要指标为用户对助力时机的主观偏好。
reference: 实验通过在不同步态周期提供髋关节助力，测量其对步行代谢成本的影响，主要结果指标为代谢成本（通常通过氧气消耗量计算），次要指标为用户偏好。实验使用基于髋关节角度的振荡器控制器调节助力时机，并分别评估髋屈与髋伸阶段的助力效果，以确定最佳助力时机窗口。

user_input: 相较于传统的物理治疗方法，TPAD训练在改善屈膝步态方面具备哪些潜在优势？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n5 of 11  f r o m h t t p : / / r o b o t i c s . s c e n c e m a g . o r g / b y  i  g u e s t  o n  J u y  l  3 0 ,  2 0 1 7  Clinical evaluations were conducted twice, 1 week before the first training and 2 weeks after the last training. Six Minute Walk test (be- fore: 361 ± 28.56 m; after: 403.67 ± 46.38 m), Pediatric Berg Balance Scale (BBS) (before: 49.67 ± 3.98; after 49.50 ± 3.83), and Timed Up and Go (TUG) test (before: 9.26 ± 2.58; after: 8.97 ± 1.95) were eval- uated, but no significant improvement was found after the training for BBS (P = 0.785 with r = 0.079) and TUG test (P = 0.345 with r = 0.272). Six Minute Walk test showed significant improvement (P = 0.028 with r = 0.635). Individual values are presented in table S1.  DISCUSSION This study shows the feasibility that training with TPAD using down- ward pull force can improve walking of CP children with crouch gait. The lower limbs have increased extension after the training, showing stronger soleus muscles. Improved vertical pelvic ROM and decreas- ing trend of trunk angle are also observed. In addition, children who participated in this study showed improvements in walking ability, for example, step length, walking speed, symmetry, and foot clearance. Currently, there is no well-established physical therapy or strengthen-  ing exercise for the treatment of crouch gait (39); TPAD training with downward pelvic pull could be a promising intervention for these children.\n']
response: TPAD训练相较于传统物理治疗方法，在改善屈膝步态方面具备以下潜在优势：1）通过主动肌肉刺激增强比目鱼肌力量；2）改善下肢伸展能力；3）提升步行参数如步长、行走速度和对称性；4）提供系统性、动力学调节的干预手段，相较于传统疗法更具针对性与有效性。
reference: TPAD训练相较于传统物理治疗方法，在改善屈膝步态方面具备以下潜在优势：通过向下的骨盆牵引力增强下肢伸展能力，改善腓肠肌功能；提升步长、步行速度、对称性及足部离地高度；优化垂直骨盆运动范围并降低躯干倾斜趋势；且作为一种新型干预手段，其在尚无标准治疗方案的背景下展现出可行性和潜力。

user_input: 自对准外骨骼设计中的伪力和力矩是如何受关节轴线不对准影响的？实验数据如何支持这一结论？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe goal of the pDOFs is to prevent the spurious forces and torques on the user’s limb that can result from misalignments. the proposed self-aligning We hypothesized exoskeleton, misalignments between the exoskeleton joint axes will not result in an increase of spurious forces and torques on the user. To test this hypothesis, we have measured the interaction forces between the exoskeleton and the user across different alignment and assistance conditions. The analysis of the interaction forces (Fig. 11 and Fig. 13) shows that the spurious forces (Fx and Fy) and torques (Tx, Ty, Tz) were not visibly affected by the assistance level. On the other hand, Fz increased with the level of assistance. This result is not surprising given that Fz is roughly perpendicular to the user shank, and, therefore, it is not a spurious load. Relatively large standard deviations were observed in measured interaction forces (Fig. 11). The large standard deviation in Fz is likely due to inter-subject variability in sit-to-stand timing as our controller allows the subjects to stand up at their preferred speed. The standard deviations in all other forces and torques, are large relative to the value of the mean because the measured values themselves are small. The linear regression analysis showed that no forces or torques other than Fz were significantly correlated to the assistive joint torque. The measured peaks of the spurious forces and torques were 5 N and 0.5 Nm, respectively (Fig. 11). To put these numbers in perspective, a previous study [11] testing similar misalignment conditions using a powered exoskeleton with no self-aligning mechanism showed spurious forces and torques up to 50 N and 10 Nm, respectively. Thus, the analysis of the interaction forces and torques supports our hypothesis.  that,  in  the user and  B. Design and Control  The pDOFs in a self-aligning mechanism should be designed to work smoothly under the high load generated by the actuation system during assistance. The pDOFs should also be lightweight and unobtrusive, as adding significant weight or dimension to the exoskeleton may negate its assistive function [30]. The proposed design includes two pDOFs in the Sagittal\n']
response: 自对准外骨骼设计中，伪力（Fx、Fy）和伪力矩（Tx、Ty、Tz）不会因关节轴线不对准而显著增加。实验数据表明，无论辅助水平如何变化，伪力和伪力矩均未表现出与对准状态相关的显著变化。此外，Fz方向的力由于与用户小腿方向垂直而未被归类为伪力，进一步支持了该结论。实验测得的伪力和伪力矩峰值（5 N 和 0.5 Nm）远低于无自对准机制外骨骼中的水平（50 N 和 10 Nm），表明自对准机制有效减少了伪力和伪力矩的产生。
reference: 自对准外骨骼设计中的伪力（Fx, Fy）和力矩（Tx, Ty, Tz）在实验中未因关节轴线不对准而显著增加，实验数据显示其峰值分别为5 N和0.5 Nm，远低于无自对准机制的外骨骼（50 N和10 Nm）。线性回归分析进一步表明，除Fz外，其他力和力矩与辅助关节力矩无显著相关性，验证了自对准机制有效抑制了伪力和力矩的产生。

Michael Goldfarb (S'93–M'95) received the B.S. degree in mechanical engineering from the Univer- sity of Arizona, Tucson, AZ, USA, in 1988, and the S.M. and Ph.D. degrees in mechanical engineering from MIT, Cambridge, MA, USA, in 1992 and 1994, respectively. response: IHMC外骨骼系统通过人机协同控制、环境感知与力控策略实现步态规划与运动控制的稳定性与适应性。系统结合传感器数据实时调整步态参数，支持站立-行走与坐-站转换，并采用闭环控制机制调节下肢关节力矩与角度，确保动态平衡与地形适应性。
reference: IHMC外骨骼系统通过任务驱动的步态规划、多层控制结构、传感器融合与参数自适应机制，结合动态稳定性判据（如ZMP或捕获点），实现了在复杂环境下的稳定行走与良好适应性。文献[34]指出其系统设计目标为提升步态稳定性，而类似系统如HAL的研究表明，融合生物信号与外部传感器反馈的控制策略是增强适应性的关键技术手段。

response: 本文中基于QDD驱动的膝关节外骨骼在连续扭矩控制中需满足以下关键设计与控制要求：（1）轻量化设计以降低穿戴能耗并减少对腿部惯性的影响；（2）高带宽与低惯性特性以实现快速动态响应；（3）关节刚度需覆盖生物刚度范围（0–176 N·m/rad），以确保与人体膝关节行为一致；（4）具备高扭矩输出能力（如485 g质量、Φ100 mm × 37 mm尺寸）以支持不同行走速度下的辅助需求；（5）支持连续扭矩控制以实现多样化的膝关节辅助功能。
reference: 基于QDD驱动的膝关节外骨骼在连续扭矩控制中需满足以下关键设计与控制要求：1）系统应轻量化、紧凑，以减少穿戴的能耗负担并避免影响人体腿部惯性特性；2）膝关节刚度需覆盖生物膝关节的刚度范围（0–176 N·m/rad）；3）QDD驱动系统应具备高扭矩密度、低传动比及高带宽特性；4）驱动器需集成控制电子组件，并通过高性能微控制器实现高层控制，同时支持无线数据通信；5）性能参数应设定为超过1.25 m/s行走速度下所需的生物力学要求，以适应多种步态任务。

user_input: 自主式关节靶向外骨骼如何在不承重的前提下实现高效的力矩传递？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe mechanical designs and control strategies of joint-targeting exoskeletons with offboard actuation can be easily modified to explore the different physiological impacts of the designs; however, these sys- tems are restricted to treadmill-based studies, which may not reflect typical features of walking (such as changes in speed, direction or terrain). By contrast, autonomous systems allow the wearer to freely navigate unconstrained environments. The aim of joint-targeting exoskeletons is not to bear weight, hence autonomous devices do not require large rigid structures. However, rigid components are benefi- cial for efficiently transferring torques to the body; for example, rigid  Nature Biomedical Engineering  components and a distal actuator at the ankle decrease the metabolic cost of loaded and unloaded walking in unimpaired individuals69,70,87. Rigid devices have also been developed for assisting other joints, in particular the hip88–91 and the knee92,93, and for multijoint assistance94 (for example, the Cyberlegs project95). Moreover, rigid joint-targeting autonomous exoskeletons have been commercially developed for industrial, recreational and clinical applications, such as the Stride Management Assist (SMA)96–98 and the Gait Enhancing and Motivation System (GEMS)99,100. These autonomous bidirectional hip exoskeletons have been used to investigate new control schemes101–103, the augmen- tation of performance in unimpaired individuals104–106, the restoration of gait function in elderly adults107,108, improvements in gait and other mobility in people with CP109–111 and clinical effects post-stroke112,113.\n']
response: 自主式关节靶向外骨骼通过采用刚性结构和远端执行器，在不承重的前提下实现高效的力矩传递。该设计利用刚性元件确保动力稳定传递，结合控制策略优化关节辅助效果，同时支持自主移动环境，避免传统研究局限。
reference: 自主式关节靶向外骨骼通过采用局部刚性结构（如关节处的刚性连接与远端执行器）实现高效的力矩传递，同时避免整体承重需求，从而在自由环境中提供精准的关节辅助。

user_input: 如何通过表面肌电图（EMG）数据评估多地形任务中股四头肌的整体肌肉用力？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n5.2.2.3 Multi-terrain Quadriceps Effort  In session 2, after appropriate skin preparation, we secured five electromyography (EMG) electrodes (Trigno Avanti and Snap, Delsys, Massachusetts, USA) onto the subject’s right vas- tus medialis oblique (VM), vastus lateralis (VL), rectus femoris (RF), biceps femoris (BF), and  59  semitendinosus (ST) to assess muscle activation. Participants performed a maximum voluntary contraction (MVC) procedure comprising explosive jump squats (eliciting maximal dynamic con- traction) and maximal isometric contraction against manual resistance, which enabled EMG data to be normalized to %MVC.  To assess muscular effort we calculated the mean of the MVC-normalized RMS signal for each gait/task cycle. The RMS signal provided by the Delsys EMG acquisition software was used for this purpose (RMS window length: 125 ms, 122 ms overlap). The muscle recruitment pattern of the individual quadriceps muscles varies both intra- and inter-participant, but the force exerted by these muscles is similar for the same level of neural activation (due to similar cross-sectional areas). Since we were interested in gross quadriceps effort, and to reduce the number of degrees of freedom in our statistical analysis, we averaged the muscle efforts of the 3 quadriceps muscles that we recorded to get a gross quadriceps effort metric.  5.2.3 Statistical Analysis  We first confirmed normality of our data using QQ-plots. Muscular effort was analyzed using a linear mixed model (LMM) in MATLAB with restricted maximum likelihood estimation of pa- rameters. Data from our eight subjects were tabulated with information consisting of quadriceps muscle effort, condition (bare, exoskeleton), and gender (male, female). We defined exoskeleton conditions and gender as categorical variables and fit a separate LMM for each task, where the condition and gender are fixed effects and subject is a random effect:  Effort ∼ Condition+Gender+(1|Subject).\n']
response: 通过记录股四头肌（VM、VL、RF、ST、BF）的表面肌电图信号，进行最大自主收缩（MVC）归一化处理后，计算每个步态周期内各肌群的均方根（RMS）信号，并对三个主要股四头肌的RMS值进行平均，从而获得整体股四头肌用力指标。该方法结合EMG信号分析与统计建模，可系统评估多地形任务中股四头肌的总体肌肉用力。
reference: 通过表面肌电图（EMG）数据评估多地形任务中股四头肌的整体肌肉用力，首先对股四头肌的三个主要部分（VM、VL、RF）进行皮肤准备并贴附EMG电极，随后通过最大自主收缩（MVC）测试对EMG信号进行%MVC归一化处理。接着，利用125 ms窗口长度（122 ms重叠）的均方根（RMS）信号计算每个任务周期的平均肌肉用力。为评估整体股四头肌用力，将三个肌肉的用力值取平均，以减少统计自由度并反映整体用力趋势。最终，使用线性混合模型（LMM）分析不同任务条件和性别对整体股四头肌用力的影响。

user_input: 自适应阻抗控制如何实现人机协同中的动态稳定性调节？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nactivity during the  Knee Stability  Knee stability is paramount in enhancing an athlete’s performance and training, minimizing injury potential, or improving a patient’s knee rehabilitation. Normal tibial in- ternal rotation in knee flexion and tibial external rotation in knee extension (i.e., the screw home mechanism) that occurs when the foot is free to move changes during the squat exercise. Instead, the femur tends to rotate externally during knee flexion and internally during knee extension. As the femur externally rotates during the descent, the tibia also attempts to externally rotate. This is supported Costigan and Reid (12), who demonstrated that during the squat the tibia generated an external rotation torque against the ground during knee flexion and an internal rotation torque during knee extension. The flexion, extension, internal rotation, and external rotation knee movements that occur during the squat are supported in part by cruciate and collateral knee ligaments, which help provide knee stability. The ACL and PCL provide anteroposterior knee stability, while the MCL and LCL provide mediolateral knee stability. Knee ligament arthrometers can be employed to quantify anteroposterior  http://www.acsm-msse.org  and mediolateral knee stability by measuring anteroposte- rior and mediolateral tibial translation relative to the femur. This is important because excessive anteroposterior or me- diolateral knee translation measurements may indicate knee instability due to damage to the cruciate or collateral liga- ments. To date, there are seven known studies that examined how the dynamic squat affects anteroposterior or mediolat- eral knee stability (5,10,21,28,37,49,57).\n']

reference: 文献无相关内容。参考文本聚焦于膝关节在动态深蹲中的生物力学稳定性，未涉及自适应阻抗控制或其在人机协同中实现动态稳定性调节的方法。

retrieved_contexts: ['\n1  eliminated tuning altogether by using able-bodied kinematic data to generate continuous impedance parameter functions this method was limited to the knee of phase. However, joint, did not consider joint kinetics, and was never experi- mentally validated. Recently, [29] proposed a similar variable impedance controller where ankle stiffness and damping were deﬁned as polynomials in phase, and the coefﬁcients deﬁn- ing the polynomials were identiﬁed using constrained least squares with an able-bodied kinematic and kinetic dataset. The authors utilized piecewise-constant equilibrium angles and demonstrated continuous stiffness and damping expressions that produced satisfactory gait with a post-optimization tuning protocol. This work was later extended to include variable inclines and a phase variable parameterization of stiffness and damping based on the phase portrait of the thigh angle and its integral [30]. However, this phase variable is known to have challenges with non-steady walking [33], and changes in impedance associated with walking speed were not considered. The authors of [30] also note that their method of identifying the impedance parameters is non-convex, which does not guarantee a globally optimal solution [34] for their controller. This paper addresses these limitations by presenting a new phase-based, task-adaptive walking controller built on a hy- brid combination of continuously-variable impedance control during stance and kinematic control during swing (Fig. 1). Stance impedance control allows the controller to regulate the dynamic interaction between the user and the ground while swing kinematic control provides the user with indirect volitional control over foot position. We use an able-bodied kinematic and kinetic dataset [21] with constrained convex optimization to create a continuous model of stance joint stiffness, damping, and equilibrium angle, each parameterized by phase, walking speed, and ground incline. Paired with an analogous model of swing joint kinematics, our hybrid controller produces a biomimetic gait across varying tasks based on real-time phase and task estimates.\n']
response: 文中通过结合健康人体运动学与动力学数据及凸约束优化方法，构建了支撑期关节的刚度、阻尼和平衡角参数，这些参数分别由相位、步行速度和地面坡度进行连续参数化。
reference: 文中基于健康人体运动学与动力学数据及凸约束优化方法，构建了作为步态相位、步行速度与地面坡度函数的支撑期阻抗模型参数，包括关节刚度（stiffness）、阻尼（damping）与平衡角（equilibrium angle）。

reference: 基于时序信息的意图识别方法通过引入用户运动过程中的时间序列生理与机械信号，提升动力型下肢假肢在模式切换中的识别准确性。该方法利用历史数据增强对过渡状态的理解，结合神经肌肉与机械信号的融合分析，并优化切换控制模式的时机判断，从而实现更自然、稳定和实时的运动意图识别，显著提高假肢在复杂任务转换中的适应能力与控制性能。

user_input: 人体实验中M-TOES控制器在哪些外骨骼配置和任务场景下进行了验证，结果体现出怎样的稳定性与任务不变性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n30  the active modes in most tasks—VMO, GM, and SOL for treadmill and stairs tasks, and VMO for sit-stand. Fig. 3.3 quantifies this trend for EMG effort and provides intra-subject statistics for the various muscles and tasks.  3.5 Synopsis: Study 2  This study introduced and validated an improved, modular version of the optimized energy-shaping controller framework developed in study 1 above to cater to the different configurations of M- BLUE and other exoskeleton designs. First, we introduced a general-purpose, modular, convex- optimization-based framework for multi-task optimized energy shaping (M-TOES). This frame- work extended our previous optimization framework (in study 1) by adding certain key features of modular energy bases, convex penalties on incorrect torque sign, and unification of stance and swing controllers by use of the vertical GRF. Second, we rigorously analyzed the behavior of the target energy resulting from these controllers, including all possible power leaks due to practical relaxations of the matching conditions (criteria that determine the allowable kinematic inputs to the basis functions) and passivity. Third, we empirically validated the stability, modularity, and task-invariance of the resulting controllers with N = 8 able-bodied participants performing the pri- mary activities of daily life with four different configurations of the M-BLUE system: unilateral hip, bilateral hip, unilateral knee, and bilateral knee. For each modular configuration of the de- vice, the M-TOES controller is optimized across multiple tasks (including multi-speed walking, ramps, stairs, start-stop, and sit-to-stand tasks) from able-bodied datasets [Camargo et al., 2021; Laschowski et al., 2021]. The human subject experiments are detailed below.  3.6 Human Subject Methods: Study 2  In study 2, the M-TOES controller was generalized for different joint modules, and implemented on the M-BLUE exoskeleton system. The experimental methods for validating different configurations with healthy human subjects performing multiple ADLs are presented next.  3.6.1 Hardware Implementation: Study 2\n']
response: M-TOES控制器在单侧髋关节、双侧髋关节、单侧膝关节和双侧膝关节四种外骨骼配置下，针对多速步行、斜坡、楼梯、启动-停止和坐-站等任务进行了验证。实验结果显示，控制器在不同任务和外骨骼配置下保持了良好的稳定性，并具备任务不变性，表明其在多种运动模式和外骨骼模块中具有良好的适应性和一致性。
reference: M-TOES控制器在人体实验中于M-BLUE外骨骼系统的四种配置下进行了验证：单侧髋、双侧髋、单侧膝和双侧膝。验证任务涵盖多速度步行、坡道、楼梯、起停及坐站任务等主要日常生活活动（ADLs）。实验结果实证验证了控制器在不同配置与任务下的稳定性、模块性以及任务不变性。
