retrieved_contexts: ['\n. The peak quadriceps tendon force observed was the same as the 8,000 N peak force reported by van Eijden et al. (63). How much force the quadriceps tendon can generate before rupture is unclear. However, because Nisell and Ekholm (42) found that the thickness and breadth of the quadriceps tendon to be 35–40% greater than the thickness and breadth of the patellar tendon, it is likely that the ultimate strength of the quadriceps tendon is greater than the 10,000–15,000 N estimate for the ultimate strength of the patellar tendon. The peak posterior shear force reported by Nisell and Ekholm (43) is similar to the peak PCL tensile force calcu- lated by Escamilla et al. (17,18) and Wilk et al. (65) (Table 1), who also used powerlifters as subjects and quantified muscle forces. At approximately 60° knee flexion, the pos- terior shear force changed to an anterior shear force. This force increased fairly linearly throughout the remainder of the ascent. It is interesting that even though tremendous muscle forces were generated in the three subjects due to the large loads lifted, tensile forces in the PCL and ACL were only approximately 50% and 25%, respectively, of the es-\n']
response: 股四头肌腱的最大断裂力估计值高于髌腱的10,000–15,000 N估计值。
reference: 文中认为股四头肌腱的断裂力很可能高于髌腱的10,000–15,000 N估计值，依据是其厚度和宽度比髌腱大35–40%，从而推测其具有更高的承载能力。

user_input: 文中提到的脑瘫患者步态特征主要存在哪些异常表现？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nIndex Terms—Adaptive control, ankle assistance, cerebral palsy, exoskeleton, metabolic cost of transport, over-ground walking, plantarﬂexion, walking speed, soleus muscle activity.  I. INTRODUCTION  CEREBRAL palsy (CP)  child-onset is neuromuscular disorders and is the most common motor disability in childhood [1]. Individuals with CP have abnormal and inefﬁcient walking patterns [2] that can worsen with age until ambulatory ability is lost [3]. Surgical intervention for pathological walking patterns in individuals with CP, such as tendon lengthening, have proven to be only moderately effective in improving long-term mobility [4], [5]. Ankle- foot-orthoses (AFOs), commonly prescribed for ambulatory children with CP, also only have limited long-term beneﬁts on gait and mobility [6], [7].  a  set of  associated with CP are characterized by signiﬁcantly reduced positive ankle joint power during push-off [8], increased hip and knee joint ﬂexion, and reduced ankle plantarﬂexion and plantar-ﬂexor [9]. These inefﬁcient gait mechanics drastically power decrease walking speed [10], increase the energy cost of walking [11], and reduce levels of physical activity [12]. There is clear need for effective interventions that can improve free-living mobility, walking speed, and efﬁciency.  Pathological  gait  patterns  Powered ankle exoskeletons have demonstrated potential to reduce metabolic cost of transport during controlled treadmill walking. Several studies utilizing different exoskeleton designs during treadmill walking have reduced metabolic cost of trans- port in unimpaired adults [13]–[16]. In a feasibility study with CP participants, powered plantarﬂexion assistance provided by an untethered exoskeleton during treadmill walking improved net metabolic cost of transport in CP participants by 19 ± 5% compared to walking without wearing the device [17].  Manuscript received September 13, 2019; revised November 22, 2019 and December 28, 2019; accepted January 3, 2020. Date of publication January 8, 2020; date of current version February 12, 2020. This work was supported in part by the NSF under Grant 1756029 and in part by the NIH under Grant 1R15HD099664. (Correspondingauthor: ZacharyF.Lerner.)  Greg Orekhov, Ying Fang, and Jason Luque are with the Mechanical Engineering Department, Northern Arizona University, Flagstaff, AZ 86011 USA.\n']
response: 脑瘫患者的步态特征主要包括：1）推进阶段正踝关节功率显著降低；2）髋关节和膝关节过度屈曲；3）踝关节跖屈能力显著减弱；4）跖屈肌群活动水平降低。这些异常表现为行走速度下降、代谢成本升高和日常活动受限。
reference: 脑瘫患者的步态特征主要异常表现为：推进阶段踝关节正向动力显著降低、髋关节和膝关节屈曲增加、踝关节跖屈减少及跖屈肌群功能减弱，这些异常导致步行速度降低、能量消耗增加及身体活动水平下降。

user_input: 如何通过用户压力中心投影位移触发外骨骼步态周期的切换？
retrieved_contexts: ["\nin [38], each successive step is initiated by a shift in the loca- tion of the projection of the user's estimated center of pressure (CoP) alongthe groundinthe sagittal plane, relative to the user's forward foot (i.e., when the CoP projection shifts forward to a sufﬁcient extent, the subsequent step will be triggered). When a right step is triggered (i.e., when state 1 is entered), predeter- mined joint angle proﬁles (given in [38]) are used as input in the controlloopsfortherightkneeandhipcontrolloops(forswing), and for the left hip control loop (for stance), while the left knee is locked. Additionally, the most recent right quadriceps stim- ulation proﬁle is used as input to the right knee control loop, and the most recent left hamstrings stimulation proﬁle is used asinputtothelefthipcontrolloop.Once the rightstephasended (i.e., the joint trajectories are complete), the FSM enters state 2, and motors alone are used to hold the double-support posture. When a left step is triggered based on the projected CoP (i.e., when state 3 is entered), the predetermined joint angle proﬁles (given in [38]) are used as input in the control loops for the left knee and hip control loops (for swing), and for the right hip con- trol loop (for stance), while the right knee is locked. Addition- ally, the most recent left quadriceps stimulation proﬁle is used as input to the left knee control loop, and the most recent right hamstrings stimulation proﬁle is used as input to the right hip control loop. Note that in the states for which a given joint does not utilize stimulation, the control structure remains as shown in Fig. 1, with the stimulation proﬁle set to zero (i.e., the controller simply tracks a given trajectory with motors only).  As previously described, upon initiation of walking, the ini- tial ﬁve steps (of each cooperatively-controlled joint) occurred withoutstimulation,andthemeasuredmotortorqueproﬁlefrom each step was averaged to establish a nominal torque proﬁle. Note that the ﬁve-step averaging was implemented to account  459  460  IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON NEURAL SYSTEMS AND REHABILITATION ENGINEERING, VOL. 24, NO. 4, APRIL 2016\n"]
response: 用户压力中心（CoP）投影位移通过在矢状面内相对于用户前脚向前移动一定距离来触发外骨骼步态周期的切换。当CoP投影达到触发阈值时，系统识别为下一步开始，进而激活相应的控制回路：右步触发时使用右膝和左髋控制回路（摆动期与支撑期），并激活右膝与左髋刺激；左步触发时则激活左膝与右髋控制回路，同时激活相应的刺激。步态切换后，系统根据预设的关节角度轮廓和最新刺激轮廓进行控制，支撑期仅使用电机，摆动期则结合刺激与电机驱动。前五个步未使用刺激，系统通过平均扭矩建立基准，为后续步态周期提供输入。
reference: 通过检测用户压力中心（CoP）在矢状面地面投影的位移变化，可触发外骨骼步态周期的切换。当CoP前移至特定阈值时，系统识别为步态切换信号，并根据当前步态状态（如右步或左步）选择相应的预定义关节角度轮廓与肌肉刺激信号输入至对应控制回路。在双支撑阶段，仅通过电机维持姿态。初始五步用于建立平均电机扭矩轮廓，以优化后续控制性能。

user_input: 在楼梯行走任务中，关节角度位移相较于平地行走有哪些显著差异？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nA fundamental consideration, already pointed out in the work of McFadyen and Winter [10] is that the ascending task consists primarily of a transfer of mus- cle energy into potential (gravitation) energy of the body. Our experiment results also showed that muscle activity generally increased with backpack load in- creasing, the RMS of gastrocnemius, tibialis anterior, hamstring and rectus femoris are significantly greater with the maximum loads compared to the no-load condition.  Table 1 showed that the stride time increased with increasing load during stair climbing and level walk- ing. The explanation for this prolonged stance phase might come from the requirement to maintain good body balance. The load carried on the back raised the center of gravity of the locomotor system, thus di- minishing the stability of equilibrium. The subjects were forced to adjust their gait to compensate for this change by lengthening the stance duration (or reduc- ing the swing duration) [6], [8].  joint angular displacements during stair climbing are similar to those reported by Nadeau and Riener et al. [12], [14]. In comparison to level walk- ing, the lower limbs were observed to be more flexed at the beginning of the foot strike and less extension at the hip was observed at toe-off. These observations reflected specific adaptations to the staircase envi- ronment. The knee and hip need to be flexed at foot contact to place the leg on the step. At the end of the stance phase of stair climbing, the hips do not need to extend as much as in level walking because the con- tralateral step length is reduced by the geometry of the staircase, as opposed to level walking where there is no such constraint. As supported by previous studies [14], these differences in the range of motion between stair climbing and level walking may depend of the staircase configuration and subject characteristics. The angular displacements at the hip and knee were simi- lar to those reported in studies using two-dimensional analyses [11].  The\n']
response: 在楼梯行走任务中，关节角度位移相较于平地行走表现出以下显著差异：1）在脚跟触地时，膝关节和髋关节需要更明显的屈曲以适应台阶结构；2）步态对称性受到楼梯几何约束影响，支撑相末期髋关节的伸展幅度小于平地行走；3）起始阶段下肢整体屈曲更多，膝髋关节的伸展幅度更小；4）这些差异依赖楼梯配置和个体运动特征，表明楼梯行走对下肢关节的运动适应性更强。
reference: 在楼梯行走任务中，相较于平地行走，髋关节在足接触时表现出更高的屈曲角度，且在支撑阶段末期不需要充分伸展；膝关节同样需要在足接触时保持更大的屈曲角度以适应台阶高度；这些角度位移的变化是由于楼梯几何结构对步态的约束所致。文献未明确提及踝关节角度位移的显著差异。

response: 文中提出的自适应阻抗控制方法通过速度-扭矩环路实现人机协同的稳定性，其核心机制是在关节接近极限运动范围（ROM）时，随着阻力扭矩的增加，电机速度逐渐降低，实现安全、平稳的肌肉-肌腱拉伸；在中段ROM区域则以较高速度响应，确保高效运动；若出现异常高阻力，系统自动降低运动速度，防止协同性下降或运动受限，从而实现动态适应与稳定协同。
reference: 文中提出的自适应阻抗控制方法通过速度-扭矩控制环实现人机协同的稳定性，具体机制为：将电机速度控制为与阻力扭矩成反比，当踝关节接近ROM极限位置或检测到高阻力时自动降低速度，从而平稳拉伸肌肉-肌腱系统；同时根据关节位置动态调整速度函数v(t)，确保在不同运动阶段维持人机交互的稳定性和安全性。

retrieved_contexts: ['\ning exercise for the treatment of crouch gait (39); TPAD training with downward pelvic pull could be a promising intervention for these children.  After training, children presented increased extension of the knee and plantar flexion of the ankle. This is explained by the increased activity of the soleus muscle, which prevents the progression of the tibia during the stance and allows the knees to extend due to momen- tum of the center of mass. The improved timing of the gastrocnemius also contributed to knee extension, because the gastrocnemius acti- vated less during the early stance phase to prevent knee flexion of the crouch gait. Improved muscle activation of soleus and gastrocnemius also increased the plantar flexion of the ankle during the push-off phase. However, hip extension cannot be directly explained by those two muscles. Hip extension can increase due to activation of the muscles that were not measured in the present study, such as gluteus maximus, adductor magnus, semimembranosus, and semitendinosus. Another possible explanation is that the changed posture of the knee and ankle enabled the hip to extend more easily. In crouch gait, the hip requires larger torque for extension because the knee is leaning forward, and the body weight vector creates a larger moment arm to flex the hip (9). As such, it is hypothesized that a portion of the elevated EMG seen in the gravity compensation experiment was due to the (sagittal plane) constraints on motion imposed by the exoskeleton. Specifically, slight changes in the plane of movement may increase the level of muscular co-contraction required to flex the hip joint, and therefore the presence of the exoskeleton may slightly increase quadriceps EMG during hip flexion due to secondary factors. Although the exoskeleton is easily capable of providing additional gravity compensation (which can offset the increase in EMG), the authors chose instead to maintain the level of gravity compensation that is appropriate in the absence of a subject, and thus used the settings indicated in Fig. 4 (and Table I) in the level walking experiments described subsequently. Inertia and Friction Compensation In order to reduce the effects of added inertia, hip and knee joint torques are supplemented in proportion to the respective angular acceleration of the joint,  ( ) (2) where θ is the angular position of that joint, and where the constant of proportionality (i.e., the effective rotational inertia) was determined experimentally by iteratively increasing the value. In order to reduce the effects of added friction, hip and knee joint torques are supplemented in proportion to the respective angular velocity of the joint,  ( ) (3) where the constant of proportionality (i.e., the damping coefficient) was determined experimentally by iteratively increasing the value. response: 在外骨骼存在重力的情况下，其运动平面约束可能通过增加髋关节屈曲所需的肌肉协同收缩来影响股四头肌的EMG活动。尽管外骨骼具备提供额外重力补偿的能力，但其对运动平面的限制可能仍导致股四头肌EMG的轻微升高，这种效应在实验中被观察到。
reference: 在存在重力的情况下，外骨骼的矢状面运动平面约束增加了髋关节屈曲时所需的肌肉共激活水平，从而间接提高了股四头肌的EMG活动。尽管外骨骼可提供额外重力补偿以抵消该效应，但实验中维持了无受试者状态下的补偿水平，导致该EMG增强效应未被消除。

user_input: 在步态活动转换评估中，PV+CS分类方法相较于LDA和PV单独使用有哪些性能优势？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nIf the switching sensitivity gain as described in (7) is too high, the classifier may be resistant to switching states in order to classify a new activity. If this gain is too low, the confidence- based switching will provide no additional benefit over the phase variable approach alone. The switching sensitivity gain was chosen by tuning the gain in order to maximize the classification accuracy on a single subject using subject- specific training data. This gain value was then used in all other applications of the hysteretic switching algorithm. To assess the activity switching aspect of the proposed algorithm, gait activity transitions were simulated by concatenating gait data from steady state activities into a single set of data. All six possible transitions between the three gait activities (see Fig. 3) were simulated in this way and the strides were classified by all three classification algorithms: linear discriminant analysis (LDA), the phase variable classifier (PV), and the phase variable classifier supplemented with the confidence-based switching (PV+CS). Gait transition data was classified using subject-specific training data and non-subject-specific training data via the previously described method of leave-one-out cross validation.  IV. RESULTS  Although each element in the classification vector nominally corresponds to the RMS of the divergence rate over an entire stride, the classification vectors for the thigh input were calculated using only the final 75% (i.e., 0.25 ≤ 𝑝 ≤ 1.0) of the stride (i.e., the first 25% of each stride was excluded from consideration in all activities due to the relatively large inter- stride variability observed in the thigh input). If not excluded, the high variability in thigh motion specifically associated with the beginning of stair ascent would negatively affect classifier accuracy, which depends on gait consistency. Following computation of the respective classification vectors, the accuracy of the classifier was assessed by calculating the percentage of accurately classified strides for each individual gait activity. In each case, the stride was classified in the class corresponding to the smallest element in the classification vector. In all accuracy calculations, all walking data was considered regardless of cadence to determine if the approach is robust to variations in step frequency.\n']
response: PV+CS相较于LDA和PV在步态活动转换评估中展现出更高的个体适应性，因其分类器的切换敏感度增益经过调参以最大化单个受试者的分类准确率。然而，文献未提供具体性能对比数据，仅指出其在个体适应性方面优于PV单独使用。
reference: 在步态活动转换评估中，PV+CS分类方法相较于LDA和PV单独使用具备更高的分类稳定性与准确性。其优势体现在：1）通过引入基于置信度的切换机制，提升了在活动转换时的分类鲁棒性；2）在面对步态起始阶段高变异性（如楼梯上升初期）时，相较于PV单独使用，PV+CS能更有效地避免误分类；3）相比LDA，PV+CS结合了相位变量动态特征与置信度反馈，更适用于动态步态转换场景。文献中通过模拟六种步态转换并比较三种方法的分类性能验证了该优势。

user_input: 自对准外骨骼设计中的伪力和力矩是如何受关节轴线不对准影响的？实验数据如何支持这一结论？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe goal of the pDOFs is to prevent the spurious forces and torques on the user’s limb that can result from misalignments. the proposed self-aligning We hypothesized exoskeleton, misalignments between the exoskeleton joint axes will not result in an increase of spurious forces and torques on the user. To test this hypothesis, we have measured the interaction forces between the exoskeleton and the user across different alignment and assistance conditions. The analysis of the interaction forces (Fig. 11 and Fig. 13) shows that the spurious forces (Fx and Fy) and torques (Tx, Ty, Tz) were not visibly affected by the assistance level. On the other hand, Fz increased with the level of assistance. This result is not surprising given that Fz is roughly perpendicular to the user shank, and, therefore, it is not a spurious load. Relatively large standard deviations were observed in measured interaction forces (Fig. 11). The large standard deviation in Fz is likely due to inter-subject variability in sit-to-stand timing as our controller allows the subjects to stand up at their preferred speed. The standard deviations in all other forces and torques, are large relative to the value of the mean because the measured values themselves are small. The linear regression analysis showed that no forces or torques other than Fz were significantly correlated to the assistive joint torque. The measured peaks of the spurious forces and torques were 5 N and 0.5 Nm, respectively (Fig. 11). To put these numbers in perspective, a previous study [11] testing similar misalignment conditions using a powered exoskeleton with no self-aligning mechanism showed spurious forces and torques up to 50 N and 10 Nm, respectively. Thus, the analysis of the interaction forces and torques supports our hypothesis.  that,  in  the user and  B. Design and Control  The pDOFs in a self-aligning mechanism should be designed to work smoothly under the high load generated by the actuation system during assistance. The pDOFs should also be lightweight and unobtrusive, as adding significant weight or dimension to the exoskeleton may negate its assistive function [30]. The proposed design includes two pDOFs in the Sagittal\n']
response: 自对准外骨骼设计中的伪力（spurious forces）和伪力矩（spurious torques）在关节轴线不对准时并未显著增加，实验数据显示这些伪力和伪力矩在辅助水平变化下保持稳定，最大值仅为5 N和0.5 Nm。Fz（垂直方向力）因与用户胫骨方向一致，未被归类为伪载荷，且其变化与辅助水平相关，但文献指出该方向不被视为伪力或伪力矩。实验还通过线性回归分析验证，除Fz外，其他力和力矩均与辅助关节力矩无关，进一步支持了伪力和伪力矩受关节轴线不对准影响较小的结论。
reference: 自对准外骨骼设计中的伪力（Fx、Fy）和力矩（Tx、Ty、Tz）在关节轴线不对准的情况下未显著增加，实验数据显示其峰值分别为5 N和0.5 Nm，远低于无自对准机制的外骨骼（50 N和10 Nm）。Fz方向的力随辅助力度增加而增加，但属于预期的支撑力而非伪力。线性回归分析显示除Fz外，其他力和力矩与辅助关节力矩无显著相关性，支持自对准机制有效降低伪力和力矩的结论。

user_input: 尽管实验对象产生了巨大的肌肉力，为何前交叉韧带（ACL）和后交叉韧带（PCL）的张力仅分别为其估计极限强度的25%和50%？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n. The peak quadriceps tendon force observed was the same as the 8,000 N peak force reported by van Eijden et al. (63). How much force the quadriceps tendon can generate before rupture is unclear. However, because Nisell and Ekholm (42) found that the thickness and breadth of the quadriceps tendon to be 35–40% greater than the thickness and breadth of the patellar tendon, it is likely that the ultimate strength of the quadriceps tendon is greater than the 10,000–15,000 N estimate for the ultimate strength of the patellar tendon. The peak posterior shear force reported by Nisell and Ekholm (43) is similar to the peak PCL tensile force calcu- lated by Escamilla et al. (17,18) and Wilk et al. (65) (Table 1), who also used powerlifters as subjects and quantified muscle forces. At approximately 60° knee flexion, the pos- terior shear force changed to an anterior shear force. This force increased fairly linearly throughout the remainder of the ascent. It is interesting that even though tremendous muscle forces were generated in the three subjects due to the large loads lifted, tensile forces in the PCL and ACL were only approximately 50% and 25%, respectively, of the es-\n']
response: 尽管实验对象产生了巨大的肌肉力，ACL和PCL的张力仅分别为其估计极限强度的25%和50%，因为韧带主要承受剪切力而非直接的肌肉拉力，且其受力机制在膝关节伸展过程中呈现线性增加趋势，从而限制了其达到极限强度的能力。
reference: 尽管实验对象产生了巨大的肌肉力，ACL和PCL的张力分别仅为估计极限强度的25%和50%，这可能归因于膝关节肌肉-韧带系统的力学分布特性及肌肉协同作用对韧带的保护机制。实验数据显示，股四头肌腱可能具有较高的极限强度，而PCL和ACL所承受的张力受膝关节角度变化和肌肉力动态分布的影响，从而未达到其断裂阈值。

response: 缺少踝关节主动自由度的外骨骼系统难以实现重心自动转移，因为其缺乏协调足部之间重量分配的主动控制能力，导致重心转移过程受限，无法满足倒立摆模型的能量需求，从而无法实现足间重心的动态转移。
reference: 缺少踝关节主动自由度的外骨骼系统难以实现重心自动转移，主要原因是其无法协调支撑转换过程中的重量分布与地面反作用力调控，导致COG无法在双足之间自然转移。文献指出，踝关节自由度的缺失需通过膝关节屈曲策略来补偿，但该方法无法实现与自然步态相当的自动重心转移效果。

retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe proposed ADP mechanism extends the RCM charac- teristic not only to the parallelogram structure, but also to the general tetragonal structure. Using this tetragon’s char- acteristics, we can remove the symmetrical constraint of a general double parallelogram. As shown in Fig. 6(b), based on the ADP mechanism, we designed the coaxial internal RCM axis for the inversion/eversion joint while minimizing its bulge height.  C. Tendon-Driven Remote Actuation  Four active joints (one hip ﬂexion/extension and one knee ﬂexion/extension joint per leg) are remotely controlled by tendon-driven actuators. This enables the proposed S-Assist to tightly ﬁt so that the it can be worn under clothing. Instead of mounting each actuator beside the wearer’s lower limb joint as in conventional exoskeletons, the actuators are packed inside a backpack. Compared to direct-driven actuation, including a motor/reducer at each joint, the lower limb of the S-Assist can be designed to be slimmer and more compact in the proposed design.  Tendon-driven actuation provides several advantages, in- cluding low mass/inertia, and stiff transmission via arbitrarily ﬂexible and complex pathways. The joints of the S-Assist are actuated by highly efﬁcient and back-drivable ball-screw linear actuators (Fig. 7(a)), which give the wearer natural inertia for the lower limb without adding considerable impedance. By using a steel cable (2096 by Carl Stahl SAVA Industries, Inc.) of diameter 2.4mm, the joint stiffness of the hip can be increased up to 233Nm/rad, which is sufﬁcient for human- robot interaction devices.  A Maxon EC-4 pole 90W brushless motor (36V) along with a 190:1 reducer consisting of a timing pulley and a linear ball screw are attached to the actuator pack. The ball screw translates the rotational motion into a linear movement. The actuator is designed for a linear stroke of 85mm and a maximum pulling force of 750N to satisfy its ROM and maximum torque. These values are based on the moment arm of the corresponding joint, desired joint ranges, torques, and velocities listed in Table II. The volume of the whole actuator package is about 230mm×240mm×40mm, and it totally weighs 2.4kg.  The operation of the proposed ADP can be explained by  1083-4435 (c) 2016 IEEE. Personal use is permitted, but republication/redistribution requires IEEE permission. See http://www.ieee.org/publications_standards/publications/rights/index.html for more information.  6\n']

user_input: 腓肠肌在深蹲动作的下降和上升阶段分别起到什么力学作用，其活动如何影响股四头肌的发力需求？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n134  Official Journal of the American College of Sports Medicine  greater hip extensor torque and less knee extensor torque compared with the high-bar squat. Mean peak knee extensor torques are typically between 100 and 300 Nzm during the barbell squat (3,17,30,36,43,58,66,68,69). Because these torques are resultant (i.e., net) torques, they represent the sum of all flexor and extensor knee torques. For example, a 500-Nzm extensor torque and a 300-Nzm flexor torque yield a 200-Nzm resultant torque. Hence, it cannot be deduced that lower knee extensor torque equates to less quadriceps force being produced in the powerlifters, although it is enticing to do so. Less quadriceps force would indeed explain why peak patellofemoral compressive force was less in powerlifters, because quadriceps tendon force and patellar tendon force would also be less. However, EMG data from Wretenberg et al. (68) show greater quadriceps and hamstring activity in the low-bar squat compared to the high-bar squat. Because the hamstrings produce a knee flexor torque, a greater knee extensor torque would be needed. Hence, greater quadriceps force would be needed to generate this force. In addition, gastrocnemius force can also cause the quadriceps to gen- erate more force during the squat, because the gastrocne- mius also generates a knee flexor torque by their duel role as knee flexors and ankle plantar flexors. Moderate gastroc- nemius activity has been observed during the squat (13,17,18), which is needed during the squat to control ankle dorsiflexion during the descent and cause ankle plantar flexion during the ascent.\n']
response: 腓肠肌在深蹲动作的下降阶段主要作为膝关节屈肌，控制踝关节 dorsiflexion，防止膝关节过度屈曲；在上升阶段则通过与胫骨前肌协同作用，产生膝关节屈曲力矩。其活动水平在下降阶段有助于控制下肢运动范围，上升阶段则促进膝关节伸展。腓肠肌的力学作用间接影响膝关节负荷，进而可能在一定程度上影响股四头肌在上升阶段的发力需求。
reference: 腓肠肌在深蹲下降阶段通过其膝屈作用增加股四头肌的发力需求以维持膝伸稳定，同时控制踝背屈；在上升阶段通过踝跖屈促进身体上升，但仍需股四头肌提供额外膝伸扭矩以抵消腓肠肌的膝屈作用。因此，腓肠肌的活动在两个阶段均提高了股四头肌的发力需求。

user_input: MBLUE外骨骼相较于早期外骨骼（如Comex 1和Comex 2）在机械设计和背驱性能方面有哪些改进？这些改进对实现部分助力控制有何意义？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n6-5-4-3-2-10123Frontal shank angle (o) Exo  020406080100Level walking gait cycle (%)  Figure 6.8: MS frontal global shank angles for bare and exo conditions. The figure shows the ensemble averaged frontal plane global shank angle profiles for bare and exo conditions (adduction angles are positive) for the left (highly impaired) leg.  92  CHAPTER 7  Conclusions and Future Work  The focus of this dissertation is on the control and pre-clinical validation of lower-limb partial assist exoskeletons, i.e., developing and assessing assistance schemes applicable to improving mo- bility in broad populations that retain a certain level of voluntary motion. More specifically, the dissertation’s goal was twofold and constituted: 1) designing an intuitive, and customizable “task- invariant” controller for lower limb backdrivable exoskeletons to assist both healthy and impaired users over multiple terrain in multiple activities; and 2) performing pre-clinical in-vivo experi- ments designed to investigate the effect of this partial assistance scheme on critical, multifaceted human variables.  The primary justification for this goal arose from both mechanical, and controls related gaps in the state-of-the-art lower limb robotic assistance technologies for individuals with remnant vol- untary ability. Mainly, this group of individuals requires control schemes that command assistive torques based on live kinematic feedback of their limbs; and thereby require a mechanical actuation system that least impedes this voluntary motion. However, at the start of my dissertation several years ago, partial assistance exoskeleton technology was in an early transition phase from a dis- tinctly different exoskeleton class—bulky, powerful exoskeletons with highly geared (and thereby stiff) actuators for “driving” the limbs of paralyzed individuals with negligible voluntary force pro- duction capability [van Kammen et al., 2020]. Accordingly, my research lab progressed through three major versions of exoskeletons (Comex 1, Comex 2, and MBLUE), with each subsequent version being lighter and more backdrivable. In order to address the first part of the goal, it was important to firstly assess the existing partial assist controllers on available hardware (related to the second part of the goal).\n']
response: MBLUE外骨骼相较于早期外骨骼（如Comex 1和Comex 2）在机械设计上更轻且更背驱，减少了对使用者下肢的干扰，提升了系统的背驱性能。这些改进使得MBLUE能够支持更自然、更精确的部分助力控制，尤其适合在多种地形和活动中实现对保留自主运动能力用户的有效辅助。
reference: MBLUE外骨骼相较于Comex 1和Comex 2在机械设计上实现了更轻量化与更高背驱性能。这些改进减少了对外部助力控制的依赖，提升了用户自主运动的自由度，从而更适用于基于实时运动反馈的部分助力控制策略，支持具有残余运动能力用户的自然运动调节。

user_input: 自适应能量成形控制框架如何通过引入垂直地面反作用力和全局平面方向信息提升助力效果？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThis work was supported in part by the National Science Foundation under Grants 1652514 and 1949869, and in part by the National Institute of Biomedical Imaging and Bioengineering of the NIH under Grant R01EB031166. This article has supplementary downloadable material available at https://doi.org/10.1109/OJCSYS.2022.3165733, provided by the authors.  ABSTRACT Task-speciﬁc, trajectory-based control methods commonly used in exoskeletons may be ap- propriate for individuals with paraplegia, but they overly constrain the volitional motion of individuals with remnant voluntary ability (representing a far larger population). Human-exoskeleton systems can be represented in the form of the Euler-Lagrange equations or, equivalently, the port-controlled Hamil- tonian equations to design control laws that provide task-invariant assistance across a continuum of activities/environments by altering energetic properties of the human body. We previously introduced a port-controlled Hamiltonian framework that parameterizes the control law through basis functions related to gravitational and gyroscopic terms, which are optimized to ﬁt normalized able-bodied joint torques across multiple walking gaits on different ground inclines. However, this approach did not have the ﬂexibility to reproduce joint torques for a broader set of activities, including stair climbing and stand-to-sit, due to strict assumptions related to input-output passivity, which ensures the human remains in control of energy growth in the closed-loop dynamics. To provide biomimetic assistance across all primary activities of daily life, this paper generalizes this energy shaping framework by incorporating vertical ground reaction forces and global planar orientation into the basis set, while preserving passivity between the human joint torques and human joint velocities. We present an experimental implementation on a powered knee-ankle exoskeleton used by three able-bodied human subjects during walking on various inclines, ramp ascent/descent, and stand-to-sit, demonstrating the versatility of this control approach and its effect on muscular effort.  INDEX TERMS Biomedical, optimization, robotics.\n']
response: 自适应能量成形控制框架通过引入垂直地面反作用力和全局平面方向信息，扩展了控制律的基函数集合，使其能够更灵活地拟合多种行走模式和任务需求。该改进保留了人体关节力矩与速度之间的能量保性关系，确保了系统稳定性与可控性，同时实现了跨任务的生物拟态助力，从而提升了助力效果。
reference: 自适应能量成形控制框架通过引入垂直地面反作用力和全局平面方向信息，增强了对人类与环境交互状态的感知能力，从而在保持输入-输出无源性的前提下，扩展了基函数的表达能力。这使得控制律能够更灵活地适应多样化的运动任务（如不同坡度行走、上下坡、坐站转换等），实现更符合生物运动特征的助力策略，从而提升助力效果与适用范围。

The results demonstrate that the estimatedkneemomentswereclosetotheactualkneemoments, andthegeneratedmomentproﬁleswerecontinuousandsmooth. The black dashed line in the right column of Fig. 9 depicts the value of the sigmoid function S(θk,r,θk,l) ∈ [01] in (11) across the entire gait cycle. It shows that the stiffness model is more inclined to the stance-phase model (S (θk,r,θk,l) = 0) during the ﬁrst double-support and single-support phases, whereas the swing-phase stiffness model has a higher weight during the second double support and swing phases (S (θk,r,θk,l) = 1).  2018-0885) and NC State University (eIRB # 24675). Our study was performed in line with the CCNY IRB and NC State IRB Guidance.  A. Benchtop Experiments  1) High-Backdrivability Demonstration: We conducted a dynamicbackdrivabilitytesttocharacterizebackdrivability.The actuator’s output shaft was manually rotated between −30° and 20° at frequencies between 0.5 and 2 Hz. A loadcell measured the backdrive torque in unpowered mode, which was ﬁltered (ﬁrst-order, 1-Hz cutoff, low-pass Butterworth ﬁlter) to elimi- nate sensor noise. The measured rotation angle and backdrive torque are presented in Fig. 10. The results indicated that our exoskeletonexhibitedaverylowbackdrivetorque(∼0.22N·m), indicating signiﬁcantly better backdrivability than advanced SEA (8.5 N·m) [10] and other QDD-based exoskeletons (1.32 N·m) [29].  VI. EXPERIMENTS  To characterize the knee exoskeleton and evaluate controller performance, we conducted both benchtop and human sub- ject experiments. Benchtop experiments aimed to evaluate the performance of the robot and its controller. The experiment with eight able-bodied subjects aimed to evaluate the tracking performance of the torque controller during walking at different speeds and muscle activity responses to exoskeleton assistance. Our protocol was approved by the City University of New York Institutional Review Board (CCNY IRB, application no.\n']
response: 连续相位刚度模型通过在步态周期中根据相位函数S(θk,r,θk,l)动态调节各阶段的刚度权重，使膝关节力矩估计具有自然过渡和连续分布特性。模型在支撑相赋予较低刚度权重（S=0），在摆动相赋予较高刚度权重（S=1），从而确保力矩估计波形连续平滑，且在不同行走速度下均保持良好的估计精度与一致性。
reference: 文中提出的连续相位刚度模型通过在步态周期中引入一个S型函数S(θk,r,θk,l) ∈ [0,1]，动态调整支撑相与摆动相刚度模型的权重，在第一双支撑/单支撑阶段倾向于支撑相模型（S=0），在第二双支撑/摆动阶段倾向于摆动相模型（S=1），从而实现膝关节力矩估计在不同步态阶段间的连续和平滑过渡，避免了传统分段模型中的不连续性。

user_input: 本文提到的步态训练如何影响卒中患者大脑皮质运动兴奋性的半球间对称性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nImproving walking ability is a high-rated priority for individuals with stroke,1 and a central focus of physical therapy inter- ventions. Powered robotic exoskeletons are promising tools to deliver high-dosage, high-intensity, and progressive therapy, and to enable greater stepping workloads during therapy while po- tentially reducing strain on therapists. The Stride Management Assist (SMA) exoskeleton, developed by Honda R&D Co., Ltd. (Tokyo, Japan), has a low weight (;6 pounds) and simpliﬁed, modular design relative to other clinically tested exoskeletons to date. Gait training with the SMA has been shown to improve muscle eﬃciency,2 energetic cost,3 and poststroke paretic step length and spatial asymmetry.4 At present, it is uncertain how long-term training with the SMA aﬀects traditional poststroke clinical measures (e.g., walking speed, endurance, balance).  Insuﬃcient central drive and an imbalance of between- hemispheresymmetryofcorticomotorexcitability(CME)are also a well-established benchmark after stroke.5,6 However, there is limited information about the eﬀect of gait training on changes in cortical activity. Several studies have shown that improvements in walking and lower limb motor performance are related to cortical reorganization occurring after stroke— speciﬁcally, improvements in excitability of the paretic lower limb muscle representations.7,8 Thus, it is expected that inter- ventions enabling greater stepping dosage and intensity would strengthen connections between the motor areas of the brain and muscles of the lower limb.\n']
response: 步态训练通过增强中枢神经系统的重新组织和下肢运动兴奋性的改善，可能促进脑皮质运动兴奋性（CME）的半球间对称性恢复，从而提升卒中患者的运动协调性和步行能力。
reference: 本文未提供关于Stride Management Assist外骨骼辅助步态训练对卒中患者大脑皮质运动兴奋性半球间对称性影响的具体研究结果，文献无相关内容。尽管已有研究表明步态训练可能促进皮质重组并改善兴奋性，但文中仅提出该训练可能通过增强运动皮层与下肢肌肉连接来促进恢复的理论预期，尚未有实证支持。

user_input: 文中使用大腿和小腿IMUs时膝关节力矩估计误差是多少？该结果如何体现模型的准确性？
retrieved_contexts: ["\nfor an independent model with only thigh IMUs [42] whereas our results for a similar activity are lower at 0.0143 but with both thigh and shank IMUs. Thus, while our model can estimate many more tasks than previous deep learning approaches, it still maintains comparable accuracy for similar activities, showing the great extensibility of deep learning. Beyond comparisons to deep learning approaches, our results can be compared to both analytical and EMG-driven approaches with similar restrictions as above prohibiting a direct comparison. To compare to analytical models, Wang et al. present results using IMUs and insoles for several cyclic and non-cyclic instrumented activities. Across subjects their error was 0.37 Nm/kg at the knee and 0.85 Nm/kg at the hip which are much higher than those presented here even with only kinematic sensors [19]. To compare to EMG-driven models, Sartori et al. reported their lowest errors of 23.75 Nm at the knee and 26.06 Nm at the hip for the stance phase of walking, side-stepping, cross-stepping, and running combined. Although there is no direct comparison, our results averaged across running and walking for the entire gait cycle are 17.9 Nm for the hip and 12.0 Nm for the knee  Authorized licensed use limited to: BEIJING UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY. This is the author's version which has not been fully edited and  content may change prior to final publication. Citation information: DOI 10.1109/TBME.2024.3388874  TBME-00180-2024  with kinematics and EMG. These results demonstrate that the key contributions from our analyses rest upon baseline results that fit well within the current literature.\n"]
response: 使用大腿和小腿IMUs时膝关节力矩估计误差为0.0143 Nm/kg，相较于仅使用大腿IMUs时更低。该结果通过与文献中基于EMG驱动和运动学传感器的方法进行对比，显示出文中模型在膝关节力矩估计上的高准确性，且误差远低于传统方法，体现了其模型的准确性和任务泛化能力。
reference: 文中使用大腿和小腿IMUs时膝关节力矩估计误差为0.0143 Nm/kg。该结果通过与先前分析模型（0.37 Nm/kg）和EMG驱动模型（23.75 Nm）对比，显示出更高的准确性，体现了模型的良好性能与扩展性。

response: 输出阻抗测试结果显示控制系统的阻抗峰值为 5.14 Nms/rad，频率为 1.98 ± 0.05 Hz。与未控制系统相比，其输出阻抗平均降低了 49.2%，表明控制系统在动态响应和力-速度控制方面具有显著改进。
reference: 控制系统的输出阻抗峰值为5.14 Nms/rad，频率为1.98 ± 0.05 Hz。与未控制系统相比，输出阻抗平均降低了49.2%，表明控制系统显著提升了系统的柔顺性与动态响应性能。

user_input: M-BLUE膝关节模块在双边控制器框架中如何利用反馈传感器数据实现协同控制？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n6.1 M-BLUE wireless networking setup. The figure shows the wireless communication between the different devices involved in the experimental setup. The two M-BLUE knee modules are configured in a paired TCP mode to establish an easy interface to exchange feedback sensor data which is critical in the bilateral controller framework. The experimental laptop communicates with each M-BLUE module, also via TCP. The push button is configured in broadcast UDP mode and is used to soft-toggle the exo power. The android GUI subscribes to and publishes to the two M-BLUE modules via UDP, and is used to update controller coefficients and display exoskeleton related . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . information to the user (see Fig. 6.2). 6.2 Clinician friendly android GUI for controller customization and visual feedback. On the left is the main panel of the GUI which allows the user to update key controller coefficients (assistance levels) for the corresponding tasks depicted with pictures. The main screen can also soft-stop the exo and switch to the next panel shown on the right. On the right is the secondary panel responsible for displaying live commanded torque values from the two (left and right) actuators of the bilateral M-BLUE knee module. Exoskeleton torques and knee angles for all tasks for PPS patient. The figure shows the ensemble averaged knee angles and exoskeleton torques for level walking (LW), stairs ascent (SA), stairs descent (SD), ramp ascent (RA), ramp descent (RD), and sit-stand (STS) normalized to the task cycles of both left (less impaired) and right (severely impaired and atrophied) legs. Positive values represent knee extension angles and knee extension torques. .  6.3  .  .  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 89  xi  . 74  . 74  . 78  . 88  6.4  Exoskeleton torques and knee angles for all tasks for MS patient. The figure shows the ensemble averaged knee angles and exoskeleton torques for level walking (LW), stairs ascent (SA), stairs descent (SD), ramp ascent (RA), ramp descent (RD), and sit- stand (STS) normalized to the task cycles of both left (highly impaired) and right (less impaired) legs. Positive values represent knee extension angles and knee extension torques.  .  .  . .  . .  . .  . .  .  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 90\n']
response: M-BLUE膝关节模块在双边控制器框架中通过TCP协议实现左右膝关节的无线数据通信，用于传输反馈传感器数据。该数据被Android GUI用于更新控制器参数、调整任务状态，并显示实时扭矩与关节角度信息，从而支持闭环控制与协同控制策略的实现。
reference: M-BLUE膝关节模块在双边控制器框架中通过配置为成对TCP模式，实现两个膝模块间的反馈传感器数据交换，从而支持协同控制。反馈数据包括膝关节角度和扭矩信息，用于同步控制左右膝关节行为。实验主机通过TCP与模块通信进行监控，而Android GUI则用于控制器参数更新和状态显示，不直接参与闭环控制。

user_input: 如何通过自适应阻抗控制实现人机协同？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n2 of 14  Bioengineering 2024, 11, 683  efficient methods such as human-in-the-loop (HITL) optimization. For example, it has been demonstrated that tailored assistance based on HITL optimization can decrease the net metabolic cost of walking by up to 50% using metabolic cost as feedback [9].  In this study, we aimed at demonstrating that a hip exoskeleton, initially developed for walking assistance, can be effectively repurposed to substantially lower the metabolic cost of cycling as measured by the net metabolic cost. To explore a range of assistance strategies, we employed two methods: (1) a brute force search with a sweep protocol that evaluates a large range of solutions and (2) human-in-the-loop optimization. The sweep protocol linearly adjusted the timing of a 10Nm peak extension torque ranging from 10% to 40% of the pedal stroke and a 10Nm peak flexion torque ranging from 60% to 90% of the pedal stroke. The HITL optimization used the peak timing of extension and flexion torque as a free parameter and the net metabolic cost as the optimization criterion. HITL optimization was performed to validate the results of the sweep protocol and to explore its potential to identify an individualized assistance strategy in cycling. We hypothesized that both methods are able to identify similar solutions that reduce the net metabolic cost of cycling. While maintaining the peak torque, we assumed that the fixed kinematics of the bicycle and the predefined cycling cadence favor assistance strategies with rapid increases in the exoskeleton torque and therefore provide increased average motor power to assist the participants.  2. Materials and Methods  Three male participants with an average age of 34 ± 7.9years, height of 1.86 ± 0.02m and mass of 75.7 ± 12.7kg participated in the study. The participants had not undergone professional cycling training and possessed low to moderate experience in cycling, pri- marily in commuting and recreational settings. Exoskeleton experiments were approved by the Ethics Committee of TU Darmstadt (EK06/2024). The experiment was conducted in accordance with the principles outlined in the Declaration of Helsinki. Participants provided written informed consent.  2.1. Experimental Setup\n']
response: 通过将人机协同优化（HITL optimization）与扫频协议结合，研究实现了自适应阻抗控制以提升人机协同性能。具体方法包括：1）设定外骨骼辅助扭矩的峰值时序（伸展和屈曲）作为自由参数，以净代谢成本为目标函数进行优化；2）结合个体代谢反馈调整控制参数，使外骨骼输出的阻抗特性动态匹配人体运动需求；3）通过两种方法验证个体化辅助策略的有效性，从而在骑行任务中显著降低净代谢成本。该方法依赖于外骨骼固定运动学模型与预设骑行节奏，以支持快速增加辅助扭矩的策略，从而增强人机协同效率。
reference: 通过自适应阻抗控制实现人机协同的关键在于采用人机闭环优化（HITL）策略，以生理反馈（如净代谢成本）为优化目标，动态调整外骨骼的扭矩时序和阻抗参数，从而实现个性化、实时适应的辅助。虽然文献未直接描述“自适应阻抗控制”，但其 HITL 优化机制和参数自适应调整方法提供了实现协同控制的理论基础和实验验证路径。

response: 不同峰值扩展扭矩相位（P1-P5）对曲柄角速度的一致性无显著影响，其平均曲柄角速度在P1至P5相位中保持基本一致，未因相位设置出现显著差异。曲柄角速度主要受骑行过程中自然的线性增加趋势主导。
reference: 在不同峰值扩展扭矩相位（P1-P5）下，曲柄角速度表现出高度一致性，未因外骨骼施加的扭矩而发生显著变化。各相位下的平均角速度均接近409–424°/s范围，且曲柄角轨迹在各条件下相互重叠，表明相位变化对曲柄角速度的一致性无明显影响。

user_input: 文中对MS患者的膝关节屈曲力量和髋关节屈曲能力评估结果表明其存在哪些显著运动缺陷？研究团队据此设定了哪些主要运动学评估指标？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nWe investigated two highly impaired cases of MS and PPS. The manual muscle test (MMT) and clinician assessment of the PPS patient revealed that he had a highly impaired (atrophied) right  75  leg from the hip down, and quadriceps weakness in his left side. Accordingly, discussion with the patient and on-site clinician highlighted the need to assist knee extension especially during sit- stand-sit and stairs ascent which the patient found the most challenging. Performance assessments during sit-stand and stair ascent were therefore our primary metrics. We hypothesized that after appropriate controller customization for the PPS patient, our novel bilateral exoskeleton would improve the results of the five times sit to stand (5xSTS) test, and time to ascend a 5-step staircase. The MMT and clinician assessment of the MS patient revealed he had reduced knee flexion strength (greatly exacerbated by quadriceps spasticity) and severely hampered hip flexion capa- bility. Functionally, his prominent deficit was leg clearance (worse on the left side) leading to compensatory circumduction. Accordingly, our primary metrics were sagittal knee and frontal shank kinematics. We hypothesized that after appropriate controller customization, exoskeleton assistance would increase the MS patient’s peak knee flexion angle (assessing leg clearance), and reduce peak shank abduction angle (assessing circumduction).  For both patients, we performed a battery of assessments to explore the effects of exoskeleton assistance for a wide array of tasks (including exploratory assessments beyond the primary out- comes described above). We performed two common gait tests: the timed up and go (TUG) test and six meter walk test (6MWT). We also assessed the times to ascend and descend a staircase and ramp. Finally we acquired subjective feedback on exoskeleton effectiveness for the various tasks completed using a modified QUEST questionnaire.  6.2 Methodology  6.2.1 Clinician-friendly android app (GUI) interface development\n']
response: MS患者的膝关节屈曲力量下降（尤其是受股四头肌痉挛影响）和髋关节屈曲能力受限是其显著的运动缺陷。研究团队据此设定了两个主要运动学评估指标：矢状面膝关节屈曲角度最大值（peak knee flexion angle）和前向面胫骨外展角度最大值（peak shank abduction angle）。
reference: 文中指出MS患者存在膝关节屈曲力量减少（受股四头肌痉挛加重）和髋关节屈曲能力严重受限的显著运动缺陷。据此，研究团队设定了两个主要运动学评估指标：矢状面膝关节运动学（用于评估腿部清空能力，如峰值膝关节屈曲角度）和额状面小腿运动学（用于评估代偿性外展步态，如峰值小腿外展角度）。

user_input: 传统下肢假肢阻抗控制方法在步态周期分相中存在哪些局限性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n(1)  where K, B, and θeq are parameters deﬁning the joint’s stiffness, damping, and equilibrium angle, respectively.  Traditional methods of impedance control for lower-limb prostheses involve segmenting the gait cycle into discrete sub- phases, where each sub-phase has its own constant values of K, B, and θeq. Researchers manually tune the impedance parameters in each sub-phase until the observed gait is sat- isfactory [5], [11], [14]–[17]. Switching between sub-phases is controlled by a ﬁnite state machine (FSM) with transition criteria based on sensor readings (e.g., elapsed time, leg loading, joint angles, etc.). Like the impedance parameters, these transition criteria are often experimentally tuned for an individual’s gait by a technical expert. More elaborate impedance value representations have been suggested [16]– [19], but these methods still required manual, expert tuning. Joint kinematics and kinetics vary based on the ground incline and walking speed [20], [21] (together termed the user’s task). Therefore, the necessary impedance parameters and state machine transition criteria also vary. For a standard FSM impedance controller to operate over a wide array of tasks, many tunable parameters are required. For example, one state-of-the-art impedance controller for ﬁve ambulation modes required a total of 140 tunable parameters [16]. While only a portion of these parameters were considered necessary to tune, the device’s conﬁguration and tuning still required the researchers up to ﬁve hours to complete. To avoid the expert tuning burden, other work aimed to eliminate manual tuning by using biological quasi-stiffness curves [17], [22]–[24] or using machine learning to perform online parameter tuning [25], [26]. However, many of these approaches were limited to level-ground walking. Further, while [24]–[26] addressed the problem of tuning the impedance parameters, their approaches still required tuning the FSM switching criteria.\n']
response: 传统下肢假肢阻抗控制方法在步态周期分相中存在以下局限性：其一，依赖手动调整每个子阶段的固定阻抗参数（K、B、θeq），缺乏自适应能力；其二，难以适应因地面坡度、行走速度等任务变量变化而引起的关节动力学差异；其三，为覆盖多种行走模式需配置大量可调参数，调参耗时且依赖专家经验；其四，现有替代方法（如生物刚度曲线、在线机器学习）仍受限于对FSM切换准则的调参需求，无法全面替代传统方法。
reference: 传统下肢假肢阻抗控制方法在步态周期分相中存在以下局限性：1）依赖手动调参，需专家经验且耗时；2）使用有限状态机控制相位切换，切换标准需实验调优；3）地面坡度与行走速度变化导致阻抗参数与切换标准需动态调整，传统方法难以适应多种任务；4）参数数量庞大，如某五模式控制器需140个可调参数，配置复杂；5）虽有研究尝试引入生物拟刚度曲线或机器学习减少调参负担，但多限于平地行走，且仍需调整FSM切换逻辑，适应性受限。

user_input: 与传统周期训练方法相比，分期训练技术在外骨骼控制应用中的主要优势是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe rate of increase in compressive force is maximum between approximately 50–80° knee flexion (17,18), thus generating proportionately greater patellofemoral force compared with lower knee flexion angles. Therefore, per- forming the squat within the functional range of 0–50° knee flexion will minimize patellofemoral compressive force and stress, and may be effective for athletes or patients with patellofemoral pathologies. For athletes with healthy knees, performing the squat at higher knee flexion angles (approx- imately 90–110°) should not be problematic, as long as heavy loads are not used excessively. This can be a potential problem for powerlifters and football players, who often train with heavy loads for long periods of time. Periodiza- tion techniques should be employed when performing the squat, in which training is divided into light, medium, and heavy intensity cycles throughout the year.  Muscle Activity  To determine which muscles are being developed during the squat and to what degree, it is helpful to quantify muscle activity through the use of EMG. To date, there are 16 known studies that  KNEE BIOMECHANICS OF THE DYNAMIC SQUAT EXERCISE  havequantifiedmuscleactivityaboutthekneeduringthedynamic squat (6,13,17,18,25,27,34,38,40,54,55,58,65,68–70). Eleven of these studies performed the barbell squat with an external load (17,18,34,40,54,55,58,65,68–70), whereas the remaining five studies (6,13,25,27,38) performed the BW squat. The pri- mary knee muscles utilized during the squat are the quad- riceps, hamstrings, and gastrocnemius, and co-contractions among these muscles are believed to enhance knee stability (15,16,31,46,47,73,74).  Escamilla et al. (17) and Wilk et al. (65) quantified quadriceps, hamstring, and gastrocnemius activity using a 12-RM load for 10 male subjects experienced in the squat. Quadriceps activity progressively increased as the knee flexed and decreased as the knees extended, with peak activity occurring at approximately 80–90° knee flexion. Similar results were observed in several other studies (18,27,40,55,58,69). Quadriceps activity remained fairly constant beyond 80–90° knee flexion, which has also been observed in other studies (58,68,69). Hence, descending beyond 90° knee flexion, which is near the parallel squat position, may not enhance quadriceps development.\n']

reference: 分期训练技术相较于传统周期训练方法在外骨骼控制应用中的主要优势包括：通过系统性划分训练强度周期（轻、中、重），实现更精确的负荷管理，从而优化肌肉适应性、降低过度训练导致的损伤风险，并提升训练的长期效果与个体适应性，尤其适用于不同膝关节状态（如康复与高性能训练）下的外骨骼辅助训练控制策略。

reference: 本研究通过自适应助力控制算法优化外骨骼在步态周期中的力输出，使其在关键运动阶段提供适当的助力，从而减少用户肌肉激活水平和能量消耗。实验结果显示，该方法在步行过程中显著降低了用户的代谢能量需求。该研究延续了现有文献中关于外骨骼助力策略优化与代谢成本降低的研究方向，并通过自适应控制提升了人机协同性能，其结论在已有研究中具有实验支持。

retrieved_contexts: ['\n. Fig. 4 shows the overlaid knee joint trajectories and torques during the series of leg lifts. Specifically, the top row in Fig. 4 shows the overlaid trajectories from 42 leg lifts without FES, along with the exoskeleton motor torque required to achieve these trajectories. The middle row in Fig. 4 shows the overlaid trajectories from 42 leg lifts with FES, along with the exoskeleton motor torque required to achieve these trajectories. Finally, the bottom row in Fig. 4 shows the average of the overlaid trajectories and torques, along with a plus and minus one standard deviation for each case. As indicated in the bottom left plot, the trajectory tracking is essentially the same in both cases, although somewhat better with FES than without. The bottom right plot shows the average torque required by the exoskeleton knee motors for both cases, with and without FES. The average motor torque required without FES was approximately 25 N·m, while the average motor torque required with FES was approximately 13 N·m. response: 文中实验结果显示，功能性电刺激（FES）可显著降低膝关节外骨骼电机在腿部抬升任务中所需的平均扭矩，从无FES条件下的25 N·m降至约13 N·m。
reference: 实验结果显示，FES的应用显著降低了膝关节外骨骼电机所需的平均扭矩。在无FES情况下，平均电机扭矩约为25 N·m，而在有FES情况下，该值降低至约13 N·m。这表明FES有效减少了外骨骼系统在轨迹跟踪过程中对电机扭矩的需求。

reference: 本文指出尽管外骨骼硬件发展迅速，但其控制系统仍需显著改进，以实现广泛日常应用。当前控制系统的不足主要体现在尚无法有效满足日常使用需求，具体表现为控制策略的适应性与实用性仍存在局限，但文献未进一步详细说明具体的技术瓶颈。

user_input: 文中提到的平均皮尔逊相关系数（PCC）值分别对应哪些关节及其运动状态？这些数值反映了模型在哪方面的应用潜力？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n. The only exception is the setup for the ankle joint moment prediction during stair negotiation, in which three IMUs were needed to derive a better per- formance than a single IMU. Of note, the results for predicting the hip, knee, and ankle joint moment during walking and running with a single IMU is quite promising, which is nearly equivalent to the performance of multiple IMUs. Moreover, the average PCC of hip, knee, and ankle joint moments reach up to 0.95, 0.90, and 0.92 during running at different speeds. Accurate estimation of joint moment with the proposed model during walking and running is critical for the injury assessment in daily life. The hip and knee joint moment can be predicted with satisfied ac- curacy using a single shank-attached IMU. However, using an extra foot- attached IMU could very likely improve the estimation performance of the proposed model, when predicting the ankle joint moment during stair negotiation.\n']
response: 文中提到的平均皮尔逊相关系数（PCC）分别为髋关节0.95、膝关节0.90、踝关节0.92，分别对应跑步状态下不同速度下的关节力矩预测。这些高PCC值表明模型在髋、膝、踝关节力矩估计方面具有高度准确性，反映了其在运动损伤评估和姿态分析等应用中的潜力。
reference: 文中提到的平均皮尔逊相关系数（PCC）值0.95（髋关节）、0.90（膝关节）和0.92（踝关节）分别对应跑步过程中这些关节的力矩预测。这些数值表明模型在动态运动状态下（如不同速度的跑步）对关节力矩具有高度准确的预测能力。模型在仅使用单个IMU的情况下即可实现高精度估计，尤其适用于髋和膝关节的力矩预测，且在步态分析与损伤评估方面具有潜在应用价值。

response: 分段线性力矩-角度曲线通过构造节点集（θi,p, τi,p）并在不同运动阶段内进行线性插值，模拟踝关节在行走中从背屈到跖屈的正功循环。每个阶段的力矩由角度变化驱动，公式为 τdes = S × [τi,p − τi−1,p] / [θi,p − θi−1,p] × (θe − θi−1,p)，其中 S 为缩放因子，用于调整期望刚度。该模型在理论上用于分析踝关节控制策略的最优被动刚度，适用于外骨骼和假肢的高阶控制设计。
reference: 文中所述的分段线性力矩-角度曲线通过定义多个节点（θi,p, τi,p）并在线性段之间过渡，模拟了人类踝关节在步态周期中产生的正功循环。曲线在跖屈阶段根据实际运动过渡点动态调整角度和力矩值，从而更准确地再现踝关节的生物力学特性。该方法被广泛用于下肢外骨骼和假肢的高层控制中，能够有效复现行走过程中的正功行为。

response: 注意力机制在所设计的CNN-BiLSTM网络中起到了增强模型对关键时间步或特征重要性的作用。该机制通过Permute层调整输入数据的维度顺序，使其符合Multiply层的计算需求；Multiply层则通过元素相乘对BiLSTM输出进行加权，从而实现注意力机制对重要信息的强调与提取。
reference: 注意力机制在所设计的CNN-BiLSTM网络中用于增强关键时间步的特征表示，通过Permute层调整注意力权重的维度，并与BiLSTM输出通过Multiply层进行逐元素相乘，实现对输入序列中重要信息的加权强调，从而提升关节力矩预测的准确性。

(4) Note that in (4) we define γγc, which is an adaptation control gain that influences the rate of adaptation. IV. EXPERIMENTAL IMPLEMENTATION The previously described control approach was implemented on a paraplegic subject wearing the previously described lower limb exoskeleton. These experiments were conducted using electrical stimulation of the quadriceps muscle, therefore only the knee joint utilized cooperative control, and only when requiring a torque in knee extension (i.e., the quadriceps cannot provide a knee flexion torque). The subject was a T10 ASIA A (i.e., complete) paraplegic male, was 36 years old, 9 years post injury, 1.85 m (6 ft 1 in) tall, and weighed 73 kg (160 lb). All experiments were conducted at the Shepherd Center in Atlanta GA USA, a hospital specializing in spinal cord injury. All experiments required the presence of a physical therapist, as per the experimental protocol approved by the Vanderbilt Institutional Review Board. A. Electrical stimulation Electrical stimulation was provided by a custom module that plugs into the main exoskeleton control board. As implemented, the same microcontroller that controls the joint actuator also controls the electrical stimulator. The stimulator provides a biphasic square-wave stimulation waveform. In the experiment described here, the stimulation frequency was set to a constant 50 Hz, and the pulse width set to 200 μs. As previously described, the stimulation amplitude was set by the structure of the adaptive controller. Note that, for safety purposes the stimulation amplitude was saturated at 120 mA. A pair of surface electrodes was placed on each of the right and left quadriceps. The stimulation leads were run proximally, through the waistband of the subject’s pants, where they connected with mating leads from the previously described stimulator. B. Experimental setup A series of trajectory-controlled leg lifts were used to assess the efficacy of the cooperative controller to adapt to  3361\n']
response: 实验中仅在膝关节伸展方向应用协同控制，是因为股四头肌主要负责膝伸展，其在膝屈曲时会主动收缩提供反向扭矩，避免在实验中产生不必要的膝屈曲。生理依据在于膝关节屈曲与伸展的协调控制对维持下肢稳定性至关重要；控制依据则来自实验中采用的自适应协同控制策略，在膝伸展方向实现对肌肉输出的精确调节。
reference: 实验中仅在膝关节伸展方向应用协同控制的生理依据是股四头肌仅能提供膝关节伸展扭矩，无法实现屈曲动作；控制依据是系统安全性与任务目标的一致性，确保控制策略作用于可测量和可调节的方向。

response: 在模型拟合中，由于非线性非凸优化问题难以直接求解，研究者通过将原问题转化为高阶多项式形式并构建凸优化问题，从而近似求解该问题。这一方法通过构造凸函数目标和约束条件，提升了求解的可行性与稳定性。
reference: 在模型拟合中采用凸优化问题近似求解非线性非凸问题的原因在于：原始问题中 Kχpθeq,χp 的乘积项导致目标函数在未知参数上是非线性的，使整体优化问题为非凸，难以求解。为克服此困难，研究通过将乘积项转化为一个新的高阶多项式 δχp，并赋予其独立系数 δip，从而构造一个可解的凸优化问题。使用该问题的解来近似原问题的解，能够在保证计算效率的同时获得可行的参数估计。

user_input: 如何通过Bowden电缆和McKibben型气动人工肌肉实现外骨骼系统远端质量的优化与代谢代价的降低？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nActuators Actuator choice for exoskeletons is targeted towards limiting the dis- tal mass and its costly metabolic impact218. Accordingly, actuators have been designed to minimize weight and to maximize power. For example, conventional motors can be applied to actuate rigid links and to establish sophisticated interfaces between exoskeletons and the body104,219,220. Bowden cables, which can transmit forces from a heavy actuator to lighter-weight distal components, have been applied in both autonomous117,118,145 and offboard devices77,79,82,85,115. Alterna- tively, McKibben-type pneumatic artificial muscles can distally apply sagittal-plane assistance34, with updated versions demonstrating metabolic benefit67,68,138,207. Other artificial-muscle technologies have also shown promise for reducing drop foot in people post-stroke221. Such soft inflatable actuators have been integrated into research devices for lateral ankle support222,223 and in commercial devices for recreational knee-injury prevention224. As a semi-active extension of a passive exoskeleton45, a proof-of-concept electroadhesive clutch has been designed to actively engage or disengage a spring when voltage is applied across a stack of thin electrode sheets225,226. These contrast with traditional mechanical clutches, which require a physical latch to engage or disengage a spring, requiring much more elaborate mech- anisms. Electrostatic clutches could allow for the design of passive joint-targeting exoskeletons that adapt to changes in speed, movement and the environment.  Simulation of forward dynamics High-fidelity simulations are an important tool for estimating the meta- bolic benefit of exoskeleton devices. Empirical techniques, such as HIL optimization, can optimize assistance in response to real-time  Nature Biomedical Engineering\n']
response: 通过将Bowden电缆与McKibben型气动人工肌肉结合，可以实现远端质量的优化：Bowden电缆将高质量的驱动部分与低质量的远端组件分离，McKibben型气动肌肉则在远端提供必要的助力，从而降低远端质量并优化代谢代价。此外，高保真度动力学仿真可进一步评估该系统在降低代谢成本方面的性能表现。
reference: Bowden电缆通过将重载执行器的力传递至较轻的远端结构，减少穿戴者感知的远端质量，从而降低其代谢负担；McKibben型气动人工肌肉则通过在矢状面提供柔性辅助力，并已被研究证实可带来代谢效益。因此，两者协同应用可实现外骨骼系统远端质量的优化与代谢代价的降低。

A fatiguing squat study reported a 25% decline in maximal quadriceps force after fatiguing exercises [Longpr´e et al., 2015], but we did not measure maximal quadriceps forces pre- and post- fatigue in our study. If we make relatively broad assumptions of a linear relationship between EMG and force [Staudenmann et al., 2010], and consider fast LL as a maximal activity for the quadri- ceps, the 33% savings in peak quadriceps force afforded by the exoskeleton was likely sufficient to fully overcome the supposed 25% deficit in force from the induced fatigue. In fact, the exoskeleton assistance practically maintained the pre-fatigue LL duration levels in post-fatigue (Fig. 5.3), suggesting a full replenishment of the post-fatigue quadriceps force deficit. user_input: 非升力型弹簧刚度函数是如何根据膝关节角度和角速度实现自适应调节的？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n) is the non-ascent spring stiffness function based on θmax  kd  kd  ) = kna ·σ(θmax  kd  kd  At the core, the LL spring is a standard virtual torsion spring at the knee with a fixed neutral point of 0 degrees knee flexion. The spring stiffness is however tapered in a nonlinear fashion dependent on knee angular velocity and knee angle itself. At a high level, the spring was designed to become more compliant with higher magnitudes of knee flexion angular velocity, such that it minimally impedes the intentional lowering (knee flexion) portion of LL but also provides a strong boost for the intentional lifting (knee extension) portion. Further, we modified the angular velocity dependence by the depth of the squat, i.e., the amount of knee flexion angle. For deeper squats the spring stiffness is less sensitive to knee flexion angular velocity. This feature helped to provide a bracing effect at the bottom of the squat (a biomechanically compromised position) as the knee flexion velocity decreased. The LL spring has the form  τLL = kLL·θk·σ( ˙θk,mLL1,x1·σ(θk,mLL2,dLL)+x2)·Fipsi  GRF  where kLL is the spring constant of the LL spring, x1, x2 ∈ R scale and shift the knee angle- modulating sigmoid respectively, and Fipsi GRF is the GRF normal to the ipsilateral foot normalized by body weight.  45  (4.3)  (4.4)  The basis function for partial gravity compensation during stance has the form  τgravst = gst·sin(θth)·Fipsi  GRF·step(θth)  where gst scales the magnitude of gravity compensation for stance, and θth is the global thigh segment angle. The unit step function restricts the torque to only flexion torques which were found to be helpful in propelling the body forward in late stance and allow a smooth transition to the flexion torque required for foot clearance in early swing.  4.2.0.2 Task sensitization\n']
response: 非升力型弹簧刚度函数通过结合膝关节角度和角速度的模态调节，实现自适应控制。其刚度函数形式为 τLL = kLL·θk·σ( ˙θk,mLL1,x1·σ(θk,mLL2,dLL) + x2 )·Fipsi GRF，其中 sigmoid 函数 σ 对角度和角速度进行非线性映射，使弹簧在不同运动阶段（如深蹲初期和末期）表现出不同的刚度特性：在屈曲速度较低时提供制动支撑，在屈曲速度较高时增强柔顺性，从而实现对膝关节助力与限制的动态调节。
reference: 非升力型弹簧刚度函数通过膝关节角度（θk）和角速度（θ̇k）的双依赖机制实现自适应调节：在膝关节屈曲角速度较高时降低刚度以减少运动阻碍，在蹲姿更深时减弱对角速度的敏感性以增强支撑作用。其刚度函数形式为 τLL = kLL·θk·σ(θ̇k, mLL1, x1·σ(θk, mLL2, dLL)+x2)·Fipsi_GRF，其中包含了对膝角和角速度的非线性调制。
