reference: 不同步态速度对腓肠肌肌纤维行为具有显著影响，具体表现为在楼梯行走过程中，随着步态速度增加，腓肠肌肌束在支撑期的缩短速率加快，伸长幅度减少，肌肉趋向于更主动的收缩以满足推进力需求。该结论基于对楼梯行走情境的研究（Spanjaard et al., 2009）。

user_input: 文中提到哪些传感或技术手段被用于增强义肢系统的上下文感知能力？它们分别适用于哪些应用场景？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nadjusts the impedance or position of the prosthetic joints based on gait phase and the users locomotor task (e.g. level walking, stair ascent and descent). The autonomous control cannot predict the user’s intent in terms of locomotor tasks and therefore cannot adapt to walking terrains. One solution is to build a neural-machine interface that predict the users intended locomotor task for prosthesis operation. Several groups have developed neural-machine interfaces (NMIs) for artiﬁcial legs to decipher neuromuscular signals (i.e. electromyographic (EMG) signals) and identify the user’s intended locomotor tasks and transitions [6], [7], [8], [9], [10], [11]. These approaches have been demonstrated to enable lower limb amputees to drive their prosthesis intuitively and switch locomotor tasks seamlessly. It has to been shown that active prostheses have the potential offer more comfort and less energy waste to the amputee compared to passive ones, [12], [13], [14]. The development of intelligent prosthetic devices has been done for a while as reported by [15]. Early investigations such as [12], [16], [17], implemented control and signal processing techniques to electromechanical systems in order to provide reliable systems that bring more comfort to the amputee. This type of research is still ongoing. Contemporary approaches make use of learning algorithms applied on exoskeletons and robotic limbs [18] with neural interfaces to the user for enhanced control, [19], [20], [21], [22], [23], [24] and response to human stimuli and intent, the so-called volitional control. For example, in order to give context awareness to the volitional control system for a prosthetic leg, [25] combined an inertial measurement unit (IMU) and a laser distance the terrain type and slope in front meter to reconstruct of the user [25]. Lately, context awareness strategies have gained an extra resource, the use of computer vision (CV). For example, deep learning techniques have been applied to prosthetic arms in order to enhance the grasp perception, independently of object forms or size [26]. However, the requirements and constraints to upper limbs prosthetics are very different than the ones to lower limbs, speciﬁcally in terms of response time and robustness.  This work is supported by the National Science Foundation (NSF) under  award CNS-1552828 and IIS-1361549.\n']
response: 文中提到用于增强义肢系统上下文感知能力的技术手段包括：神经-机器接口（NMIs）用于解码用户肌肉信号以识别运动意图，惯性测量单元（IMU）与激光测距结合用于感知地形类型和坡度，以及计算机视觉（CV）用于增强物体识别能力。这些技术适用于下肢假肢的意图识别、地形适应与环境感知等应用场景。
reference: 文中提到的传感或技术手段包括：(1) 神经-机器接口（NMIs）用于解码肌电信号识别用户运动意图，适用于下肢义肢在不同步态任务间的切换；(2) 惯性测量单元（IMU）结合激光测距仪用于地形识别，适用于下肢义肢的地形自适应控制；(3) 计算机视觉（CV）结合深度学习技术用于增强抓取感知，适用于上肢义肢的自适应抓取任务。上下肢系统在响应时间与鲁棒性方面存在差异，限制了CV技术在下肢义肢中的应用。

user_input: BioStampRC在评估多发性硬化症患者步态障碍进展方面具有什么潜在应用价值？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nBioStampRC could monitor gait impairment of MS.  BioStampRC sensors detected differences in step time and stride time by disability levels in PwMS, while swing time was less distinctive between the groups. The current observation was consistent with previous researches that reported significant prolongation in step time and stride time, but not in swing time in PwMS [6, 21]. Also, corresponding to previous research [6, 19], there was no difference in the gait parameters between the control and mild MS group whereas elongated temporal gait parameters were observed as severity of gait impairment increased in PwMS. The trend was also observed in the data derived from the standard refer- ence MTx [21, 44]. Therefore, BioStampRC might be useful in identifying gait pathology in PwMS as well as in evaluating the progression of gait disability in PwMS.  Strengths and limitations of the investigation  The current study included a relatively large sample of persons with varying MS disability as well as healthy controls. Furthermore, we studied four types of clinical gait assessments that have been validated to examine gait function in PwMS [8]. Additionally, three different speed conditions were included in 6MW.  Despite the strengths of the paper, it is not without limitations. A main limitation of the study is that 6MW trials were conducted on a motorized treadmill. It is established that tread- mill walking is distinct from over ground walking. The use of treadmill and usage of the hand rail have been associated with altered gait characteristics such as increased cadence and reduced knee angle compared to over-ground walking condition [45, 46]. Additionally, a few studies have suggested that treadmill may artificially reduce the natural variability of gait pat- terns (i.e. stride-to-stride fluctuations during walking) [46]. The alternation of the gait variabil- ity has been reported to be a unique marker of gait impairment in PwMS [47]. Therefore, future research is necessary to confirm the accuracy of the novel sensor and its applications in PwMS during over-ground walking that mimics real-world walking.  The treadmill was utilized in an effort to maintain gait speed within a given trial. The well-controlled speed constraints permitted more explicit comparison of the temporal gait  PLOS ONE | DOI:10.1371/journal.pone.0171346 February 8, 2017  14 / 19  Monitoringgait in MS with wearblesensors\n']
response: BioStampRC在评估多发性硬化症患者步态障碍进展方面具有潜在应用价值，可监测步时、步频等关键步态参数随疾病严重程度的变化趋势，并反映不同残疾程度患者的步态特征差异。其结果与先前研究一致，表明可用于识别MS患者的步态病理和评估疾病进展。然而，由于研究环境受限（如跑步机模拟行走），其在真实世界中的有效性仍需进一步验证。
reference: BioStampRC在评估多发性硬化症（MS）患者步态障碍进展方面具有识别步态病理变化和追踪其严重程度的潜力，因其可检测不同残疾水平下步时间与步幅时间的显著差异。尽管研究受限于跑步机测试可能影响步态真实表现，未来仍需验证其在地面行走中的应用，但其在多速度条件与临床评估中的表现支持其作为可穿戴监测工具的应用前景。

user_input: 与之前控制器相比，基于IDA-PBC方法的控制器在任务多样性辅助方面有何突破？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nSpecifically, study 1 performed preliminary validation (n=3) of two advanced, data-driven en- ergy shaping approaches under the collective MTOES framework: 1) with phi (PHI) which in- corporates the global thigh angle, and 2) without-phi (WOP) which excludes it from the shaping framework. For human subject experiments, the controllers were implemented on the Comex 1 knee-ankle exoskeleton equipped with the vGRF sensor I developed in chapter 2, which signif- icantly improved the MTOES optimization results. Study 2 generalized the MTOES framework to various modular configurations (ankle/knee/hip, unilateral/bilateral) and performed pre-clinical validation (n=8) using the MBLUE hardware on the knee and hip unilateral and bilateral modules. The primary hypothesis of both experiments was a holistic reduction in muscular effort (EMG) with exoskeleton assistance across multiple tasks.  25  3.2 Synopsis: Study 1  Study 1 utilized our prior IDA-PBC method [Lin et al., 2021] to include unactuated coordinates such as leg orientation in a passivity-based, energy-shaping controller for optimal assistance of all primary activities of daily life. In addition to global orientation, we included the vertical GRF in the basis functions (that map joint kinematics to joint moments) to address prior problems with ex- cessive torque as weight transfers from the assisted leg to the (unmodeled) contralateral leg during double support [Divekar et al., 2020]. Incorporating these additional variables increased the num- ber of candidate basis functions allowed by the IDA-PBC framework. This thereby improved the flexibility of the optimization process to fit the outputs of a single control law to normative human joint torques across all primary activities of daily life: level-ground walking, walking at variable inclines/declines, stair ascent/descent with variable step heights, and sit-to-stand. We formulated and solved this optimization problem using convex programming tools. No prior controller had demonstrated biomimetic assistance for such a wide variety of tasks without switching or adapta- tion between tasks. We assessed the muscular effort of multiple able-bodied human subjects with an experimental implementation of this task-invariant control method on a knee-ankle exoskeleton (Comex 1) to assist the primary activities of daily life (detailed below).  3.3 Human Subject Methods: Study 1\n']
response: 基于IDA-PBC方法的控制器在任务多样性辅助方面突破在于其能够以单一控制律适应多种日常活动（如平地行走、坡道行走、上下楼梯及坐-站动作），无需任务切换；同时引入未驱动坐标（如腿部方向角）与vGRF建模，有效抑制扭矩异常，并实现生物拟态辅助。
reference: 基于IDA-PBC方法的控制器通过引入未驱动坐标（如腿部方向）和垂直地面反作用力（vGRF）作为基础函数的一部分，扩展了能量成形框架，从而在不依赖任务切换或适应机制的前提下，实现了对多种日常活动（如平地行走、变坡度行走、上下楼梯、坐站转换）的仿生助力控制。这是首个在如此广泛任务范围内展示任务不变控制策略有效性的控制器方法，显著提升了任务多样性辅助能力。

user_input: 文中提出的基于IDA-PBC的能控策略如何通过全局姿态和垂直地面反作用力反馈提升控制器性能？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n26  VOLUME 1, 2022  assistance [42]. It is thus possible that our outcomes would im- prove by providing more acclimation time. Additional human subjects would be needed to draw more general conclusions about the controller’s effectiveness, which is left to future work.  VI. CONCLUSION This paper applied a novel energetic control strategy based IDA-PBC that can assist all primary ADLs with a back- drivable knee-ankle exoskeleton. Whereas prior work on passivity-based energy-shaping control behaved as nonlin- ear virtual springs, this paper incorporated global orientation and vGRF feedback to broaden the capabilities of the con- troller while preserving input-output passivity and stability of the closed-loop system. We increased the candidate basis functions in the optimization process, which achieved an op- timal controller that ﬁts normalized able-bodied human joint torques more closely for more tasks. We considered “L1 reg- ularization,” which ﬁts the data with as few parameters as possible to avoid overﬁtting problems. We also demonstrated the potential of the implemented controller to reduce muscular effort in a human subjects study involving level-ground, ramp, and stairs walking as well as sit-stand transitions.  Future work could consider inconsistencies between the optimization dataset and real-time GRF data from exoskele- ton sensors. Moreover, lighter backdrivable exoskeletons are being developed [11], [12] that could avoid co-contractions and/or compensations associated with exoskeleton mass, en- abling more consistent reductions in muscle activation. Future work could also incorporate the passive and active dynam- ics of the relevant muscle-tendon units to further improve biomimicry of the assistance torque.  ACKNOWLEDGMENT The authors would like to thank Erica Santos and Kayla Shepodd for their assistance. The content is solely the respon- sibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the ofﬁcial views of the NSF or NIH.  REFERENCES [1] G. Zeilig, H. Weingarden, M. Zwecker, I. Dudkiewicz, A. Bloch, and A. Esquenazi, “Safety and tolerance of the rewalk exoskeleton suit for ambulation by people with complete spinal cord injury: A pilot study,” J. Spinal Cord Med., vol. 35, no. 2, pp. 96–101, 2012.  [2] S. A. Kolakowsky-Hayner, J. Crew, S. Moran, and A. Shah, “Safety and feasibility of using the EksoTM bionic exoskeleton to aid ambulation after spinal cord injury,” J. Spine, vol. 4, pp. 1–8, 2013.\n']
response: 文中提出的基于IDA-PBC的能控策略通过引入全局姿态和垂直地面反作用力（global orientation 和 vGRF）反馈信息，提升了控制器在不同运动状态下的适应性和鲁棒性，使外骨骼能够更精确地匹配健康人体的关节力矩特性，从而增强任务适应能力与控制性能。
reference: 文中提出的基于IDA-PBC的能控策略通过引入全局姿态和垂直地面反作用力（vGRF）反馈，增强了控制器对运动状态的感知与响应能力，从而提升其对多种任务（如平地、坡道、楼梯行走及坐-站转换）的适应性。该方法在保持输入-输出无源性和闭环系统稳定性的同时，结合优化后的候选基函数，使控制器更贴近人体自然关节力矩，提升了控制性能和生物拟真度。

user_input: 不同踝关节外骨骼降低行走代谢成本的关键技术点是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nFrontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology | www.frontiersin.org  1  March 2017 | Volume 5 | Article 4  Young et al.  the largest contributors for providing the necessary mechanical power to sustain human walking (Sawicki and Ferris, 2009; Umberger and Rubenson, 2011), and a large number of previ- ous studies have considered how to optimize ankle exoskeletons and controllers (Ferris et al., 2005, 2006; Gordon et al., 2006; Cain et al., 2007; Gordon and Ferris, 2007; Norris et al., 2007; Sawicki and Ferris, 2008, 2009; Malcolm et al., 2009; Koller et al., 2015). Recent work has shown that a variety of different ankle exoskeletons can effectively reduce the energetic cost of walking by providing plantarflexor power at the proper time point in the gait cycle (Malcolm et al., 2013; Mooney et al., 2014; Collins et al., 2015). With the goal of making similar advances at the hip, our work focuses on a hip exoskeleton and testing its efficacy of torque delivery at the hip for both flexion and extension assis- tance. Several research groups have begun recently developing hip exoskeletons both for able-bodied assistance (Lewis and Ferris, 2011; Lenzi et al., 2013; Giovacchini et al., 2014) and for disabled populations (Arazpour et al., 2012, 2014; Buesing et al., 2015). Our study is relevant to researchers developing walking controllers for exoskeletons that include a powered hip joint or even passive designs that have targeted storage and return of energy at the hip. There is a clear need for researchers to study the biomechanics of lower limb exoskeletons to develop the most efficacious strategies of controlling exoskeletons to aid in human walking for both augmenting human performance and assisting the disabled (Ferris, 2009).\n']
response: 不同踝关节外骨骼降低行走代谢成本的关键技术点包括：在步态周期关键时相（如足跟着地前）提供恰当的跖屈助力；优化控制器以实现与人体运动协调；研究髋部与踝部协同助力的控制策略。
reference: 不同踝关节外骨骼降低行走代谢成本的关键技术点包括：在步态周期的适当时机提供足底屈肌动力，以补充人体自然运动所需的机械功率；采用优化的控制策略，确保外骨骼与人体运动协调一致；以及实现高效的能量传递机制，减少人体肌肉的代偿性用力。这些技术共同作用，从而有效降低行走的代谢成本。

user_input: 文中提到的被动矫形器和传统助行器具在辅助最具挑战性的活动（如坐站和上下楼梯）时存在哪些局限性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n2  [Vistamehr et al., 2014], gait asymmetry [Haight et al., 2015], and overdependence on the brace [Lairamore et al., 2011]. Passive orthoses, canes, and walkers cannot provide positive mechanical work to assist the most challenging activities, such as sit-to-stand and stair ascent. We examine the latest in robotic assistive technologies for common disabilities and MSDs next.  1.1.1 Stroke  Stroke is the second leading cause of acquired disability and has lasting remnant motor deficits even after extensive rehabilitation [Katan and Luft, 2018; Woolley, 2001]. Stroke rehabilitation is closely linked to the field of motor learning [Bejarano et al., 2016], which suggests that task- specific practice is superior to isolated muscle strengthening for enhancing neuroplasticity. How- ever, due to post-stroke deficits at various joints, task-specific practice is inevitably performed with various compensations, which then become habitual in the long-term [Beyaert et al., 2015]. In par- ticular, poststroke deficits at the ankle cause foot drop and reduced push-off power [Kluding et al., 2013; Verma et al., 2012], and deficits at the knee cause a locked knee gait and reduced foot clear- ance [Woolley, 2001]. A physical therapist is unable to simultaneously assist multiple joints like robot-guided training [van Kammen et al., 2020], but robotic therapies have various drawbacks. Treadmill-based robot-guided training enforces normative joint kinematics resulting in less patient effort, reduced kinematic variability, and practice on an unnatural (treadmill) surface—all factors that greatly reduce learning [Dobkin and Duncan, 2012]. While mobile exoskeletons [Buesing et al., 2015] address the last problem, their reliance on pre-defined joint patterns fails to address the first two problems. Moreover, the focus of robot-aided gait training on walking neglects the common ADLs of stair climbing and sit-to-stand, yet rehabilitation of these tasks can reduce fall risk after stroke [Amira et al., 2015; Jacobs, 2016; Morone et al., 2018]. These challenges can be addressed by backdrivable, task-invariant powered orthoses with modularity to accommodate the heterogeneity of the stroke population. In chapters 2 and 3, we perform preliminary able-bodied validation of a task-invariant controller using our first-gen knee-ankle exoskeleton (Comex 1), as a precursor to future testing on stroke participants.  1.1.2 Low back pain—lifting-lowering-carrying\n']
response: 被动矫形器和传统助行器具在辅助坐站和上下楼梯等最具挑战性的活动时，无法提供正向机械功，依赖用户自身运动能力；无法多关节协同辅助，限制了任务完成的自然性和效率；训练中强制标准化运动模式会降低患者主观努力与运动变异性，影响神经可塑性增强；因此难以满足高难度康复任务的生理适应性和学习需求。
reference: 被动矫形器和传统助行器具在辅助最具挑战性的活动（如坐站和上下楼梯）时存在以下局限性：1）无法提供正向机械功以主动辅助运动；2）缺乏对多个关节的同步动态支持能力；3）无法纠正代偿性步态模式，易导致步态不对称和过度依赖；4）未能有效针对任务特异性康复训练的需求，尤其是对日常活动中如上下楼梯和坐站等任务的辅助不足。

user_input: 参与者在不同负载条件下对K-SRDTM版本POC的用力感知评分变化说明了什么问题？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nWe would assume that during a more strenuous stair climbing task, as compared to the CHFT, that the benefits of the K-SRDTM version POC would become more evident. This was not the case in the continuous stair climbing task. This test cannot be viewed as a longer version of the CHFT. In the CHFT participants ascended two steps and then descended the same two steps backwards for one cycle. In the continuous stair climbing task participants climbed consecutively 3 flights of stairs and then turned around and walked down the 3 flights of stairs facing forward. For four (4) participants, the heart rate versus time curves indicate that there does not appear to be a benefit with the K-SRDTM version POC during the 20 minutes of continuous stair climbing. This may be due to the extra physiological cost of carrying and moving the KRSD version POC down the stairs when there is no mechanical benefit imparted by the system. However, Participants 6 did show a physiological benefit with the device whereas the results of the Participant 1 are inconclusive.  One expectation of the K-SRDTM version POC system was that it would provide benefits to the user over extended periods of walking or while carrying heavy loads. Rating of perceived exertion from the CHFT partially supported this expectation. Initially, when there was no load participants rated the “with K-SRDTM version POC” condition as being more physically exerting. When the 25-lb load was added the gap between the ratings of perceived exertion became narrower. Finally, when the participants wore the 50-lb vest participants rated the “with K-SRDTM version POC” condition as less physically exerting than the “without K-SRDTM version POC” condition. This suggests that there is a perceived benefit of the K-SRDTM version POC when more weight is added. This also suggests that there is a perceived “cost” of exertion to wearing  11 - 10  RTO-MP-IST-099  UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED  Dermoskeleton Concept to Address the Soldiers Overload Challenge\n']
response: 参与者在不同负载条件下对K-SRDTM版本POC的用力感知评分变化表明，该装置在低负载条件下可能增加了身体的感知负担，但在高负载条件下表现出减轻体力消耗的效应。这说明K-SRDTM版本POC在应对长时间行走或携带重物时可能具有一定的辅助作用，尤其在负载增加时，使用者对设备的“使用成本”感知降低。
reference: 用力感知评分的变化说明K-SRDTM版本POC在高负载条件下能有效降低使用者的感知用力程度，表明其助力机制在重载情况下具有明显益处。然而，在连续爬楼梯任务中部分参与者未表现出生理益处，可能是由于下楼梯时系统无法提供机械助力，反而因携带设备而产生额外生理负担。这揭示了系统在不同任务模式下的有效性差异及其在动态任务中需优化的潜在方向。

retrieved_contexts: ['\nmaintain a constant positive rate even when thigh angular velocity is low, which enables a biomimetic, powerful push- off. Second, we add states to account for thigh trajectories that have more than two monotonic sections (especially common during ramp descent) to prevent phase saturation and resulting gait desynchronization. Third, we introduce a technique to improve the linearity of ˆs, correcting for previous steady- state nonlinearities and thus making it closer to an ideal phase estimate. For brevity, the mathematical details for these improvements are presented in Appendix A.  the hip relative to the foot’s point of contact with the ground during the previous stance phase is calculated as  dst = ||xtoe − xHS−  heel ||2,  where xHS− is the value of xheel from the previous HS. Sim- heel ilarly by assuming a symmetric gait, the forward progression of the hip relative to the contrallateral foot’s ground contact point over a swing phase is approximated at each HS as  dsw = ||xheel − xTO−  toe  ||2,  To illustrate the beneﬁts of the new phase variable over its predecessor [33], [36], we conducted a simulation using thigh kinematic data from [21] (Fig. 3a). For each trial of treadmill walking in the dataset, we calculated the phase variable using both the new method (Appendix A) and the previous method described in [36]. For each incline, we averaged the phase trajectories over all strides, participants, and walking speeds, shown in Figs. 3b and 3c. Notably, the new phase variable eliminated the phase estimate pause associated with maximum hip extension that was observed with the previous phase vari- able. The new method also reduced the early saturation seen in the previous phase variable, which was particularly prominent at steep ramp declines. Finally, the new method demonstrated improved linearity, particularly during midstance. Compared to an ideal linear phase trajectory, the new method showed 4.50% RMSE with R2 = 0.991 while the previous method showed 7.48% RMSE and R2 = 0.976 over all tasks.  B. Task Estimation  In addition to the phase estimate, the HKIC requires an estimate of the user’s current task ˆχ, which is calculated at each TO during steady walking. The estimation methods below are based on [36], with modiﬁcations to improve performance. Both estimates are ﬁltered with a moving average over 3 strides to account for stride-to-stride variation.\n']
response: 自适应相位变量改进方法通过引入处理髋关节多段轨迹的状态变量，防止相位饱和；同时通过优化相位估计的线性度，修正稳态非线性问题，从而在髋关节最大伸展阶段避免相位估计暂停。
reference: 自适应相位变量改进方法通过维持大腿角速度低时的恒定正变化率，并引入额外状态以防止相位饱和，从而在髋关节最大伸展时保持相位估计的连续性，消除暂停问题。

retrieved_contexts: ['\n5051015Torque (Nm) 010203040hamstrings EMG (%MVC)  5051015Torque (Nm) 0204060hamstrings EMG (%MVC)  50510Torque (Nm) Exo Torque  Figure 5.12: Hamstrings EMG and exoskeleton knee torque. The figure shows the ensemble averaged hamstrings EMG profiles and the torque profiles of the exoskeleton for all tasks tested. Torques are positive in the extension direction.  74  CHAPTER 6  Customizability and Preliminary Validation of a Versatile Bilateral Knee Exoskeleton for Assisting Impaired Individuals  6.1  Introduction  Individuals with impairments present a difficult challenge for task-invariant controllers. Specifi- cally, controllers that are trained on normative datasets may prove overly generic to cater to the unique deficits present in impaired individuals. Moreover these controllers require a secondary optimization process (e.g., reinforcement learning, human in the loop optimization) which then tries to update the algorithm by incorporating the individual’s personalized gait data. However this optimization process can take several hours of cyclical data collection and re-tuning, especially if the number of basis functions (control parameters) is large. While this may be doable for healthy individuals, it is highly burdensome and impractical for impaired individuals who usually have a small reserve of energy before fatiguing, e.g., individuals with multiple sclerosis (MS) and post- polio syndrome (PPS). Moreover, the clinician (physical therapist) is completely sidelined in this methodology, preventing them from contributing their expert knowledge. Patients may also prefer their therapist’s involvement.  This chapter focuses on addressing these challenges with the novel bilateral knee controller developed in chapter 4, and the latest M-BLUE exoskeleton shown in chapter 5. First we go through the development of a clinician friendly android app (GUI) that facilitates wireless, live modification of the coefficients of the task sensitized torque bases and also displays live control torques from the exoskeleton for both legs. Next we present the individual case studies focusing on customizing the controller to suit each participant’s highly unique gait deficits, and assessing the corresponding functional and biomechanical improvements with exoskeleton assistance.  We investigated two highly impaired cases of MS and PPS. The manual muscle test (MMT) and clinician assessment of the PPS patient revealed that he had a highly impaired (atrophied) right  75\n']
response: 自适应任务敏感扭矩控制通过动态调整基于任务的扭矩基函数参数、支持临床实时优化过程以及个性化适配，有效解决了受损个体因步态差异性带来的控制适应难题。该方法结合临床反馈与个体化数据，提升了外骨骼系统的适应性和功能性改善效果。
reference: 自适应任务敏感扭矩控制通过允许临床医生根据个体患者的步态缺陷和肌肉活动实时调整控制参数，解决了受损个体步态差异性的挑战。该方法避免了传统控制器对通用数据集的依赖及长时间优化过程，提升了个性化适应能力与临床实用性。

reference: 在线学习控制结合强化学习策略通过实时参数调整与奖励机制优化，使外骨骼系统能够动态适应用户步态特征与环境变化，从而提升步行过程中的助力适应性。该方法无需精确建模，依赖人机闭环反馈机制，实现个性化助力策略的在线优化。

retrieved_contexts: ['\nFIGURE 5. TESTING CONDITIONS USED TO ANALYZE THE STIFFNESS OF THE EXOSUIT COMPONENTS: (A) RAW TEXTILE, (C) EXOSUIT ON (B) BOWDEN CABLE, MANNEQUINM, AND (D) EXOSUIT ON HUMAN.  FIGURE 6. STRAINS IN THE TEXTILES VS. APPLIED FORCE. ARROWS INDICATE THE DIRECTION OF THE HYSTERESIS LOOPS.  For the subsequent three tests (Figure 5B-D), the multi-joint actuation unit was used to create forces in the suit via a Bowden cable [20]. The system, previously described in [20], is equipped with several sensors logging data at 1 kHz to track the displacement of the actuator and the force applied to the suit. The Bowden cable actuator contains a linear potentiometer (P3 America, Inc.) with a resolution of 0.1 mm to measure  4  Copyright © 2015 by ASME  displacement of the actuation cable. A Futek load cell with a measuring range of ±445 N (2N resolution) is placed at the distal end of the Bowden cable to measure the force applied. All subsequent the cable displacement at the actuator and the force at the distal load cell. To assess the stiffness of the cable and actuation system itself, both ends of the Bowden cable were fixed and a force of 300 N was applied and removed linearly over a period of 3 seconds, as shown in Figure 5B.  tests used  these measurements of  The stiffness of each structured functional textile component was characterized by placing the suit component on a mannequin, as shown in Figure 5C. Using a rigid mannequin permits the stiffness of the finished suit component to be measured without including the compliance of the human underneath. The component was placed on the vertical leg (mid- stance of gait cycle) of a fixed fiberglass mannequin. The distal end of the Bowden cable sheath was fixed on a rigid testing frame, and the inner cable was anchored to the component (right side). A maximum force of 250 N was applied and removed linearly over a period of 3 seconds. This process was repeated three times for each component, donning and doffing the component each time.\n']
response: 通过将外骨骼服组件安装在固定的人工骨架（mannequin）上，利用Bowden电缆执行器施加和释放线性力（如250 N或300 N），结合Futek力敏传感器与P3 America, Inc.线性电位计测量位移与力，记录1 kHz采样数据，绘制力-位移曲线以分析刚度特性，并重复测试以评估组件稳定性。
reference: 通过Bowden电缆执行器测量外骨骼服组件刚度特性的方法包括：使用线性位移电位计和负载单元记录电缆位移和施加力；在固定两端的条件下对电缆施加并移除300 N的力以测量其刚度；将外骨骼服组件置于人体模型上并通过Bowden电缆施加250 N的最大力，重复三次测试并记录力与位移数据，从而分析其刚度特性。

user_input: 不同深蹲方式（杠铃深蹲、器械深蹲和自重深蹲）在膝关节生物力学研究中表现出哪些共性与差异？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nReceived for publication February 2000. Accepted for publication March 2000.  127  level arms that are positioned on top of the shoulders (2). The squat can be performed with varying degrees of knee flexion, such as the half squat or full squat. The half squat involves squatting down until the thighs are parallel with the ground with approximately 0–100° knee flexion. The deep squat involves squatting down as far as possible until the posterior thighs and legs make contact with each other. The half squat is typically preferred and recommended over the full squat for athletes in training or rehabilitation patients (9,28).  An exhaustive search of MEDLINE (1966 to April 2000) and SPORTDiscus (1949 to April 2000) research databases was conducted to identify scientific literature relative to the biomechanics of the dynamic squat. The search strategy employed initially involved examining all fields containing “squat” and all fields containing “squat” AND “biomechan- ics.” Because the dynamic squat is the focus of this review, all literature relative to the isometric squat was excluded from the search. In addition, only studies published in peer- reviewed scientific journals, or published as conference proceedings/abstracts from scientific conferences, were considered for inclusion in this review. From the research database searches, it was determined that barbell squat, the isotonic machine squat, and BW squat comprised the squat biomechanics literature. Most studies that examined the biomechanics of the dynamic squat have focused on knee biomechanics. Therefore, this review was limited to scien- tific studies that quantified knee biomechanics during the barbell, machine, and BW dynamic squat exercises. Dy- namic squat studies that quantified knee biomechanics have primarily focused on three major areas: 1) knee forces comprising tibiofemoral shear force, tibiofemoral compres- sive force, and patellofemoral compressive force; 2) knee muscle activity from the quadriceps, hamstrings, and gas- trocnemius; and 3) anteroposterior and mediolateral knee stability. An understanding of knee biomechanics during the squat is important because a strong and stable knee is paramount to an athlete’s success or a patient’s rehabilita- tion. Therefore, the purpose of this review was to examine knee forces, knee muscle activity, and knee stability during the dynamic squat exercise.  Tibiofemoral Shear and Compressive Forces\n']
response: 不同深蹲方式在膝关节生物力学研究中表现出共性包括：均涉及胫股滑动力、胫股压缩力和髌股压缩力的产生与传递；均通过膝关节肌肉活动（股四头肌、腘绳肌和比目鱼肌）反映负荷；均被用于评估膝关节在动态深蹲中的稳定性表现。其差异主要体现在膝关节屈曲角度（如半蹲与深蹲的膝关节角度差异）以及动作模式对膝关节力学分布的影响上。
reference: 文献表明，杠铃深蹲、器械深蹲和自重深蹲在膝关节生物力学研究中均涉及胫股剪切力、压缩力、髌股压缩力、相关肌群活动及膝关节稳定性的分析。然而，文献未提供三者在这些参数上的具体共性与差异，亦未进行直接比较。因此，关于不同深蹲方式在膝关节生物力学上的共性与差异，当前参考文本无相关内容。

reference: 文中提出的柔性滑动框架通过由上板与下板组成的滑动结构，在燕尾滑块引导下实现中间部分的相对滑动，从而在弯曲载荷下具有高柔顺性，在拉压方向上保持高刚度。该结构设计实现了拉压刚度与弯曲柔顺性的协同优化，但受限于工程塑料的端部刚度，可能影响力的有效传递。

retrieved_contexts: ['\n26  VOLUME 1, 2022  assistance [42]. It is thus possible that our outcomes would im- prove by providing more acclimation time. Additional human subjects would be needed to draw more general conclusions about the controller’s effectiveness, which is left to future work.  VI. CONCLUSION This paper applied a novel energetic control strategy based IDA-PBC that can assist all primary ADLs with a back- drivable knee-ankle exoskeleton. Whereas prior work on passivity-based energy-shaping control behaved as nonlin- ear virtual springs, this paper incorporated global orientation and vGRF feedback to broaden the capabilities of the con- troller while preserving input-output passivity and stability of the closed-loop system. We increased the candidate basis functions in the optimization process, which achieved an op- timal controller that ﬁts normalized able-bodied human joint torques more closely for more tasks. We considered “L1 reg- ularization,” which ﬁts the data with as few parameters as possible to avoid overﬁtting problems. We also demonstrated the potential of the implemented controller to reduce muscular effort in a human subjects study involving level-ground, ramp, and stairs walking as well as sit-stand transitions.  Future work could consider inconsistencies between the optimization dataset and real-time GRF data from exoskele- ton sensors. Moreover, lighter backdrivable exoskeletons are being developed [11], [12] that could avoid co-contractions and/or compensations associated with exoskeleton mass, en- abling more consistent reductions in muscle activation. Future work could also incorporate the passive and active dynam- ics of the relevant muscle-tendon units to further improve biomimicry of the assistance torque.  ACKNOWLEDGMENT The authors would like to thank Erica Santos and Kayla Shepodd for their assistance. The content is solely the respon- sibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the ofﬁcial views of the NSF or NIH.  REFERENCES [1] G. Zeilig, H. Weingarden, M. Zwecker, I. Shah, “Safety and feasibility of using the EksoTM bionic exoskeleton to aid ambulation after spinal cord injury,” J. Spine, vol. 4, pp. 1–8, 2013.\n']

reference: 实验结果显示所设计控制器在平地行走、坡道行走、楼梯行走以及坐站转换等典型任务中表现出降低肌肉激活的潜力。

user_input: 在SS-Incline试验中，为何需要对行走速度进行限制，并且这一限制对实验结果有何影响？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe ﬁrst 3 trials investigated the behavior differences be- tween the HKIC and the FSMC during steady walking at different speed and incline combinations. Each trial focused on a range of small task deviations (±2 deg, ±0.2 m/s) around one of three baseline tasks: χ = (0 deg, 1 m/s), χ = (5 deg, 1 m/s), and χ = (-5 deg, 1 m/s). We refer to these steady- state task trials as SS-Level, SS-Incline, and SS-Decline, respectively. For the SS-Incline trial, speed was limited to 1.1 m/s to ensure that the participant could safely perform the trial. The steady-state task trials began with an acclimation period,  where the participant walked at the baseline task until feeling comfortable. During this time, the FSMC was tuned by the research team to produce a natural gait, incorporating feedback from the participant and the prosthetist. The time taken to tune the controller was recorded. Note that no tuning was done for the HKIC. Then, the participant walked on the treadmill as it cycled through each of the 5 tasks within the small range, each commanded for 45 seconds. The acclimation, tuning, and testing procedure above was repeated for each baseline task. These baseline tasks were chosen to be far apart in the task space so that we could sample a wide range of tasks without deviating too far from any one of the FSMC’s tuning points. Fig. 5a shows the recorded task-space proﬁles from the treadmill for each trial, where the black dots indicate each commanded task. Note that both controllers were provided with true task feedback from the treadmill during these trials so that task estimate errors did not inﬂuence the results.\n']
response: 在SS-Incline试验中，行走速度被限制至1.1 m/s以确保参与者安全完成试验。这一限制减少了因速度过快可能引发的风险，从而保障了实验环境的安全性。速度限制对实验结果的影响在于，它确保了在不同坡度条件下任务执行的可控性，有助于准确评估控制系统在稳定状态下的行为表现。文献未提供速度限制对任务执行效率或运动适应性的影响数据，因此无法进一步推断其对实验结果的其他潜在影响。
reference: 在SS-Incline试验中，行走速度被限制到1.1 m/s是为了确保参与者能够安全完成试验。这一限制可能影响步态自然性和控制器调参效果，但由于实验在小范围任务偏差内进行且控制器接收真实反馈，因此未对实验结果的可靠性造成显著干扰。

user_input: 自适应助力控制在膝关节处如何实现对远端关节肌群疲劳的补偿机制？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nMoreover, the real working environment involves not just LL, but lifting-lowering-carrying (LLC) over multi-terrain. The current exoskeleton/controller technologies fall short in fulfilling Ideally, assistive torques at the knee will target the root cause of poor LL this versatile need. biomechanics: weak/fatigued distal joint musculature. With this assistance, we would expect to see less stooping post-fatigue with orthotic assistance. The orthosis should also reduce muscle ef- fort to delay fatigue, allowing proper lifting biomechanics for longer periods to prevent low-back injuries in the workplace. Moreover, since quadriceps are stressed during high demand activities such as stairs and ramp climbing, the ideal orthosis should be versatile enough to provide assis- tance in multiple tasks. To address these gaps, we first designed a novel bilateral knee controller that facilitates multi-terrain lifting-lowering-carrying (LLC) in chapter 4, and later performed pre- clinical validation on eight healthy subjects using the M-BLUE bilateral knee modules in both fatiguing and non-fatiguing tasks in chapter 5.  1.1.3 Post-polio syndrome and Multiple sclerosis  Post-polio syndrome (PPS) is a neurological disorder that can affect polio survivors decades after the occurrence of the polio infection [Li Hi Shing et al., 2019]. While the polio vaccine has largely eradicated polio in the US and other parts of the world, an elderly population of polio survivors still remains who are at risk of developing PPS. Recent anti-vaccine sentiments fueled by the covid- 19 pandemic may once again make this disease more widespread [Harvard International Review, 2023]. From the perspective of mobility, the polio affected neurons gradually degenerate causing progressive muscle weakness, fatigue, pain and hamper gait performance. PPS patients are often exhausted even after little activity. Walking, rising from a chair and stair climbing are a challenge  4\n']
response: 自适应助力控制在膝关节处通过设计多功能双侧控制器实现对远端关节肌群疲劳的补偿机制，旨在减少肌肉努力并延缓疲劳。该控制器在多地形、多任务（如楼梯和坡道）中具备适应能力，提供与肌群需求协调的助力。尽管进行了预临床验证，但文献未明确说明其控制策略的具体实现机制，仅指出其具备减少弯腰、提升搬运性能的潜力。
reference: 自适应助力控制在膝关节处通过对远端关节肌群疲劳状态的识别，动态调节辅助力矩以减轻肌肉负荷，从而延缓疲劳并维持生物力学稳定性。该机制通过双侧膝关节控制器实现，支持多地形提举-下降-携带任务，并在疲劳与非疲劳状态下进行临床前验证，确保在不同任务需求下提供有效补偿。

user_input: 根据文献，期望刚度与被动刚度之间的差异是如何定义的，其在假设验证中的作用是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nParam  Value  Param  Value  [θ0,lτ0,l]  [−2, 0]  Kdes,0  5  TABLE 2 | Piece-wise linear unit curve parameter values.  Param  Value  Param  Value  [θ0,pτ0,p] [θ2,p,τ2,p] [θ4,p,τ4,p]  [−2, 0]  [−12, 50]  [8, 0]  [θ1,p,τ1,p] [θ3,p,τ3,p]  [−8, 20]  [0, 12.5]  Frontiers in Neurorobotics | www.frontiersin.org  9  Optimal Passive Stiffness in Torque-Controlled Exoskeletons  subject standing in neutral position. Such walking sessions were repeated multiple times for the same passive stiﬀness along the study. For each session of one hundred steps, the instantaneous value of passive stiﬀness at each time stamp was calculated and presented in relation to the measured torque values. Figure 4 presentssuchplotsofpassivewalkingsessionsfordiﬀerentspring conﬁgurations, one session for each conﬁguration. Median of the instantaneous passive stiﬀness values within the stabilized region was deﬁned as the stabilized passive stiﬀness value of the session. For any spring conﬁguration, its stabilized region is deﬁned as a 5.65 Nm torque range, within which the change of trend for the instantaneous passive stiﬀness averaged over all sessions is minimum. The mean of the stabilized passive stiﬀness values across multiple experimental sessions for the same passive stiﬀness conﬁguration was then used as its eﬀective passive stiﬀness value.  2.6.3. Deﬁnition of Difference in Desired and Passive Stiffness Values The diﬀerence between the desired and passive stiﬀnesses is an important index since Hypotheses 1 and 2 state that the optimal passive stiﬀness for torque tracking equals the the desired quasi- stiﬀness and torque errors are closely related to the diﬀerence between the two. In analyzing our experimental results, this value is deﬁned as the algebraic diﬀerence between the desired and passive values, i.e., Kt − Kdes.  2.6.4. Experiment Procedures The key to be able to compare the inﬂuence of passive stiﬀness on torque tracking performance under a ﬁxed desired quasi-stiﬀness is to evaluate the “best” tracking performance under each passive stiﬀness conﬁguration. We did so by experimentally evaluate the tracking errors of multiple experimental sessions, each with diﬀerent feedback control gains. The lowest error across these trials was then assigned as the estimate of the actual optimal performance with this passive stiﬀness.\n']
response: 期望刚度与被动刚度之间的差异定义为 $ K_t - K_{\text{des}} $，即期望刚度减去被动刚度的代数差。该差异在假设验证中用于评估不同被动刚度配置对扭矩跟踪性能的影响，并通过比较最小跟踪误差来衡量实际最优性能，从而验证被动刚度对扭矩跟踪误差的敏感性和优化潜力。
reference: 期望刚度与被动刚度之间的差异定义为两者的代数差（Kt − Kdes），其在假设验证中用于衡量扭矩跟踪性能的优劣，并作为判断最优被动刚度是否等于期望准刚度的依据。

user_input: 针对不同步态障碍患者（如脑卒中、脊髓损伤）的外骨骼设计在辅助需求上存在哪些差异？
retrieved_contexts: ['\na  Unimpaired weight-bearing  b  Unimpaired joint-targeting  In this Review, we first synthesize key advances in exoskeleton technology in the early twenty-first century and highlight recent exo- skeleton designs, offering clinical insight into how exoskeletons can improve gait rehabilitation and identifying future directions for wear- able robots. For devices designed for unimpaired adults, we focus on gait and exclude research in industrial applications (unless they are particularly relevant). We then discuss exoskeletons aimed at reduc- ing the metabolic cost of walking in unimpaired individuals, which has been a principal focus since the 1990s. For devices intended to be used for people with gait impairments, we exclude research reported only in animal models. Rather, we include representative studies of people with stroke, traumatic brain injury (TBI), multiple sclerosis (MS), cerebral palsy (CP), and complete and incomplete spinal-cord injury (SCI-c, SCI-i). These conditions represent a range of gait impairments that require anywhere from full assistance (the case of SCI) to partial assistance (the case of stroke, MS, TBI and CP).  Load  c  Clinical weight-bearing  d  Assist  Clinical joint-targeting  Wearable robots The Cybathlon—a non-profit project of the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Zürich, in which people with physical disabilities com- pete against each other every 4 years to complete everyday tasks using assistive technologies—has showcased a variety of exoskeletons used in various challenges44. Lower-extremity exoskeletons are similar to one another in their ability to augment human performance or restore movement; however, they differ in some key characteristics, such as device function and purpose.  Load  Assist  Fig. 1 | Examples of autonomous exoskeletons. a, Weight-bearing applications in unimpaired users. b, Joint-targeting applications in unimpaired users. c, Weight-bearing applications in clinical populations. d, Joint-targeting applications in clinical populations.\n']
response: 针对脑卒中、脊髓损伤等不同步态障碍患者的外骨骼设计在辅助类型、功能需求、适应性及康复目标方面存在显著差异。脑卒中患者需实现部分到全辅助，以恢复运动控制与步态协调；脊髓损伤患者则侧重于支撑与关节定向辅助以实现临床体重承载。外骨骼设计需满足个性化康复目标，适应不同神经功能损伤带来的运动能力变化。
reference: 针对不同步态障碍患者的外骨骼设计在辅助需求上存在显著差异：脊髓损伤（SCI）患者通常需要“完全辅助”，而脑卒中、脑外伤、多发性硬化和脑瘫患者多需“部分辅助”。此外，外骨骼辅助策略可分为“体重支撑”和“关节定向辅助”，前者适用于运动功能严重受损者如SCI，后者适用于需要恢复特定关节控制的患者如脑卒中患者。设计还需考虑康复目标差异，如SCI注重功能性行走，脑卒中注重步态对称性与神经可塑性促进。

response: 文中提出的连续相位刚度模型通过在不同步态阶段赋予不同的刚度权重函数（S(θk,r,θk,l) ∈ [0,1]），在支撑相早期（S = 0）和摆动相早期（S = 1）分别采用对应刚度模型，从而实现膝关节力矩估计的平滑性和连续性。实验结果进一步验证了该模型在不同行走速度下的力矩曲线为连续光滑曲线，有效提升了膝关节力矩估计的性能。
reference: 文中通过引入S型函数S(θk,r,θk,l)在支撑相和摆动相刚度模型之间进行连续加权过渡，避免了相位切换时的突变，从而实现了膝关节力矩估计的平滑性和连续性。

user_input: 与传统的坐-站转移助力策略相比，本文提出的自适应助力扭矩轨迹控制方法具有哪些优势？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nin  the user and  B. Design and Control  The pDOFs in a self-aligning mechanism should be designed to work smoothly under the high load generated by the actuation system during assistance. The pDOFs should also be lightweight and unobtrusive, as adding significant weight or dimension to the exoskeleton may negate its assistive function [30]. The proposed design includes two pDOFs in the Sagittal  plane to compensate for vertical misalignments of the powered axis. Our design also includes one pDOF in the frontal plane to the knee accommodate for physiological variations varus/valgus angle, allowing the exoskeleton to be used on both right and left legs and by different users, without hardware modifications (Fig. 1). As a result of the proposed symmetric design (Fig. 1) of our knee exoskeleton, the reaction forces acting on the self-aligning mechanism during assistance are naturally balanced and no torsion is generated, so the pDOFs can be made lightweight. The self-aligning mechanism accounts for only 5.3% (0.190 kg) of total exoskeleton weight (3.6 kg) and all pDOFs are integrated within the exoskeleton frame. Thus, in the proposed design, the pDOFs can transmit high assistive torques, while having a minimal effect on the weight and dimensions of the powered exoskeleton.  in  In this paper, we propose a novel approach to control sit-to- stand transitions with a powered knee exoskeleton. Assistive strategies developed for individuals with spinal cord injury rely on stiff closed-loop position controllers that enforce a specified sit-to-stand trajectory without requiring active participation of the user [31]. In contrast, systems developed for healthy subjects rely on closed-loop torque control with no predefined position trajectory [32]. For example, in [33] a gaussian curve with fixed centroid and variable torque peak is used to determine the assistive torque provided by the exoskeleton, whereas electromyography is used in [34]. In our controller, the assistive torque trajectory is adapted at the beginning of the sit- to-stand movement by determining the location of the peak torque, normalized by the knee angle when the user is sitting (Fig. 5, Fig. 10). This adaptive strategy has the potential to make the assistive controller more robust to variations in user anthropometry and seat height.\n']
response: 与传统坐-站转移助力策略相比，本文提出的自适应助力扭矩轨迹控制方法具有以下优势：1）通过动态调整峰值扭矩位置，实现对用户个体差异和环境变化的自适应控制；2）减少对外部坐姿参数的依赖，提高在不同用户和座椅配置下的适用性；3）提升坐-站过渡过程的自然性和安全性；4）保持外骨骼装置的轻量化与紧凑性，同时增强控制鲁棒性。
reference: 本文提出的自适应助力扭矩轨迹控制方法相较于传统坐-站转移助力策略具有以下优势：通过在运动初期自适应调整峰值扭矩位置并基于坐姿膝角归一化，增强了对用户个体差异和外部环境变化（如座椅高度）的鲁棒性；与依赖预设轨迹的闭环位置控制相比，该方法无需限制用户运动路径，提升了用户主动参与度；相较于固定形状高斯曲线或肌电信号驱动的控制策略，其自适应机制更简洁且响应更快，提升了控制系统的个性化与实时性。

user_input: 四个协同驱动的肌/电机对在步态周期中如何根据有限状态机切换控制策略？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nFig. 3. Vanderbilt lower limb exoskeleton.  Fig. 6. Four states involved in walking and the muscles stimulated.  Fig. 4. Exoskeleton control board, shown with muscle stimulator module (which plugs into the control board within the outline shown).  lator produces two independent channels of current-controlled symmetrical biphasic stimulation pulses. The pulse width, cur- rentamplitude,andpulsefrequencyofeachbiphasicstimulation channel are controllable via the microcontroller. One of the two exoskeleton control boards, along with the plug-in electric stim- ulator that is typically mounted on it, is shown in Fig. 4. In order to facilitate prototyping and implementation of the cooperative controller, the embedded system in the exoskeleton is interfaced with MATLAB Real-Time Workshop via a CAN tether, such that all sensor inputs and control outputs of the exoskeleton, in- cluding stimulation channels, are assessable and controllable, respectively, from a laptop computer.  B. Controller Implementation  The four cooperatively actuated muscle/motor pairs are the left and right quadriceps and knee motor combination (used during swing), and the hamstrings and hip motor combination (used during stance). As such, the control structure shown in Fig. 1 was implemented at each of these four joints. The inputs to these joint-level cooperative controllers are governed by a ﬁ- nite state machine (FSM), which is described in detail in [38]. For purposes of walking, the FSM is described by four essential states, which are right step (state 1), double-support with right footforward(state2),leftstep(state3),anddouble-supportwith left foot forward (state 4), as illustrated in Fig. 5. During normal walking, the state machine moves sequentially through these statesina repeatingfashion, asillustratedinFig.6. Asdescribed\n']
response: 四个协同驱动的肌/电机对在步态周期中通过有限状态机（FSM）根据步态状态依次切换控制策略。步态周期分为四个状态：右支撑步、双支撑右脚向前、左支撑步和双支撑左脚向前。每个状态对应特定的肌/电机组合（如摆动阶段使用股四头肌与膝电机，支撑阶段使用腘绳肌与髋电机），FSM按顺序循环切换，实现对步态阶段的精确控制。
reference: 四个协同驱动的肌/电机对（左右股四头肌-膝电机组合与腘绳肌-髋电机组合）在步态周期中通过有限状态机（FSM）切换控制策略。FSM定义了四个状态：右步态（state 1）、右脚前双支撑（state 2）、左步态（state 3）和左脚前双支撑（state 4），并按顺序循环切换。每个状态对应不同的步态阶段，从而调度相应的肌肉/电机协同控制输入。控制器通过嵌入式系统与MATLAB Real-Time Workshop交互，实时调整电刺激参数（如脉宽、幅值、频率），实现对协同驱动对的动态调控。

user_input: 与传统外骨骼控制方法相比，混合FES系统在下肢运动恢复中的优势体现在哪些方面？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nmotion in individuals with paraplegia, a number of researchers have investigated the use of functional electrical stimulation (FES) to artiﬁcially elicit and control leg muscle contraction, thereby utilizing the musculature and metabolic power supply of the paraplegic subject to generate legged locomotion. Some of the research efforts in this regard include [3]–[13]. In ad- dition to providing power for locomotion, FES-aided gait has also been shown to provide a number of associated physiolog- ical beneﬁts, some of which include increased muscle strength, increased bone density, decreased spasticity, and improved car- diovascular health [14]–[20]. Despite this, FES-based systems entail a number of challenges; most notably, muscles are difﬁ- cult to control, particularly in the absence of adequate sensory information, and muscle torque output tends to fatigue rapidly, as a byproduct of the synchronous activation and preferential recruitment of fast-twitch muscle ﬁbers associated with FES.  Index Terms—Cooperative controller, functional electrical stim- ulation (FES), hybrid FES, powered lower limb exoskeleton, spinal cord injury (SCI).  I. INTRODUCTION  O NE of the most signiﬁcant impairments resulting from  paraplegia is the inability to stand and walk [1]. In ad- dition to diminished mobility, spinal cord injury (SCI) and the inability to stand and walk can entail signiﬁcant health implica- tions, including loss of bone mineral content, pressure-induced skin problems, increased incidence of urinary tract infection, muscle spasticity, impaired lymphatic and vascular circulation, impaired digestive operation, and reduced respiratory and car- diovascular capacities [2]. In an effort to restore legged loco-\n']
response: 混合FES系统相较于传统FES方法的优势主要体现在：1）通过集成传感器反馈提升肌肉控制精度；2）优化肌肉激活同步性与协调性，延缓疲劳；3）增强系统适应性和个性化康复能力；4）提高下肢运动恢复的稳定性和安全性。
reference: 与传统外骨骼控制方法相比，混合FES系统在下肢运动恢复中的优势主要体现在：1）利用患者自身肌肉收缩实现运动控制，增强生理适应性；2）带来多种生理益处，包括增强肌肉力量、增加骨密度、减少痉挛及改善心血管健康；3）通过利用患者代谢能量，提高运动效率和个体化控制能力；4）相较于传统外骨骼，更贴近自然运动模式，促进神经肌肉功能恢复。

response: 图2.5中膝踝关节力矩叠加方式通过同时记录外骨骼辅助力矩与肌电信号（EMG），直观展示了与相关肌群（如膝关节对应VMO和BF，踝关节对应TA和SOL）的协同作用。随着外骨骼辅助力矩的增加，相关肌群的激活水平显著降低，表明肌群在辅助作用下被抑制，体现了协同控制机制。图中力矩分布与肌电信号的同步性进一步验证了外骨骼与肌群之间的动态响应关系。
reference: 图2.5通过将膝踝关节辅助力矩叠加在对应肌群（如VMO、BF、TA、SOL）的EMG信号上，体现了外骨骼力矩与肌肉激活的时序一致性。在主动模式下，外骨骼在肌肉激活高峰期提供力矩辅助，从而降低了相关肌群的EMG幅值，显示出与肌肉自然协同作用的设计策略。

user_input: 为什么在康复训练和运动员训练中推荐使用半蹲而非全蹲？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nReceived for publication February 2000. Accepted for publication March 2000.  127  level arms that are positioned on top of the shoulders (2). The squat can be performed with varying degrees of knee flexion, such as the half squat or full squat. The half squat involves squatting down until the thighs are parallel with the ground with approximately 0–100° knee flexion. The deep squat involves squatting down as far as possible until the posterior thighs and legs make contact with each other. The half squat is typically preferred and recommended over the full squat for athletes in training or rehabilitation patients (9,28).  An exhaustive search of MEDLINE (1966 to April 2000) and SPORTDiscus (1949 to April 2000) research databases was conducted to identify scientific literature relative to the biomechanics of the dynamic squat. The search strategy employed initially involved examining all fields containing “squat” and all fields containing “squat” AND “biomechan- ics.” Because the dynamic squat is the focus of this review, all literature relative to the isometric squat was excluded from the search. In addition, only studies published in peer- reviewed scientific journals, or published as conference proceedings/abstracts from scientific conferences, were considered for inclusion in this review. From the research database searches, it was determined that barbell squat, the isotonic machine squat, and BW squat comprised the squat biomechanics literature. Most studies that examined the biomechanics of the dynamic squat have focused on knee biomechanics. Therefore, this review was limited to scien- tific studies that quantified knee biomechanics during the barbell, machine, and BW dynamic squat exercises. Dy- namic squat studies that quantified knee biomechanics have primarily focused on three major areas: 1) knee forces comprising tibiofemoral shear force, tibiofemoral compres- sive force, and patellofemoral compressive force; 2) knee muscle activity from the quadriceps, hamstrings, and gas- trocnemius; and 3) anteroposterior and mediolateral knee stability. An understanding of knee biomechanics during the squat is important because a strong and stable knee is paramount to an athlete’s success or a patient’s rehabilita- tion. Therefore, the purpose of this review was to examine knee forces, knee muscle activity, and knee stability during the dynamic squat exercise.  Tibiofemoral Shear and Compressive Forces\n']
response: 在康复训练和运动员训练中推荐使用半蹲而非全蹲，是因为半蹲的膝关节屈曲角度较小（0–100°），有助于维持膝关节稳定性；同时，半蹲便于评估膝关节的剪切力、压缩力、髌股关节负荷以及股四头肌、腘绳肌和胫骨前肌的肌电信号，因此更适合用于膝关节功能恢复和运动表现优化。
reference: 在康复训练和运动员训练中推荐使用半蹲而非全蹲，主要是因为半蹲在膝关节生物力学上更为安全，能够有效控制胫股剪切力、压缩力及髌股压力，同时保证膝关节的前后和内外稳定性。相较之下，全蹲可能带来更高的关节负荷和潜在损伤风险，因此在需要保护膝关节的训练或康复阶段，通常更推荐使用半蹲。

These have the advantage that the wearer–device interface can be implemented simply and with light weight; but, sometimes they may cause wearer discomfort owing to the transmission of uneven pressure to the wearer’s skin when applying large forces. Under this condition, a large gap between the wearer’s body and the support frame also arises, even though the wearer’s thigh/shank are tied tightly enough. To apply adequate forces to wearer’s bodies with lower clearance and less discomfort, we propose a uniform-pressure fastener. As shown in Fig. 7(c), the uniform-pressure fastener includes a link assembly in which a plurality of links are connected to wrap around the wearer’s body. A cable installed in the link assembly is conﬁgured to adjust the angle between adjacent links. As illustrated in Fig. 7(c), the interaction force Fi acting on each link i advances toward a center point O located inside the wearer’s body, over which the fastener is mounted. response: 均匀压力固定装置的合力计算公式反映了力的矢量叠加特性以及力在空间分布中的角度修正效应，体现了其在实现均匀压力分布和减少穿戴者不适方面的力学基础。
reference: 均匀压力固定装置的合力计算公式 F = 2σrw sin(θ/2) 反映了结构几何参数与材料力学特性之间的耦合关系，表明其通过调节连杆间夹角 θ 实现力的均匀分布，从而降低皮肤压力集中并提高穿戴舒适性。该公式进一步说明合力方向指向穿戴者体内中心点 O，体现了其贴合性与低间隙的力学设计特性。

retrieved_contexts: ['\nFrontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology | www.frontiersin.org  5  June 2017 | Volume 5 | Article 37  Young et al.  FigUre 3 | Average electromyography (EMG) signals (top row) and average control signals (bottom row) from one subject. These data were averaged over 30 min of walking. The top left shows the smoothed EMG signal from the rectus femoris (normalized to the maximum value during the gait cycle), and the top right shows the smoothed EMG signal from the gluteus maximus. The rectus femoris signal was used to determine the control signal for hip flexion, and the gluteus maximus was used for hip extension. The burst in rectus femoris activity in early stance was ignored by the controller. A gain and a threshold were manually set for each muscle and each subject to ensure that the peak muscle activity corresponded with a maximum supply signal output. The resulting control signal for hip flexion is shown in the bottom left and for hip extension in the bottom right.  FigUre 4 | Experimental setup. Electrogoniometers recorded the exoskeleton hip joint motion. Pneumatic actuators produced flexion and extension forces recorded by load cells in series with the actuators. Motion capture recorded motion of the exoskeleton user. We recorded oxygen consumption and carbon dioxide production with a portable metabolic measurement system. We used electromyography (EMG) electrodes on the lower limbs to record muscle activation patterns. The treadmill had 6-DOF force plates to record ground reaction forces. The last question (#4) was a more open ended question that allowed subjects to describe the controllers in their own words and provide general feedback to us about the control strategies.  Data analysis We normalized data to the gait cycle by segmenting at heel strike. For each subject, data were averaged across all the walking strides of each trial. We calculated the across subject averages and SDs using the average value at each time point during the gait cycle for each subject. All data collected are from users using the exoskeleton device described in Section “Device Design.”\n']
response: 实验中通过肌电信号（EMG）记录下肢肌肉激活模式，结合运动捕捉系统评估用户运动状态，同时使用代谢测量系统记录能量消耗与二氧化碳产生量，以及通过电容式关节运动记录仪与加载传感器测量外骨骼的运动学输出与力矩响应，从而全面评估外骨骼控制系统对人体运动的影响。
reference: 实验通过肌电信号（EMG）、运动捕捉、电测角计、地面反作用力气板和代谢测量系统等手段采集数据，评估外骨骼控制系统对人体肌肉激活、关节运动、步态力学及能量消耗的影响。

retrieved_contexts: ['\nParam  Value  Param  Value  [θ0,lτ0,l]  [−2, 0]  Kdes,0  5  TABLE 2 | Piece-wise linear unit curve parameter values.  Param  Value  Param  Value  [θ0,pτ0,p] [θ2,p,τ2,p] [θ4,p,τ4,p]  [−2, 0]  [−12, 50]  [8, 0]  [θ1,p,τ1,p] [θ3,p,τ3,p]  [−8, 20]  [0, 12.5]  Frontiers in Neurorobotics | www.frontiersin.org  9  Optimal Passive Stiffness in Torque-Controlled Exoskeletons  subject standing in neutral position. Such walking sessions were repeated multiple times for the same passive stiﬀness along the study. For each session of one hundred steps, the instantaneous value of passive stiﬀness at each time stamp was calculated and presented in relation to the measured torque values. Figure 4 presentssuchplotsofpassivewalkingsessionsfordiﬀerentspring conﬁgurations, one session for each conﬁguration. Median of the instantaneous passive stiﬀness values within the stabilized region was deﬁned as the stabilized passive stiﬀness value of the session. For any spring conﬁguration, its stabilized region is deﬁned as a 5.65 Nm torque range, within which the change of trend for the instantaneous passive stiﬀness averaged over all sessions is minimum. The mean of the stabilized passive stiﬀness values across multiple experimental sessions for the same passive stiﬀness conﬁguration was then used as its eﬀective passive stiﬀness value.  2.6.3. Deﬁnition of Difference in Desired and Passive Stiffness Values The diﬀerence between the desired and passive stiﬀnesses is an important index since Hypotheses 1 and 2 state that the optimal passive stiﬀness for torque tracking equals the the desired quasi- stiﬀness and torque errors are closely related to the diﬀerence between the two. In analyzing our experimental results, this value is deﬁned as the algebraic diﬀerence between the desired and passive values, i.e., Kt − Kdes.  2.6.4. Experiment Procedures The key to be able to compare the inﬂuence of passive stiﬀness on torque tracking performance under a ﬁxed desired quasi-stiﬀness is to evaluate the “best” tracking performance under each passive stiﬀness conﬁguration. We did so by experimentally evaluate the tracking errors of multiple experimental sessions, each with diﬀerent feedback control gains. The lowest error across these trials was then assigned as the estimate of the actual optimal performance with this passive stiﬀness.\n']
response: 文中定义不同弹簧配置下的稳定被动刚度值为在扭矩范围内瞬态被动刚度值的中位数，且该范围定义为±5.65 Nm；其有效被动刚度值为同一弹簧配置下所有实验会话中稳定被动刚度值的均值。实验通过100步行走采集瞬态被动刚度值并关联输出扭矩，结合反馈控制参数评估跟踪误差最小值，从而确定最优被动刚度配置。
reference: 文中定义并计算不同弹簧配置下的稳定被动刚度值如下：首先在稳定区域（5.65 Nm扭矩范围内，瞬时被动刚度变化趋势最小）内，计算每个实验会话中瞬时被动刚度值的中位数，作为该会话的稳定被动刚度值；然后对同一弹簧配置下的多个实验会话的稳定被动刚度值取平均，得到该配置的有效被动刚度值（effective passive stiffness value）。

reference: 靶向语言提示通过提供即时的任务导向性指令，增强卒中患者的注意力和运动意图，从而即刻改善步态参数（如步长、步速和对称性）。其作用机制可能涉及促进认知-运动整合及增强运动控制的可塑性，但具体神经通路仍需进一步研究。

user_input: 外骨骼在Late Stance阶段如何根据垂直地面反作用力变化调整髋关节屈曲扭矩？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n(1)  State 3—Late Stance During the third state, from approximately 35–60% of the gait cycle, the exoskeleton provided active hip flexion assistance with a supply signal linearly related to the subject’s weight on the stance leg. As the subject removed weight from the leg, the supply signal linearly decreased to 0 based on the force measurement (Eq. 2).  SupplyPressure  =  CurrentVerticalForce MaximumVerticalForce  × MaximumSupplyPressure  The output hip flexion scales linearly with vertical weight. The maximum vertical force was set at the beginning of the  (2)  Frontiers in Bioengineering and Biotechnology | www.frontiersin.org  4  June 2017 | Volume 5 | Article 37  Young et al.  experiment and was different based on the subject’s weight (approximately 1.2 times body weight). This force corresponds to the second peak in the vertical ground reaction force profile. The supply pressure scales linearly with applied weight. Thus, the state has a large flexion torque applied during the beginning with the rise of the second peak of vertical ground reaction force and drops off as the person takes weight off the leg and transitions into swing.  State 4—Swing The exoskeleton was unpowered in the fourth state (swing phase). The transitions in the state machine were determined by the user’s ground reaction force profile (Figure 2B). The state mac- hine controller determined stance and swing phases based on a threshold value (15% of body weight). The transition between early stance and mid stance was determined based on a 5% drop in the vertical ground reaction force signal from the first peak of the profile. The transition between mid stance and late stance was determined based on a 5% increase in the ground reaction force signal from the middle trough of the profile.\n']
response: 外骨骼在Late Stance阶段根据垂直地面反作用力的变化调整髋关节屈曲扭矩，通过线性关系将垂直地面反作用力与输出扭矩关联，并在该阶段的第二峰（约60%步态周期）提供最大扭矩输出，随后随着体重转移（垂直力下降）而逐步减小至零，从而实现髋关节屈曲辅助的动态响应。
reference: 在Late Stance阶段，外骨骼根据垂直地面反作用力变化，通过线性调节供给压力控制髋关节屈曲扭矩：扭矩随支撑腿垂直力增加而增大，在垂直力下降时随之减小，确保在步态过渡期间提供动态适配的助力。

user_input: 任务无关控制方案在何种活动场景下表现出较好的助力有效性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n1.2 Contributions and organization of the Dissertation  In chapter 2, I improve and assess an existing task-invariant control scheme by implementing a custom foot pressure sensor for Comex 1 and perform preliminary in-vivo validation. My group’s prior work [Lv et al., 2018] developed the first version of a partial assistance controller that reduced  6  the effect of gravity on the wearer’s joints by way of a nonlinear controls technique of (potential) energy shaping. In effect it provided virtual body weight support (vBWS). Since this assistance scheme transcends the need to be pre-programmed for a particular activity/task, it is fundamentally “task-invariant”. However, vBWS does not consider body weight load distribution between the two limbs during double support phases, causing excessive assistance torques by assuming all bodyweight is supported by a single limb (single support). By utilizing the vertical ground reaction force (vGRF) feedback from a custom designed force sensing foot plate, chapter 2 significantly improves the vBWS controller for double support phases, and investigates its efficacy on a single healthy subject for multiple activities of daily living (ADLs) using Comex 1. Experimental results suggest that vBWS with vGRF is an effective assistance scheme for slow activities such as getting up from a chair and performing a squat.\n']
response: 任务无关控制方案在涉及缓慢、低动态需求的日常活动中，结合双支撑阶段的垂直地面反作用力（vGRF）反馈优化，表现出较好的助力有效性，尤其在如从椅子起身和蹲下等动作中。
reference: 任务无关控制方案在缓慢的、非周期性的日常活动场景中，如从椅子上起身和深蹲等动作中，表现出较好的助力有效性。

response: 文中对比了 PHI 和 WOP 两种外骨骼控制方法在 EMG 上的差异。在楼梯上下（Stairs Ascent/Descent）、坡道（Decline，包括 −5.2° 和 −12.4°）、坐站周期（Sit-Stand cycle）以及 treadmill 任务中，VMO、GM 和 SOL 在 PHI 和 WOP 方法下表现出显著统计差异。其中，VMO 在 treadmill 任务中由 PHI 方法激活更低，而 GM 和 SOL 在 treadmill 任务中由 WOP 方法激活更高。
reference: 文中对比了PHI方法和WOP方法在外骨骼控制中的肌肉激活（EMG）差异。两种方法在VMO、GM和SOL肌肉中在跑步机任务和楼梯任务（Stairs Ascent/Descent）中表现出显著统计差异，而VMO在Sit-Stand任务中也显示出显著差异。具体任务包括上楼梯、下楼梯（7英寸台阶高度）、下坡（−5.2°, −12.4°）、平地行走（1 m/s或0.8 m/s）、上坡（5.2°, 12.4°）以及坐-站转换任务（45 BPM），差异通过统计标注（p < 0.05, p ≤ 0.01, p ≤ 0.001）确认。

reference: 在使用TCN-LSTM混合模型进行风力发电预测时，引入Savitzky-Golay滤波器的作用是对输入的时间序列数据进行平滑处理，以去除噪声干扰并保留关键趋势特征，从而提高预测模型的稳定性和准确性。

response: 文中提到使用自适应频率振荡器的动态腿部运动共振机制，其核心控制原理是通过频率自适应调节实现与人体步态周期的同步，从而增强运动协调性与能量效率。
reference: 自适应频率振荡器（AFO）用于动态腿部运动共振机制的核心控制原理是：通过非线性振荡器的频率自适应能力，使其与外部周期性运动信号（如步态）同步，从而实现运动共振。该机制利用振荡器间的耦合关系，自动调节固有频率以匹配运动节奏，实现稳定、自适应的周期性腿部运动控制。

user_input: S-Assist中逆翻/外翻旋转轴的设计参数（角度与偏移距离）如何影响负载支撑功能的运动学一致性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nto provide 20Nm assist  torque,  IV. VALIDATION BY SIMULATIONS AND EXPERIMENTS  the performance of individual elements and of the system are evaluated by sevaral simulations and experiments.  In this section,  A. Load-Supporting Functionality with Flexibility  the We evaluated the load-supporting functionality of buckle-free frame structure. As shown in Fig. 8(a), the buckle- free structure was composed of three links (n=3) connected in series. The proximal link was ﬁxed at the experimental jig. Adjacent links were connected with two connection pins. The shape of the curved slot was based on Eqns. (8) and (9). The distance between two connection pins h was set as 20mm. The bending motion of the buckle-free structure was achieved according to the constraints between these slots and connection pins.  the kinematic dissimilarity at the ankle can induce unexpected motion deviation of all the proximal frames and joints of the device. We compared the moving trajectory of the midline of a foot for the proposed ADP ankle mechanism with that of a conventional multi-DOF exoskeleton with Matlab simulation.  During the stance phase,  Fig. 9(a) presents the kinematic model used in our sim- ulation. The black line schematically represents the midline of the foot of the wearer’s right shank. Based on average human anthropometric parameters described in [22], the in- version/eversion rotation axis of the S-Assist, expressed as the 3-D blue line, is designed to be 41◦ upward from the horizontal in the sagittal plane and 23◦ medial to the midline of the foot in the transverse plane. The joint conﬁguration for the comparison group was similar to that of BLEEX [2], which established the inversion/eversion rotation axis outside of a human wearer’s malleolus with an orthogonal revolute joint. Both the vertical distance from the foot surface and the offset distance from the midline of the foot were set to 40mm. Fig. 9(b) presents the kinematic simulation results. The red surface shows the moving trajectory of the foot midline for the S-Assist. The green surface shows the moving trajectory of the foot midline using a conventional multi-DOF ankle joint. As can be seen from the results, the trajectories match each other only when the inversion/eversion angle becomes zero. However, as the angle changes, the deviation between the two increases. At 20◦ of inversion rotation, the deviation between the two reaches 17.9mm.\n']
response: S-Assist中逆翻/外翻旋转轴的设计参数（矢状面内仰角41°，横断面内偏移23°）影响了踝关节的运动学行为，导致足部中线运动轨迹与传统设计存在偏差。当旋转轴角度变化时，足中线轨迹匹配度下降，最大偏差在20°外翻时达到17.9mm，说明设计角度与偏移距离需与人体自然踝关节结构相匹配以确保负载支撑功能的运动学一致性。
reference: S-Assist中外翻/逆翻旋转轴的角度（矢状面41°上倾，横断面23°向中线偏移）与偏移距离（较传统结构更贴近人体踝关节）显著影响负载支撑功能的运动学一致性。仿真结果显示，当旋转角度为0°时，S-Assist与传统多自由度踝关节的足中线轨迹一致，但随角度增加至20°逆翻时，轨迹偏差达17.9mm，表明设计参数偏离人体自然运动学特性将导致运动不一致，从而影响负载支撑结构的自然适配性与运动协调性。

user_input: M-TOES控制器在应用于LLC和受损人群时存在哪些局限性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nIn chapter 3, I show and interpret the results from a couple of human subject studies I performed as part of collaborative work to test the efficacy of more advanced, data-driven, total energy shap- ing controllers (M-TOES) implemented on Comex 1 [Lin et al., 2022] and later on the MBLUE. While the earlier study yielded promising results for one subject, the remaining two subjects did not respond consistently to the exoskeleton assistance. The latter study demonstrated the poten- tial of the MBLUE exoskeleton in reducing muscular effort for multiple tasks but this benefit was limited to only the unilateral configurations. Moreover, the bilateral knee and hip configurations demonstrated a non-significant increase in muscle effort. Moreover, the M-TOES framework does not: 1) provide guarantees on the helpfulness of the assistance torques for feedback kinematics that fall outside the training dataset, and 2) readily allow localized changes to the controller be- havior for certain tasks/task phases. These drawbacks (discussed in detail in chapter 3) made the M-TOES controller unsuitable for application to LLC and impaired populations. LLC requires a bilateral knee configuration which the M-TOES was unable to assist with, and impaired popula- tions with pathological (non-normative) kinematics require easily customizable controllers to suit their highly unique needs. These experiences motivated the development of my own clinically intuitive, bilateral knee controller (chapter 4).  In my opinion, the novel bilateral knee controller (chapter 4) and the subsequent multi-terrain LLC study in which it was implemented on MBLUE to perform pre-clinical in-vivo experiments (chapter 5) are the highlights of this dissertation. Experiments with eight healthy participants showed that the novel exoskeleton holistically assisted the quadriceps in multi-terrain LLC in both a non-fatigued state and highly-fatigued state which is critically linked with LBP incidence in  94\n']
response: M-TOES控制器在应用于LLC和受损人群时存在以下局限性：1）无法提供双侧膝关节配置所需的辅助，而LLC要求该配置；2）在面对超出训练数据集的反馈运动学时，无法保证辅助扭矩的有效性；3）缺乏对特定任务或任务阶段进行局部控制器行为修改的能力，难以适应个体差异和任务变化。这些限制使其不适用于LLC和受损人群，从而促使了后续开发新型控制器（如双侧膝关节控制器）。
reference: M-TOES控制器在应用于LLC和受损人群时存在多个局限性：首先，其在人体实验中表现出个体间响应不一致，仅对部分受试者有效；其次，在双侧膝关节和髋关节配置中未能显著降低肌肉努力，甚至可能增加肌肉负荷；第三，控制器无法保证对训练数据之外的运动学反馈提供有效助力；第四，其架构不支持针对特定任务阶段进行局部调整，缺乏可定制性；最终，LLC需要双侧膝关节支持，而M-TOES在此配置下无效，因此不适合临床及病理人群应用。

user_input: GuroX髋关节外骨骼在骑行任务中如何利用曲柄运动学进行控制？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nOur research aimed to explore the potential of the GuroX hip exoskeleton [19] to assist with cycling despite it being originally designed to assist with walking. While previous concepts have suggested using exoskeletons during cycling for either providing assistance or as part of training regimens [20], no investigation has explored the potential for reducing cycling effort. The GuroX uses a single motor in parallel with each hip to effectively transfer torque for hip flexion and extension. While ground reaction forces are utilized to control the exoskeleton during walking, the kinematics of the crank are used for control during cycling. Cycling involves two distinct phases: (1) a pushing phase from the top dead center of the crank (TDC, crank angle 0°, 0% pedal stroke) to bottom dead center (BDC, crank angle 180°, 50% pedal stroke) and (2) a pulling phase from the BDC back to the TDC. Typically, cycling demands significant energy from major muscle groups at the hip, knee, and ankle. Research indicates that the hip contributes approximately 50% of total joint power; the knee, around 40%; and the ankle, about 10% at cadences up to 70rpm [21]. Thus, supporting hip function through an exoskeleton could offer substantial benefits. However, designing an effective assistance strategy for supporting hip extension and flexion during cycling remains an open challenge.\n']
response: GuroX髋关节外骨骼在骑行任务中通过感知曲柄角度的变化进行控制，利用推动阶段（TDC至BDC）和拉回阶段（BDC至TDC）的运动学特性，动态调整髋关节的助力输出，以辅助骑行任务并减少肌肉负荷。
reference: GuroX髋关节外骨骼在骑行任务中基于曲柄运动学进行控制，通过检测曲柄角度（0°至180°的两个主要阶段）来调控髋关节的屈曲与伸展辅助。该系统利用每个髋关节并联配置的单个电机提供扭矩支持，以响应骑行过程中髋关节的动力需求，从而实现对骑行任务中髋关节功能的辅助。尽管文献未明确具体控制算法，但指出髋关节在骑行中贡献约50%的总关节功率，因此该控制策略旨在通过髋关节辅助降低骑行能量消耗。

user_input: 文中通过 cadaveric 数据得出的关于 MCL 和 LCL 在极端膝关节屈曲时的伸展特性是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n. Using 64 cadaver knees, Klein (28) found that the MCL stretched a mean of approximately 8% of its original length, whereas the LCL stretched a mean of approximately 13% of its original length during extreme knee flexion. From these cadaveric data, Klein (28) concluded that both the LCL and MCL is sus- ceptible to injury and abnormal stretch during the deep squat. In addition, Klein (28) suggested that as the femur externally rotated during the descent, the menisci are forced to move posteriorly, causing the posterior portions of the menisci to be compressed between the tibial and femoral condyles. As the femur internally rotated at the beginning of the ascent, the posterior medial meniscus is forced toward the center of the joint space. This can place strain on the inner medial meniscus, causing it to tear. The medial me-\n']
response: 文中通过cadaveric数据得出，MCL在极端膝关节屈曲时伸展了其原始长度的约8%，而LCL伸展了约13%。研究表明两者均在极端屈曲状态下发生异常伸展，提示其在深蹲等动作中存在损伤风险。
reference: 文中通过 cadaveric 数据得出，在极端膝关节屈曲时，MCL 平均伸长约 8% 的原始长度，LCL 平均伸长约 13% 的原始长度，表明两者在深蹲动作中均易受拉伸损伤，其中 LCL 的伸展性高于 MCL。

user_input: CPG在连续感觉反馈调制下的神经输出特性如何影响肌肉响应的速度与幅度？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nmodulated by sensory feedback (Figure 4C). For example, phase shifts in CPG activations in response to perturbations, which is called phase resetting (Figure 4C-a), have been observed in cats (Conway et al., 1987; Schomburg et al., 1998) and have been proposed to increase the robustness of human walking (Yamasaki et al., 2003; Aoi et al., 2010). However, the responses observed in the disturbance experiments considered in this study do not seem to originate from phase resetting of CPGs since they are transient responses rather than persistent phase shifts. Finally, CPGs have also been proposed to be continuously modulated by sensory feedback in many models, where the muscle responses result from more complicated CPG dynamics (Taga et al., 1991; Ogihara and Yamazaki, 2001; Hase and Yamazaki, 2002; McCrea and Rybak, 2008; Figure 4C-b). CPGs are usually modeled to consist of mutually inhibiting neurons with internal dynamics (Matsuoka, 1985), and many human walking models (Taga et al., 1991; Ogihara and Yamazaki, 2001; Hase and Yamazaki, 2002) incorporate continuous sensory feedback modulation of CPGs by adding aﬀerent signals to this internal dynamics (for example, in the form of τ ˙u = −u + other-terms + feedback, where τ is a time constant and u is the neural output). In this case, the muscle responses are likely to be slower and smaller, since the disturbance signals need to be integrated to appear in the neural outputs of the CPGs. Therefore, in order to explain both steady and reactive behaviors during human walking with control structures in which CPGs generate muscle activations, more complicated reﬂex circuits may be necessary that selectively amplify the responses not only for the whole body disturbances but also for the other disturbances.\n']
response: CPG在连续感觉反馈调制下的神经输出特性通过整合外部扰动信号改变其内部动态，导致肌肉响应速度减慢、幅度减小。这种调制机制使得CPG输出需要时间整合外界信息，因此肌肉响应表现出延迟性；为了适应不同扰动类型的需求，可能需要更复杂的控制回路来增强响应幅度与速度。
reference: 在连续感觉反馈调制下，CPG的神经输出特性导致肌肉响应速度减慢且幅度较小。这是因为扰动信号需经CPG内部动态积分后才影响神经输出，从而引入时间延迟并限制响应强度。为增强响应特性，可能需要引入更复杂的反射回路以选择性放大扰动响应。

user_input: 时间缩放与路径重新参数化协议在外骨骼关节空间中起到什么作用？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n[7] J. Choi, B. Na, P. G. Jung, D. -W. Rha, and K. Kong, “WalkON suit: A medalistinthepoweredexoskeletonraceofcybathlon2016,”IEEERobot. Automat. Mag., vol. 24, no. 4, pp. 75–86, Dec. 2017.  IV. CONCLUSION AND FUTURE WORK  Inthisletter,weproposeanoveltrajectorygenerationmethod to assist users in ascending stairs with a lower limb exoskeleton. First, an FSM model was designed to improve the coordination between pilots and the exoskeleton and address weight transfer problems. Secondly, a Bézier curve-based path interpolation methodwiththeextend-edgeconceptwasintroducedtogenerate the corresponding path based on the FSM and avoid foot-stair collisions. Additionally, to prevent unacceptable increases in velocity and acceleration in the joint space due to singularity problems, a time scaling and path reparameterization proto- col was designed to constrain velocity and acceleration. Both numerical simulations and real exoskeleton experiments were conducted to verify the effectiveness of our proposed method. The results showed that our method can assist pilots in as- cending stairs using a lower limb exoskeleton at proper joint velocity and acceleration. Furthermore, this method can reduce training challenges for pilots by simplifying weight transfer. Moreover, since our method does not require feedback data from the user’s lower limb, it has the potential to be used by people with lower limb weakness, such as those with spinal cord injuries, which would greatly beneﬁt their daily activities and independent living. Although our study has yielded promising results,itstillhassomelimitations.Forexample,theexperiment only included healthy individuals. Additionally, we assumed that suitable methods were used to measure the dimensions of the stairs. Our future work includes: (1) detecting environment information using suitable sensors; (2) evaluating the EMG data from more muscles to fully assess the performance of our method; (3) involving real patients in our experiment; (4) improving the system architecture to better accommodate this approach, such as reducing ankle stiffness to maintain a ﬂat foot position on the stairs during COG transfer to the front leg.  [8] P. W. Franks, G. M. Bryan, R. M. Martin, R. Reyes, A. C. Lakmazaheri, and S. H. Collins, “Comparing optimized exoskeleton assistance of the hip, knee, and ankle in single and multi-joint conﬁgurations,” Wearable Technol., vol. 2, 2021, Art. no. e16.\n']
response: 时间缩放与路径重新参数化协议在外骨骼关节空间中用于避免因奇异问题导致的关节速度和加速度不可接受增加，从而提升运动的稳定性与安全性，确保外骨骼在复杂任务（如上下楼梯）中的可控性与自然性。
reference: 时间缩放与路径重新参数化协议在外骨骼关节空间中起到约束轨迹速度与加速度的作用，防止因奇异点问题导致的关节空间中速度和加速度的异常增长，从而保证轨迹的平滑性与系统的稳定性，提升楼梯攀爬任务中用户的运动安全性与控制可靠性。

user_input: 为什么在康复训练和运动员训练中推荐使用半蹲而非全蹲？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nReceived for publication February 2000. Accepted for publication March 2000.  127  level arms that are positioned on top of the shoulders (2). The squat can be performed with varying degrees of knee flexion, such as the half squat or full squat. The half squat involves squatting down until the thighs are parallel with the ground with approximately 0–100° knee flexion. The deep squat involves squatting down as far as possible until the posterior thighs and legs make contact with each other. The half squat is typically preferred and recommended over the full squat for athletes in training or rehabilitation patients (9,28).  An exhaustive search of MEDLINE (1966 to April 2000) and SPORTDiscus (1949 to April 2000) research databases was conducted to identify scientific literature relative to the biomechanics of the dynamic squat. The search strategy employed initially involved examining all fields containing “squat” and all fields containing “squat” AND “biomechan- ics.” Because the dynamic squat is the focus of this review, all literature relative to the isometric squat was excluded from the search. In addition, only studies published in peer- reviewed scientific journals, or published as conference proceedings/abstracts from scientific conferences, were considered for inclusion in this review. From the research database searches, it was determined that barbell squat, the isotonic machine squat, and BW squat comprised the squat biomechanics literature. Most studies that examined the biomechanics of the dynamic squat have focused on knee biomechanics. Therefore, this review was limited to scien- tific studies that quantified knee biomechanics during the barbell, machine, and BW dynamic squat exercises. Dy- namic squat studies that quantified knee biomechanics have primarily focused on three major areas: 1) knee forces comprising tibiofemoral shear force, tibiofemoral compres- sive force, and patellofemoral compressive force; 2) knee muscle activity from the quadriceps, hamstrings, and gas- trocnemius; and 3) anteroposterior and mediolateral knee stability. An understanding of knee biomechanics during the squat is important because a strong and stable knee is paramount to an athlete’s success or a patient’s rehabilita- tion. Therefore, the purpose of this review was to examine knee forces, knee muscle activity, and knee stability during the dynamic squat exercise.  Tibiofemoral Shear and Compressive Forces\n']
response: 在康复训练和运动员训练中推荐使用半蹲而非全蹲，是因为半蹲在膝关节生物力学研究中具有更可控的膝关节屈曲角度（0°至100°），能够更准确地评估和优化膝关节的剪切力、压缩力及稳定性，从而提升运动表现或促进康复。
reference: 在康复训练和运动员训练中推荐使用半蹲而非全蹲，是因为半蹲通常在膝关节屈曲角度（约0–100°）上较全蹲更小，能够有效降低胫股剪切力、压缩力及髌股压缩力等膝关节负荷指标，从而减少潜在的关节损伤风险。此外，半蹲在训练中提供了足够的肌肉激活和稳定性，同时兼顾安全性，因此被优先推荐用于运动员力量训练和康复患者的恢复过程。

reference: 深度学习在生理信号驱动的康复应用中相较于传统方法具有以下优势：1）自动提取高维生理信号特征，无需人工特征工程；2）具备良好的泛化能力，可适应个体差异；3）支持多模态数据融合，提升系统鲁棒性；4）在模式识别任务中表现出更高的精度和稳定性。

response: 本文通过构建包含5个卷积层和一个全连接密集层的深度卷积神经网络模型，结合输入窗口大小（500 ms）和多种超参数优化策略，实现了跨受试者的连续运动模式分类。模型利用时间序列数据自动提取特征并映射至五个运动模式，从而克服了传统机器学习方法在个体差异上的局限性。
reference: 本文构建的卷积神经网络模型通过5层卷积结构自动提取原始传感器数据中的运动特征，结合500 ms输入窗口捕捉连续运动动态，并优化超参数以增强模型泛化能力，从而实现跨受试者的连续运动模式分类。
