retrieved_contexts: ['\nFig. 3. Vanderbilt lower limb exoskeleton.  Fig. 6. Four states involved in walking and the muscles stimulated.  Fig. 4. Exoskeleton control board, shown with muscle stimulator module (which plugs into the control board within the outline shown).  lator produces two independent channels of current-controlled symmetrical biphasic stimulation pulses. The pulse width, cur- rentamplitude,andpulsefrequencyofeachbiphasicstimulation channel are controllable via the microcontroller. One of the two exoskeleton control boards, along with the plug-in electric stim- ulator that is typically mounted on it, is shown in Fig. 4. In order to facilitate prototyping and implementation of the cooperative controller, the embedded system in the exoskeleton is interfaced with MATLAB Real-Time Workshop via a CAN tether, such that all sensor inputs and control outputs of the exoskeleton, in- cluding stimulation channels, are assessable and controllable, respectively, from a laptop computer.  B. Controller Implementation  The four cooperatively actuated muscle/motor pairs are the left and right quadriceps and knee motor combination (used during swing), and the hamstrings and hip motor combination (used during stance). As such, the control structure shown in Fig. 1 was implemented at each of these four joints. The inputs to these joint-level cooperative controllers are governed by a ﬁ- nite state machine (FSM), which is described in detail in [38]. For purposes of walking, the FSM is described by four essential states, which are right step (state 1), double-support with right footforward(state2),leftstep(state3),anddouble-supportwith left foot forward (state 4), as illustrated in Fig. 5. During normal walking, the state machine moves sequentially through these statesina repeatingfashion, asillustratedinFig.6. Asdescribed\n']
response: 四个协同驱动的肌/电机对在步态周期中根据有限状态机（FSM）切换控制策略，依次通过右步态（state1）、双支撑右脚（state2）、左步态（state3）和双支撑左脚（state4）四个状态完成。在每个状态下，对应的肌/电机组合被激活并协同工作，确保步态的自然过渡与运动协调。FSM通过外部系统（如MATLAB Real-Time Workshop）实现状态切换的实时控制，支持肌肉刺激与运动控制的同步性。
reference: 四个协同驱动的肌/电机对（左/右侧股四头肌与膝电机组合、腘绳肌与髋电机组合）在步态周期中依据有限状态机（FSM）定义的四个状态进行切换控制策略：右步态（状态1）、右脚在前的双支撑期（状态2）、左步态（状态3）、左脚在前的双支撑期（状态4）。FSM根据步态阶段顺序控制各肌/电机对的激活模式，实现摆动期与支撑期的协同控制，其具体策略基于文献[38]中描述的状态识别与反馈机制。

A fatiguing squat study reported a 25% decline in maximal quadriceps force after fatiguing exercises [Longpr´e et al., 2015], but we did not measure maximal quadriceps forces pre- and post- fatigue in our study. If we make relatively broad assumptions of a linear relationship between EMG and force [Staudenmann et al., 2010], and consider fast LL as a maximal activity for the quadri- ceps, the 33% savings in peak quadriceps force afforded by the exoskeleton was likely sufficient to fully overcome the supposed 25% deficit in force from the induced fatigue. This could explain how the exoskeleton assistance enabled the subjects to significantly reduce their time to complete 10 LL repetitions post-fatigue by 33% and with better posture (3 degrees decrease in global tho- rax angle), see Fig. 5.5. In fact, the exoskeleton assistance practically maintained the pre-fatigue LL duration levels in post-fatigue (Fig. 5.3), suggesting a full replenishment of the post-fatigue quadriceps force deficit. On the other hand, the LL durations in the bare condition increased with post-fatigue repetitions, indicating an increasing trend in fatigue. response: 自适应助力控制算法通过实时监测股四头肌的EMG信号，识别其激活水平和力量下降趋势；在检测到疲劳时自动增加助力扭矩（如16 Nm），以补偿肌肉输出不足；结合胸段姿态改善和完成任务时间缩短等运动表现数据，动态调整助力策略，从而实现对股四头肌力的补偿，对抗疲劳带来的力量下降。
reference: 自适应助力控制算法通过实时监测股四头肌的激活状态（如EMG信号），并基于检测到的疲劳引起的力下降动态调整助力水平。文献指出，外骨骼提供的33%峰值股四头肌力节省足以补偿疲劳导致的25%力量下降。结合EMG与力的线性关系假设，算法可实现对肌肉力下降的自适应补偿，从而维持任务表现，如缩短深蹲循环时间并改善姿势。

user_input: 本文通过何种方式评估步态对称性？为何该方法存在局限性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nB. Limitations of the study  As in other similar studies [21]-[23], we assisted the gait unilaterally, i.e. robotic assistance was provided to the left leg only. Given the importance of inter-limb coordination mechanisms and reflexes [60]-[62], the unilateral assistance could have increased the difficulty of the task in terms of adaptation time. Although we did not record the kinematics of the subjects’ right leg, we assessed the gait symmetry through the foot pressure sensors located in the insoles. Post- hoc analysis on the duration of the gait phases did not show any statistically significant difference between free walking condition and assisted condition. In addition, we did not record the EMG signals of the users’ right-leg muscles, and the ground reaction forces. Thus we could not assess the occurrence of compensation strategies at the level of the right leg [63] during the assisted or zero-torque condition.  Further insights could be gained in the future by recording kinematics, kinetics, and EMG signals from both legs and by assisting users bilaterally. Finally, heart rate and metabolic consumption measurements would be desirable to verify possible systemic benefits to the cardiopulmonary apparatus.  C. response: 本文通过安装在鞋垫上的足底压力传感器评估步态对称性，但该方法存在局限性：1）仅记录左腿数据限制了对左右肢体协调机制的全面评估；2）未记录右腿运动学和肌电信号，无法识别代偿行为；3）缺乏心率与代谢数据，限制了对系统性益处的评估。未来研究应改进数据采集方式，采用双侧辅助并整合多模态信号。
reference: 本文通过鞋垫中的足底压力传感器评估步态对称性。该方法存在局限性，因其未记录右腿的运动学、动力学及肌电信号，无法全面反映步态对称性及代偿策略，亦难以捕捉肢体间协调机制的变化。

response: 自适应频率振荡器（AFO）在外骨骼下肢步态生成中通过与变分控制器和状态观测器协同工作，利用弱耦合理论对振荡器序列进行动态调整，以实现基本步态的学习与重构。该方法确保系统在不同用户需求和外部环境变化下仍能维持稳定步态输出，从而实现对外骨骼下肢步态的自适应控制。
reference: 自适应频率振荡器（AFO）通过自适应频率调整学习用户的基本步态节奏，并利用弱耦合理论重构振荡器序列以实现步态动态适应；同时通过确保极限环稳定性与状态观测器反馈机制，使下肢外骨骼控制系统的步态生成具备稳定性和自适应性。

user_input: 文中提出的FSM模型在外骨骼控制中如何改善用户与设备的协调性？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n[7] J. Choi, B. Na, P. G. Jung, D. -W. Rha, and K. Kong, “WalkON suit: A medalistinthepoweredexoskeletonraceofcybathlon2016,”IEEERobot. Automat. Mag., vol. 24, no. 4, pp. 75–86, Dec. 2017.  IV. CONCLUSION AND FUTURE WORK  Inthisletter,weproposeanoveltrajectorygenerationmethod to assist users in ascending stairs with a lower limb exoskeleton. First, an FSM model was designed to improve the coordination between pilots and the exoskeleton and address weight transfer problems. Secondly, a Bézier curve-based path interpolation methodwiththeextend-edgeconceptwasintroducedtogenerate the corresponding path based on the FSM and avoid foot-stair collisions. Additionally, to prevent unacceptable increases in velocity and acceleration in the joint space due to singularity problems, a time scaling and path reparameterization proto- col was designed to constrain velocity and acceleration. Both numerical simulations and real exoskeleton experiments were conducted to verify the effectiveness of our proposed method. The results showed that our method can assist pilots in as- cending stairs using a lower limb exoskeleton at proper joint velocity and acceleration. Furthermore, this method can reduce training challenges for pilots by simplifying weight transfer. Moreover, since our method does not require feedback data from the user’s lower limb, it has the potential to be used by people with lower limb weakness, such as those with spinal cord injuries, which would greatly beneﬁt their daily activities and independent living. Although our study has yielded promising results,itstillhassomelimitations.Forexample,theexperiment only included healthy individuals. Additionally, we assumed that suitable methods were used to measure the dimensions of the stairs. Our future work includes: (1) detecting environment information using suitable sensors; (2) evaluating the EMG data from more muscles to fully assess the performance of our method; (3) involving real patients in our experiment; (4) improving the system architecture to better accommodate this approach, such as reducing ankle stiffness to maintain a ﬂat foot position on the stairs during COG transfer to the front leg.  [8] P. W. Franks, G. M. Bryan, R. M. Martin, R. Reyes, A. C. Lakmazaheri, and S. H. Collins, “Comparing optimized exoskeleton assistance of the hip, knee, and ankle in single and multi-joint conﬁgurations,” Wearable Technol., vol. 2, 2021, Art. no. e16.\n']
response: 文中提出的FSM模型通过定义不同运动状态（如站立、行走、上下楼梯等），实现对用户运动意图的实时识别与响应，从而提升外骨骼与用户之间的协调性。该模型特别解决了楼梯上升过程中体重转移的稳定性问题，减少了对外骨骼下肢反馈数据的依赖，提高了控制策略的适应性与用户友好性。
reference: 文中提出的FSM模型通过识别用户的运动状态并生成相应的控制策略，有效改善了外骨骼与用户的协调性。该模型解决了体重转移问题，并通过状态转换机制增强设备对用户意图的响应能力；同时，结合路径插值方法避免了足部碰撞，提升了运动的安全性与自然性。此外，其无需用户下肢反馈数据的特点，增强了对下肢功能障碍用户的适用性。

response: 文中提出的踝关节力矩估算方法通过测量电机输出扭矩τb，结合几何参数和角度信息（如踝关节角度θ和螺杆传动参数p），利用力矩传递关系推导出ANKLET力矩τa。具体步骤包括：1）通过螺杆传动将电机扭矩转化为线性力Fs；2）利用几何定理将Fs与ANKLET偏转角θ1关联；3）通过角度替换将θ1替换为可测量的踝关节角度θ；4）结合余弦定理计算关键几何长度LAB；5）最终通过力矩传递关系实现ANKLET力矩τa与电机扭矩τb的反馈补偿。
reference: 文中提出的踝关节力矩估算方法通过结合传感器测量的踝关节角度 θ 和电机输出的制动力矩 τb，利用传动结构的几何关系和力学模型推导出踝关节力矩 τa。通过反馈补偿模块将实际力矩 τa 与模型估计力矩 τm 进行比较，生成误差信号 τ∆ 并输入 PID 控制器调整电机输出，从而实现对踝关节力矩的闭环反馈控制。此外，前馈估计模块基于角度和角加速度信息进一步优化力矩估算，提升系统动态响应与控制精度。

user_input: 文中在不同背包载荷条件下，胫骨前肌的激活时相有何变化？其与步态周期中哪些关键事件相关？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nThe ground reaction forces (kinetic data) were collected at 1200 Hz. The three-dimensional co- ordinates of makers and ground reaction forces were synchronized. The net moments at the ankle, knee and hip joints were calculated according to the methods of Vaughan et al. [20]. Then, the net muscle power at each joint was computed by multiplying the joint an- gular velocity by the local net muscle moment within each plane of movement. All kinematics and kinetic data were time-normalized to 100 points over the stride. The values for each point of interest were taken from all trials and averaged within subjects. Statistical analyses were done using SPSS software. Only the sagittal plane information was further analyzed.  For comparison with level walking data, all par- ticipants were requested to walk on a level with backpack load. Two force plates were embedded in the floor. The force plates, developed by Advanced Mechanical Technology Incorporated (AMTI), fea- ture a loading range of up to 500 N and a size of 0.51 m × 0.46 m × 0.08 m. The subject began with the condition to habituate himself to the walkway area, and then performed three walking trials under each backpack load condition with almost the same speed, during which his two feet made contact on two em- bedded force platforms separately. The subjects used their right leg for the first step, and the left leg for the second step. Before each trial, the subjects rested for 5 min for reducing fatigue effect.  2.5. Data analysis  3. Results  3.1. Muscle activity  The muscle activation patterns during stair climbing under different backpack load are shown in Figs. 3 through 6. The tibialis anterior is active from late stance through swing phase, as shown in Fig. 3. The gastroc- nemius is active throughout most of the stance phase, especially, the intensity of the activity is maximum dur- ing the procedure of toe-off, as shown in Fig. 4. The rectus femoris is active from heel strike through mid- stance, as shown in Fig. 5. The hamstring is active throughout most of the stance phase, and is also active during the latter part of swing, as shown in Fig. 6.\n']
response: 文献未提供关于胫骨前肌在不同背包载荷条件下激活时相变化的具体信息，也未分析其与步态周期中关键事件（如足趾离地、足部着地等）的相关性。
reference: 在不同背包载荷条件下，文中未报告胫骨前肌激活时相的显著变化。其激活主要发生在步态周期的晚期站立相至摆动相，与足部离地（toe-off）及摆动初期踝关节背屈控制相关。

retrieved_contexts: ['\nWhen calculating the repulsion force, it is possible for the 1/ρ(X,Xobs) to be equal to zero, which results in a significant change to the potential function. It leads to a significant correction of the impedance coefficient, which in turn causes the instability of the system. Consequently, the Urep(X) can be modified accordingly.  The artificial potential field method is a common algorithm in path planning, which allows the upper and lower boundaries of the channel to be set as obstacles. The optimal torque can be considered as the target. Accordingly, when the actual human- robot interaction force deviates from the optimal force, the virtual force field is adjusted accordingly. When the robot is close to an obstacle, the corresponding virtual force field is increased, while when it is far away from the obstacle, the corresponding virtual force field is decreased. Therefore, the potential function is aligned with the impedance parameters. Consequently, the impedance control parameters can be ad- justed in real-time in accordance with the potential function.  0246810  Upper BoundaryLower BoundaryOptimal Torque CurveTime(s)  10010203040 (a) Torque Coordination Channel(b) Optimal Torque CurveTime(s)  Fig. 6. response: 自适应阻抗控制通过构建包含吸引势函数（Uatt）和排斥势函数（Urep）的势能函数 U(X) 来调节人机交互力。当人机交互力偏离最优力时，系统通过动态调整排斥势函数的强度，使虚拟力场根据机器人与障碍物的距离变化而增减，从而引导人机交互力回归最优力域。这种力场自适应机制使阻抗控制参数能够实时响应交互状态，实现人机安全协同控制。
reference: 自适应阻抗控制通过人工势场法构建虚拟力场，将最优扭矩作为目标，交互力偏离时动态调整排斥势函数Urep(X)与吸引势函数Uatt(X)，实时修正阻抗参数，使轨迹保持在安全通道内，从而引导人机交互力回归最优状态。

user_input: 多任务优化能量成形控制器（M-TOES）如何利用垂直地面反作用力（vGRF）实现任务不变控制？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nChapter 3 presents human subject experiments that were my contributions to collaborative work on more advanced task-invariant controllers—specifically, the multi-task optimized energy shap- ing controller (M-TOES) which crucially utilizes the vGRF in its optimization scheme [Lin et al., 2022]. M-TOES was tested on 3 healthy subjects for all primary ADLs and achieved promising but subject dependent muscular effort reductions for tasks with slow as well as fast dynamics with Comex 1 (equipped with the custom vGRF sensor I developed). Next, the chapter presents the results of my latest collaboration in the experimental testing (n=8) of an updated version of the M- TOES controller implemented on our latest M-BLUE exoskeleton (knee and hip modules). Good matching between controller and normative torques was achieved with these exoskeleton/controller combinations for all ADLs. However, the vast number of non-intuitive basis functions utilized in the M-TOES controls approach hindered customizability, and possibly explains the lack of con- sistent muscular effort reductions that were achieved across tasks. These limitations precluded the application of M-TOES for LLC and impaired individuals, and paved the way for the subsequent chapters.  Chapter 4 presents a novel, versatile, clinically intuitive, and easily customizable bilateral knee controller for application to LLC and impaired individuals. Assisting LLC requires specialized torques, high in magnitude, fully exploiting the capabilities of the actuator, and not limited by the need to match the % assistance for each task or relying on a normative dataset. Although the controllers tested in chapter 3 guaranteed stability, they have no guarantee of producing help- ful torques especially for the impaired populations who have non-normative kinematics that fall grossly outside the training dataset. The critical dependence on a training dataset is also a draw- back of machine learning approaches that aim for task-invariance. In chapter 4 I took a more fundamental approach to controller development. By studying fundamental clinical gait analysis literature and using carefully selected, physically inspired torque basis functions, I developed a task-invariant bilateral knee controller which in addition to achieving good torque matching with  7  normative data, is also clinically intuitive and readily customizable.\n']
response: M-TOES通过在优化过程中引入垂直地面反作用力（vGRF）作为任务不变控制的基函数，使控制器能够在不同任务之间保持一致性，从而实现任务不变控制。尽管vGRF在优化中起关键作用，但M-TOES的控制策略依赖于大量非直观的基函数，限制了其可定制性和跨任务的推广能力。
reference: 多任务优化能量成形控制器（M-TOES）通过将垂直地面反作用力（vGRF）作为关键输入信号整合到其优化方案中，实现任务不变控制。vGRF 提供了关于步态周期和地面交互力的实时信息，使控制器能够动态调整外骨骼输出以匹配不同活动任务的规范力矩。然而，由于其依赖大量非直观的基函数和训练数据集，M-TOES 在非典型运动模式下的泛化能力有限，影响了其在下肢受限人群中的应用。

retrieved_contexts: ['\nE.WalkingDetection  The controller detects whether the user is walking or stand- ing by measuring the foot-ﬂoor force readings, thigh angle, and thigh angular velocity. Walking is detected when all the  A. ExoskeletonHardware  The controller was implemented on the knee exoskeleton prototype shown in Fig. 4. The knee exoskeleton is essentially a standard knee-ankle-foot orthosis (KAFO) with a powered knee module in place of a standard knee joint. The ankle joint, which is standard, is an articulated joint without compliance, but with adjustable dorsiﬂexion and plantarﬂexion range-of- motion limits. For the experiments described here, the range of motion limits were set outside of the users’ range of motion, except for Subject 3, who required plantarﬂexion limits to mitigate foot drop during swing. The primary purpose of the AFO component was to prevent the orthosis from sliding down the leg, and to offer a mounting surface for a force sensing resistor (FSR). The thigh segment of the exoskeleton is supported by bilateral uprights. The knee joint on the medial aspect is a standard passive hinge joint, while the knee joint on  Authorized licensed use limited to: Brock University. The actuated is driven by brushless motor (Maxon EC-52i) knee joint and two-stage chain-drive transmission, which is packaged separately from the knee joint and located on the lateral aspect of the thigh, and actuates the knee joint remotely through a pair of Bowden cables. The actuation unit is capable of maximum continuous torque of 15 Nm and peak torque of 20 Nm. The actuation unit is powered by a lithium ion battery pack consisting of six 18650 cells (INR18650-30Q) in series, providing nominal 25.2 V and 72 W-hrs at full charge, with a maximum continuous current capacity of 15 A. The battery pack has a mass, including housing, of 355 g. The total mass of the knee exoskeleton including the actuation cassette, KAFO structure, and battery is 2.0 kg.  Fig. 5. Photo of subject 1 walking while using the knee exoskeleton.\n']
response: 通过检测足-地接触力、大腿角度和角速度，控制器可以实现行走状态的识别。足-地接触力用于检测支撑状态，大腿角度和角速度反映运动状态，三者综合分析用于判断用户是否处于行走状态。
reference: 行走状态检测通过实时测量足-地接触力、大腿角度及角速度进行多传感器融合分析。当足底力传感器信号出现周期性变化，并结合大腿角度与角速度的规律性波动时，控制器判定为行走状态。该方法依赖于传感器信号的动态特征，文献中未提供具体算法细节。

From the view- point of the other physiological responses, half-way through the series no signiﬁcant differences should be observed.  5. Discussion  While a common task, periodic squatting can not be taken as an equivalent substitute of walking on a ﬂat terrain, because it is considerably more demanding. However, in everyday life many activities demand sim- ilar movement, for example walking up and down the stairs, which requires also dissipation of energy (nega- tive work) when going down. Another example is get- ting up from a chair. From this point of view periodic squatting can be considered as walking over a (very) rough terrain. response: 自适应阻抗控制通过实时调节外骨骼的刚度与阻尼特性，使其与人体运动自然同步，从而减少肌肉激活与代谢负担，实现人机协同以降低代谢能量消耗。实验表明，基于振荡器的控制方法相比自由运动与重力补偿方法，在生理响应（如心率、呼吸频率及肌肉激活）上更接近自然状态，有效降低了蹲起动作中的代谢成本。
reference: 自适应阻抗控制通过动态调节膝关节外骨骼的机械阻抗以匹配人体运动状态，从而优化人机协同，降低代谢能量消耗。实验结果显示，使用振荡器控制方法可显著降低分钟通气量和心率，表明其有效减少了周期性蹲起任务中的生理负荷。EMG信号分析进一步显示该控制方法能维持肌肉自然激活模式，有助于减少肌肉疲劳。综上，自适应阻抗控制通过优化交互力实现能量效率提升，从而降低代谢消耗。

response: 踝关节在多段平衡控制中主要负责执行动态响应，特别是在足部对地面的接触与离心运动中维持稳定性；髋关节则参与更广泛的运动协调与姿态控制，通过推力生成和整体运动调节维持平衡。两者在控制策略上表现出不同的时间尺度和空间范围差异，共同构成多段平衡系统。
reference: 踝关节与髋关节在多段平衡控制中的贡献可通过其在不同尺度和任务中的功能分工区分：踝关节主要负责小幅度姿态调整和步态微调，参与前馈控制；髋关节则主导大幅度动态平衡，尤其在应对扰动和执行反馈控制中起关键作用。研究采用系统辨识方法、COG-COP关系分析以及动态稳定性指标量化其贡献。

response: 混合辅助系统（Hybrid assistive system）的核心工作原理是通过功能性电刺激（FES）激活残存肌肉并提供机械辅助，实现步态功能的重建。其控制策略采用多自由度协调控制，使电刺激与机械装置能够动态响应运动需求，协同提供稳定、自然的步态支持。
reference: 混合辅助系统的核心工作原理是将功能性电刺激（FES）与外部机械装置（如外骨骼或矫形器）相结合，通过协同控制策略，利用FES激活患者自身肌肉产生主动运动，同时由外部机械结构提供支撑、稳定或动力辅助，从而恢复脊髓损伤患者的步态功能。

user_input: M-BLUE外骨骼系统在测量关节角度时为何优先选择IMU而非编码器？技术依据是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n3.6 Human Subject Methods: Study 2  In study 2, the M-TOES controller was generalized for different joint modules, and implemented on the M-BLUE exoskeleton system. The experimental methods for validating different configurations with healthy human subjects performing multiple ADLs are presented next.  3.6.1 Hardware Implementation: Study 2  The controller was implemented on M-BLUE shown in Fig. 3.4 (see [Nesler et al., 2022] for de- tails). The unilateral knee and hip modules weigh 2.36 kg and 2.15 kg, respectively, including the battery. M-BLUE combines commercial off-the-shelf orthoses with a quasi-direct drive actuator— the T-motor AK80-9 which comprises a high-torque electric motor with an internal 9:1 planetary gearbox. This actuator is highly backdrivable with less than 0.5 Nm static backdrive torque. It can  31  Figure 3.4: M-BLUE hip-only and knee-only exoskeleton configurations worn by a healthy user (with an unpowered ankle brace in the knee-only configuration to support the mass of the knee actuator).  32  provide 9 Nm continuous torque and 18 Nm peak torque according to the manufacturer, though we verified up to 30 Nm peak torque using the Dephy FASTER ActPack driver in our own bench- top calibration [Nesler et al., 2022]. This modular exoskeleton facilitates bilateral/unilateral knee and/or hip configurations to match different use cases.  The high-level control loop ran at ∼ 200 Hz on an 8 GB RAM Raspberry Pi 4B for each leg, where bilateral configurations communicated with each other through ZeroMQ, a TCP based package. Sagittal-plane joint angles and global segment angles were measured by two 6-axis Mi- crostrain IMUs attached to the brace straps around each limb segment. The joint angles were obtained by taking the difference between the global angles of adjacent segments, which mostly bypassed the compliance between the actuator and limb segment to give more accurate joint mea- surements than the actuator encoders. In fact, soft-tissue and strap compliance caused vibrations when using the joint encoders, which was avoided by using the IMU-based joint measurements. M-BLUE was powered by a 24 V, 2 Amp-hour Kobalt powertool battery (∼ 470 g) attached to a 3D printed adapter mounted on the side of each orthosis.\n']
response: M-BLUE外骨骼系统在测量关节角度时优先选择IMU而非编码器，是因为IMU能够绕过执行器与肢体段之间的顺应性，避免由软组织和带扣造成的振动干扰，从而提供更稳定、准确的运动学测量；而编码器受限于机械结构与执行器输出，难以有效消除这些误差，导致测量不精确。IMU具备更高的抗干扰能力，适合动态运动环境下的高精度角度测量。
reference: M-BLUE外骨骼系统优先选择IMU而非编码器测量关节角度，主要技术依据在于：IMU通过测量相邻肢体段的全局角度差，绕过了执行器与肢体之间的柔顺性，提升了测量准确性；同时，编码器因软组织与绑带柔顺性引发振动，影响稳定性，而IMU方式可有效避免该问题。

response: 在离线泛化实验中，坡度为7.8°的 hold-out 条件对CNN和XGB模型的分类性能产生了显著影响。CNN的总体分类误差增加了10.80 ± 4.23%，XGB增加了7.38 ± 6.79%（p < 0.05），而与12° hold-out条件相比，两者无显著差异。文献未提供7.8°条件与其他 hold-out 条件（如10.2 cm）之间的进一步统计比较。
reference: 在7.8° hold-out条件下，CNN和XGB模型的整体分类误差分别显著增加了10.80 ± 4.23%和7.38 ± 6.79%（p < 0.05）。然而，文献中未提供CNN与XGB之间直接统计比较的结果，因此无法确定两者在该hold-out条件下分类性能差异是否具有统计学显著性。

Here we presented a simple timing based control scheme; however, with the addition of sensors to the virtual anchor matrix, additional human-machine interaction control modalities can be examined. Specifically, we can examine those relevant and have been shown to be very important from a physiological perspective [31]. An extensive study of the full range of parameters of this device was beyond the scope of this paper, but we feel that this work opens the door to a broad range of biomechanics studies, not previously possible with other exoskeletons that have a significant effect on natural dynamics and kinematics. Further, we note that while no statistical analyses were performed here, the trends presented for this first case study are promising. Future work will also focus on statistically evaluating the efficacy of the exosuit with an increased number of human subjects. reference: 本文实验结果中展示的趋势被认为具有潜力，因为它们为基于生理学机制的人机交互控制提供了新路径。未来研究将通过增加受试者数量并进行统计分析，以系统评估外骨骼系统的有效性，从而验证这些趋势的显著性与可重复性。

user_input: 优化过程中被忽略的参数标准是什么，其背后的工程意义是什么？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nWe optimize the constant coefﬁcients α to ﬁt the control law outputs to normalized values of the across-subject (ten sub- jects) averaged human joint torques over level-ground, ramps, stairs walking [33], and stand-to-sit [35]. The optimization process provides the optimal parameters α∗, where we neglect those parameters with absolute values contributing less than 0.1% · α∗2. The vGRFs during locomotion tasks in [33] are normalized by the body weight. Because the stand-to-sit data in [35] does not provide vGRFs, we set the vGRF to a constant value during the optimization process (a reason- able assumption for a quasi-static task like stand-to-sit). The training tasks include level treadmill walking at 0.5,1.5m/s, ascending/descending ramps with inclines of 5.2◦,11◦, as- cending/descending stairs with step height of 4,7inch [33], and the stand-to-sit task in [35]. The original knee torque data  VOLUME 1, 2022  in [35] was not adequate during the late stand-to-sit cycle because of support from the chair during data collection. To provide adequate support with our controller, we modiﬁed the able-bodied knee torque proﬁle from [35] by holding the peak knee torque from 60% to 100% of the cycle.  Fig. 3 shows the simulated exoskeleton control torques and demonstrates the agreement between a single energy-shaping control strategy (exoskeleton torque τexo) and normalized able-bodied human torques τhum over the training activities. The validation activities are considered next in comparison with a state-of-art ﬁnite state machine (FSM) controller [5].  B. COMPARISON TO IDEAL FINITE STATE MACHINE The presented method was evaluated by comparison with an ideal FSM for testing tasks. We deﬁned the FSM in a similar way as in [36], where the ideal FSM was assumed to provide the normalized able-bodied human torque with pre-deﬁned tasks using intent recognition between different modes, including walking and stairs climbing. The pre- deﬁned “training” tasks included level treadmill walking at 1.5 m/s, ramp ascent/descent at 5.2◦, and stairs ascent/descent with 4inch step height in [33] to cover a similar number of tasks to a state-of-art FSM [5]. The ideal FSM returns the pre-deﬁned torque proﬁleYj, j ∈ {1,...,5}, that most closely matches the normalized able-bodied proﬁle Yi for the current task i. The problem is deﬁned in [36, 7] as ﬁnding j in the pre-deﬁned tasks via  argmin  j   Yi,ankle −Yj,ankle    2  +   Yi,knee −Yj,knee    2\n']
response: 在优化过程中，被忽略的参数标准是绝对值贡献小于 0.1% 的 α∗²。其背后的工程意义是降低模型复杂度、减少计算负担，并在保证控制性能的前提下实现参数空间的有效压缩。
reference: 优化过程中被忽略的参数标准是其绝对值贡献小于0.1%·α∗²。该标准的工程意义在于：1）避免模型冗余，提升计算效率；2）增强控制器在跨任务与跨个体应用中的鲁棒性与泛化能力；3）防止对数据噪声或非典型特征的过拟合，从而提升实际控制性能与稳定性。

response: 基于自适应动态规划的外骨骼控制框架在下肢假肢应用中实现了对步态对称性、稳定性及能量效率的优化，从而提升使用者的行走质量与舒适性。
reference: 文中提出的基于自适应动态规划的外骨骼控制框架在下肢假肢应用中实现了多个关键优化目标，包括提升步态对称性、优化能量利用效率、增强动态适应能力，并通过在线学习机制实现与用户意图的实时协同控制。

user_input: 自适应阻抗控制中如何利用运动学信号和足底开关数据实现步态事件的准确识别？
retrieved_contexts: ['\n8th International IEEE EMBS Conference on Neural Engineering Shanghai, China, May 25 - 28 , 2017  978-1-5090-4603-4/17/$31.00 ©2017 IEEE  98  II. METHODS A. Experimental protocol Three able-bodied subjects (1 male, 2 female; 24-28 years, 163-184 cm, 54-75 kg) gave informed consent and completed the experiment, which was approved by the Northwestern University Institutional Review Board. Each subject completed at least 10 repetitions of a locomotion circuit consisting of walking on level ground, ascending/descending a ramp with a 10° slope, and ascending/descending a 3-step staircase in an experimental session. The true locomotor intent of the subject was labeled by the experimenter using a key fob to provide supervised data to train an intent recognition algorithm. Bilateral electromyographic (EMG) signals were collected using bipolar surface electrodes (model DE2.1; Delsys, Boston, MA, USA) from the same 6 muscles in each leg: tibialis anterior (TA), medial gastrocnemius (MG), soleus (SOL), vastus medialis (VM), rectus femoris (RF), and semitendinosus (ST) (Fig. 1). These muscles are a subset of the uniarticular and biarticular muscles about the ankle, knee, and hip. Electrode placement was guided by the SENIAM standards and verified by having subjects perform voluntary contractions. Signals were amplified by 1000x, filtered between 20-450 Hz (Bagnoli 16, Delsys), and sampled at 1 kHz. Bilateral kinematic signals were recorded using biaxial goniometers (Biometrics Ltd, Newport, UK) placed on the knee and ankle and sampled at 500 Hz (Fig. 1). Flexible event switches (MA-153; Motion Lab Systems, Baton Rouge, LA, USA) were taped bilaterally to the subjects’ feet beneath the heel and first metatarsal (Fig. 1). Footswitch data were sampled at 500 Hz using a custom data acquisition unit and used to detect heel contact and toe off gait events. All signals were simultaneously recorded using a custom 16-bit analog-to-digital converter that permits multi-rate sampling.\n']
response: 自适应阻抗控制中利用运动学信号和足底开关数据实现步态事件准确识别的方式是：通过采集踝关节和膝关节的双轴运动学信号（采样频率500 Hz）获取步态周期的空间信息，结合足底开关数据（采样频率500 Hz）检测足跟着地与足尖离地事件，进而融合多模态信号实现对步态事件的高精度识别。
reference: 在自适应阻抗控制中，运动学信号与足底开关数据协同用于步态事件识别。运动学信号（如膝关节和踝关节角度）通过双轴测角仪以500 Hz采样率采集，提供步态周期中的连续动态信息；足底开关数据通过足跟与第一跖骨下的柔性开关采集，用于检测足部接触状态，识别关键步态事件（如足跟着地与足趾离地）。两者结合可提升步态事件识别的准确性，并为自适应阻抗控制提供实时步态阶段划分依据。

response: 基于肌电信号的速度自适应控制算法通过实时监测肌肉激活状态和外部运动速度信息，动态调整踝关节外骨骼的助力输出，从而实现个性化、高效的步态辅助。该方法显著提升了行走效率和稳定性，尤其在减少代谢成本和适应复杂运动环境方面效果显著。
reference: 基于肌电信号的速度自适应控制算法通过实时检测肌肉激活状态，动态调整踝关节外骨骼的助力输出，使其与用户的步态周期和行走速度同步。该算法提升了行走稳定性与舒适性，适应个体化步态模式，减少能量消耗，提高行走效率，从而增强后中风患者的行走辅助效果和康复训练质量。

user_input: 不同深蹲方式（杠铃深蹲、器械深蹲和自重深蹲）在膝关节生物力学研究中表现出哪些共性与差异？
retrieved_contexts: ['\nReceived for publication February 2000. Accepted for publication March 2000.  127  level arms that are positioned on top of the shoulders (2). The squat can be performed with varying degrees of knee flexion, such as the half squat or full squat. The half squat involves squatting down until the thighs are parallel with the ground with approximately 0–100° knee flexion. The deep squat involves squatting down as far as possible until the posterior thighs and legs make contact with each other. The half squat is typically preferred and recommended over the full squat for athletes in training or rehabilitation patients (9,28).  An exhaustive search of MEDLINE (1966 to April 2000) and SPORTDiscus (1949 to April 2000) research databases was conducted to identify scientific literature relative to the biomechanics of the dynamic squat. The search strategy employed initially involved examining all fields containing “squat” and all fields containing “squat” AND “biomechan- ics.” Because the dynamic squat is the focus of this review, all literature relative to the isometric squat was excluded from the search. In addition, only studies published in peer- reviewed scientific journals, or published as conference proceedings/abstracts from scientific conferences, were considered for inclusion in this review. From the research database searches, it was determined that barbell squat, the isotonic machine squat, and BW squat comprised the squat biomechanics literature. Most studies that examined the biomechanics of the dynamic squat have focused on knee biomechanics. Therefore, this review was limited to scien- tific studies that quantified knee biomechanics during the barbell, machine, and BW dynamic squat exercises. Dy- namic squat studies that quantified knee biomechanics have primarily focused on three major areas: 1) knee forces comprising tibiofemoral shear force, tibiofemoral compres- sive force, and patellofemoral compressive force; 2) knee muscle activity from the quadriceps, hamstrings, and gas- trocnemius; and 3) anteroposterior and mediolateral knee stability. An understanding of knee biomechanics during the squat is important because a strong and stable knee is paramount to an athlete’s success or a patient’s rehabilita- tion. Therefore, the purpose of this review was to examine knee forces, knee muscle activity, and knee stability during the dynamic squat exercise.  Tibiofemoral Shear and Compressive Forces\n']
response: 不同深蹲方式（杠铃深蹲、器械深蹲和自重深蹲）在膝关节生物力学研究中表现出共性：均涉及膝关节在深蹲过程中经历不同程度的屈曲，并研究其膝关节所承受的剪切力、压缩力以及髌股关节负荷。此外，三种深蹲方式在膝关节肌肉活动（如股四头肌、腘绳肌和腓肠肌的激活）和膝关节稳定性方面具有相似性。然而，在动作幅度、肌力输出和膝关节接触面分布上存在差异。
reference: 根据文献，杠铃深蹲、器械深蹲和自重深蹲在膝关节生物力学研究中主要围绕胫股剪切力与压缩力、肌肉活动（股四头肌、腘绳肌、腓肠肌）以及膝关节稳定性（前后与内外方向）进行比较。文献指出这三种深蹲方式均被用于量化膝关节生物力学，但未提供具体数据以明确其共性与差异。因此，目前仅能确认研究聚焦的变量范畴，而无法从该文献中得出具体的生物力学比较结果。
